chapter: What Has Been Related That Salat Is Not Accepted Without Purification
text:
the Prophet said: "Salat will not be accepted without purification, nor Charity from Ghulul."

Hannad said in his narration, "except with purification"

[Abu `Eisa said: This Hadith is the most correct thing on this topic, and the best. There are also narrations on this topic from Abu Al-Malih, from his father; and Abu Hurairah and Anas. And Abu Al-Malih bin Usamah's name is `Amir, and they also say it was Zaid bin Usamah bin `Umair Al-Hudhali.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Purification
text: Allah's Messenger said: "When a Muslim, or believer, performs Wudu', washing his face, every evil that he looked at with his eyes leaves with the water - or with the last drop of water, or an expression similar to that - and when he washes his hands, every evil he did with his hands leaves with the water - or with the last drop of water - until he becomes free of sin."

chapter: What Has been Related That The Key To Salat Is Purification
text: the Prophet, said: "The key to Salat is the purification, its Tahrlm is the Takblr, and its Tahlil is the Taslim."

chapter: What Has been Related That The Key To Salat Is Purification
narrated: Jabir bin 'Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them, narrated that
text: Allah's Messenger said: "The key to Paradise is Salat, and the key to Salat is Wudu'."

chapter: What Is Said When entering The Toilet
text: "When the Prophet entered the toilet he would say: 'O Allah Indeed I seek refuge in You.'" Shu'bah (one of the narrators) said: "Another time he said: 'I seek refuge in You from AI-Khubthi and al-Khablth.' Or: 'Al-Khubthi and Al-Khaba'ith.'"

chapter: What Is Said When entering The Toilet
text: "When the Prophet would enter the toilet 'He said: "O Allah! Indeed I seek refuge in You from Al-Khubith and Al- Khaba'ith."

chapter: What Is Said When Exiting The Toilet
narrated: 'Aishah, [may Allah be pleased with her] said
text: "When the Prophet would exit the toilet he would say: 'Ghufranak.'"

chapter: Regarding The Prohibition Of Facing The Qiblah When Defecating And Urinating.
text: Allah's Messenger said: "When one of you arrives to defecate, then let none of you face the Qiblah while defecating, nor while urinating. And do not have your back towards it, but have it east of you or west of you."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Permission for That
text: "The Prophet prohibited us from facing the Qiblah while urinating. Then i saw him facing it a year before he died."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Permission for That
text: he saw the Prophet urinating while facing the Qiblah. Qutaibah narrated that to us, he said: "Ibn Lahi'ah informed us." Jabir's Hadlth about the Prophet is more correct than the Hadith of Ibn Lahi'ah. Ibn Lahi'ah is weak according to the scholars of Hadith. He was graded weak by Yahya bin Sa'eed Al-Qattan, and others, [due to his memorization].

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Permission for That
text: "One day I climbed on Hafsah's house, and I saw the Prophet relieving himself while facing Ash-Sham, with his back toward the Ka'bah."

chapter: (What Has Been Related About) The Prohibition Of Urinating While Standing
text: "Whoever narrated to you that the Prophet would urinate while standing; then do not believe him. He would not urinate except while squatting." [He said:] There are narrations on this topic from Umar, Buraidah, [and Abdur-Rahman bin Hasanah].

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Permission For That
text: "Allah's Messenger came to a waste area used by people, so he urinated on it while standing. I brought him the (water for) Wudu. Then I left to be away from him, but he called me until I was behind him. So he performed Wudu and wiped (Masaba) over his Khuff."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Being Screened While Relieving Oneself
narrated: Anas, may Allah Most High be pleased with him, said
text: "When the Prophet  wanted to relieve  himself, he would not raise his garment until he was close to the ground."

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Use The Right Hand For Istinja.
narrated: Abdullah bin Abu Qatadah narrated from his father
text: "The Prophet prohibited that a man  should touch his penis with his right hand."

chapter: Using Stones For Al-Istinja
text: "They said to Salman, 'Your Prophet taught you about everything, even defecating?' So Salman said, 'Yes. He prohibited us from facing the Qiblah when defecating and urinating, performing Istinja with the right hand, using less than three stones for Istinja, and using dung or bones for Istinja"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Istinja With Two Stones
text: "Allah's Messenger went out to relieve himself. So he said: 'Bring me tree stones.'" He said, "So I came with two stones and a piece of dung. So he took the two stones, and left the dung. He said: 'It is Riks (a degenerative or filthy thing)."

chapter: What Has Been Related Regarding] What Is Disliked For One to use for Istinja
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Do not perform Istinja, with dung, nor with bones. For indeed it is provisions for your brothers among the Jinn."

chapter: [What Has Been Reported About] Istinja With Water
text: "Encourage your Husbands to clean themselves with water, for I am too shy of them, and Allah's Messenger would do that."

chapter: What Has Been Related That When The Prophet Wanted To Relieve Himself, He Would Go Far Away
text: I was with the Prophet on a journey. The Prophet had to relieve himself, so he went far away."

chapter: What Has Been Related That It Is Disliked To Urinate In The Washing Area
text: the Prophet  prohibited that a man should urinate in his bathing area. And he said: "It will only cause misgivings." [He said:] There are narrations on This topic from "a man from among the Companions of the Prophet."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Siwak
text: Allah's Messenger said: "If it were not that it would be difficult on my nation, then I would have ordered them to use the Siwak for each prayer."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Siwak
text: 'I heard Allah's Messenger saying: 'If it were not that it would be difficult on my nation then, I would have ordered them to use the Siwak for each prayer and to delay the Isha prayer until the third of the night.'"He [Abu Salamah, one of the narrators] said: Zaid bin Khalid wouId attend the prayer in the Masjid and his Siwak would be on his ear in the location of the pen on the ear of a writer. He would not get up to pray without cleaning his teeth, then returning it to its location."

chapter: What Has Been Related That When One Of You Awakens From His Sleep, Then Let Him Not Put His Hand Into Vessel Until He Washes it.
text: Prophet said: "When on of you awakens in the night, then let him not put his hand into the vessel until he has poured water on two times, or three times, for indeed he does not know where his hand has spent the night."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About The Tasmiyah When Performing Wudu
narrated: Rabah bin Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Sufyan bin Huwaitib narrated from his grandmother, from her father; she said (that he said)
text: "I heard Allah's Messenger saying: there is no Wudu for one who does not mention Allah's Name over it."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About The Tasmiyah When Performing Wudu
narrated: Rabah Bin Abdur-Rahman bin Abu Sufyan bin Huwaitib narrated
text: the same from his grandmother the daughter of Sa'eed bin Zaid, from her father, from the Prophet.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Al-Madmadah And AI-Istinshaq
text: Allah's Messenger said: "When you perform Wudu then sniff water in the nose and blow it out, and when you use small stones (to remove filth) then make it odd (numbered)."

chapter: Al-Madmadah And Istinshaq From One Handful
text: "1 saw the Prophet rinse his mouth and sniff water in his nose using one hand, he did that thrice,"

chapter: [What Has Been narrated] About Going through The Beard
text: "1 saw Ammar bin Yasir performing Wudu, so he went through his beard (with his hand). It was said to him" - or he said - "1 said: 'You go through your beard?' He said: 'And what is there to prevent me? Indeed I saw Allah's Messenger going through his beard.'"

chapter: [What Has Been narrated] About Going through The Beard
text: the same from the Prophet.

chapter: [What Has Been narrated] About Going through The Beard
text: the Prophet would go through his beard."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Wiping The Head, That It Is To Begin With The Front Of The Head To Its Rear.
text: "Allah's Messenger wiped over his head with his hands, going over the front with them and the rear. He began with the front of his head until they went to the nape of his neck. Then he brought them back again to the place where he began. Then he washed his feet."

chapter: What Has Been Related That It Is To Be Begun At The Rear Of The Head
narrated: Ar-Rubay' bint Mu'awwidh bin Afra' narrated
text: "The Prophet wiped his head two times: He began with the rear of his head, then with the front of his head and with both of his ears, outside and Inside of them."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Wiping The Head Once
narrated: Ar-Rubayy bint Mu'awidh bin Afra narrated that
text: she saw the Prophet performing Wudu. She  said: "He wiped his head, and  what is in the front of it and what is in its rear, and his temples and his ears one time."

chapter: What Has Been Related About One Taking New Water For (Wiping) His Head
text: he saw the Prophet performing Wudu, and that he wiped his head with water that was not left over from his hands.

chapter: [What Has Been Related About] Wiping The Outside And The Inside Of The Ears
text: "The Prophet wiped his head and his ears: the outside and the inside of them." ($ahih)

chapter: What Has Been Related That The Ears Are Part Of The Head
text: "The Prophet performed Wudu; so he washed his face three times, and his hands three times, and wiped his head, and he said: "The ears are part of the head."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Going Between The Fingers
narrated: Asim bin Laqit bin Sabirah narrated from his father that
text: the Prophet Muhammad said: "When performing Wudu go between the fingers."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Going Between The Fingers
text: Allah's Messenger said: "When performing Wudu go between the fingers of your hands and (toes of) your feet."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Going Between The Fingers
text: "I saw the Prophet when he was performing Wudu doing that to the toes on his feet with his pinky."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: "Protect The Heels From The Fire."
text: the Prophet said: "Protect the heels from the Fire!"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Wudu' One Time (For Each Limb)
text: "The Prophet performed Wudu one time (for each limb)."

chapter: What Has Been Reported About Wudu Two Times (For Each Limb)
text: "The Prophet performed Wudu two time (for each limb)."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Wudu Three times (For Each Limb)
text: "The Prophet performed Wudu three times (for each limb)."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Wudu One Time, Two Times And Three Times
text: "I asked Abu Ja'far: 'Did Jabir narrate to you that: "The Prophet performed Wudu one time each, and two times, and three times?" He said: "Yes."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Wudu One Time, Two Times And Three Times
text: "1 asked Abu Ja'far: 'Did Jabir narrate to you that: "The Prophet performed Wudu one time each?" He said: "Yes."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About One Who performs Some Of Wudu, Two Times Each, And Some Of It Three
text: "The Prophet performed Wudu. So he washed his face three times, and washed his hands two times each, and wiped his head, and washed his feet [two times]."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About The Wudu Of he Prophet: How Was It Performed?
text: "I saw Ali performing Wudu. He washed his hands until he cleaned them, then he rinsed out his mouth three times, sniffed water into his nose and blew it out three times, washed his face three times, and his forearms three times. He wiped his head once, then he washed his feet up to the ankles. Then he stood up, taking what was left over from his purification (water) and drank it while he was standing. Then he said, 'I wanted to show you how Allah's Messenger purified himself.'"

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About The Wudu Of he Prophet: How Was It Performed?
narrated: Abd Khair related a narration similar to that of Abu Hayyah,
text: from Ali (no. 48). Except that Abd Khair's version includes the following additions: "When he was finished from his purification, he would take what was left over from his purification with his hand to drink it."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About An-Nadh After Wudu
text: the Prophet said: "Jibril came to me and he said: 'O Muhammad! When you perform wudu then perform Nadh.'"

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Performing Wudu Perfectly And Completely (Isbagh AI-Wudu)
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Shall I tell you that for which Allah will wipe out your sins, and raise your ranks?" They said, "Of course Allah's Messenger!" He said:  "Performing Wudu well in difficulty, and taking many steps to the Masajid, and waiting for Salat after Salat, That is the Ribat."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Performing Wudu Perfectly And Completely (Isbagh AI-Wudu)
text: "For that is the Ribat, that is the Ribat, that is the Ribat" three times.

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Using a Towel after Wudu
text: "Allah's Messenger had a cloth that he would use to dry off with after Wudu."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Using a Towel after Wudu
text:
"I saw the Prophet when he performed Wudu, he wiped his face with the edge of his garment."  Abu Eisa said: This Hadith is gharib, and its chain is weak. Rishdin bin Sa'd and Abdur- Rahman bin Ziyad bin An'um Al Ifriqi [narrators in the chain of this Hadith] are weak in Hadith. Some people of knowledge among the Companions of the Prophet  and those after them, permitted using a towel after Wudu. 
Those who disliked it, only disliked it from the view of the saying: "Wudu is weighed." That as reported from Sa'eed bin Al- Musayyab and Az-Zuhri. Muhammad bin Humaid [Ar-Razi] narrated to us, Jarir narrated to us,  he said: Ali bin Mujahid narrated to me, and he is trustworthy to me, from me, from: Tha'labah from Az-Zuhri, he said: "The towel is only disliked after Wudu because Wudu is weighed."

chapter: [About] What Is Said After Wudu
text: Allah's Messenger said: 'Whoever performs Wudu, making Wudu well, then says: (Ashhadu an la ilaha illallah, wahdahu la sharika lahu, wa ashhadu anna Muhammadan-abduhu wa rasuluhu, Allahummajalni minat tawwabin, waj'alni minal mutatahhirin) 'I testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah Alone, there are no partners for Him. And I testify that Muhammad is His servant and Messenger. O Allah! Make me among the repentant, and make me among those who purify themselves.' Then eight gates of Paradise are opened for him, that may enter by whichever of them wishes."

chapter: On Wudu With A Mudd
text: "The Prophet would perform Wudu with a Mudd, and he would perform Ghusl with a Sa."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About It Being Disliked To Be Wasteful With Water During Wudu
text: the Prophet said: "Indeed there is a Shaitan for Wudu' who is called "AI-Walahan." So beware of having misgivings about water."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Performing Wudu For Every Salat
text: "The Prophet would perform wudu for every Salat, whether he was in state of purity or not in a state of purity."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Performing Wudu For Every Salat
narrated: It has been related in a narration from Ibn Umar that
text: the Prophet said: "Whoever performs Wudu while in a state of purity, Allah writes for him on account of it ten good merits."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Performing Wudu For Every Salat
narrated: Amr bin Amir Al-Ansari narrated that he heard Anas bin Malik saying
text: "The Prophet would perform Wudu for every Salat." I said, "So what about you, what would you do?" He said I wouId pray all of the prayers with one Wudu, as long as we had not committed Hadath (anything that invalidates Wudu)."

chapter: What Had Been Related About Performing The (Five Obligatory) Prayers With One Wudu
narrated: Sulaiman bin Buraidah narrated that his father said
text: "The Prophet would perform Wudu for every Salat. So during the year of the Conquest, he performed all of the prayers with one Wudu, and he wiped over his Khuff. So Umar said, 'You did something that you have not done before?' He replied: "I did it on purpose."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Man And A Woman Performing Wudu From One Vessel
text: "I and Allah's Messenger would perform Ghusl for Janabah from one vessel."

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Use The Leftover Water Of A Woman
narrated: Abu Hajib narrated from a man from Banu Ghifar who said
text: "The Prophet prohibited using the leftover (water) of a woman's Purification."

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Use The Leftover Water Of A Woman
narrated: A1-Hakim bin Amr AI-Ghifari narrated that
text: "The Prophet forbade that a man should perform Wudu with the leftover (water) from a woman's purifcation." Or, he said: "from her drinking."

chapter: [What has Been Related] About Permitting That
text: "One of the wives of the Prophet performed Ghusl with a bowl. Allah's Messenger wanted to perform Wudu with it, so she said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Indeed I am ]unub.' So he said: 'Indeed, water does not become Junub.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About: Nothing Makes Water Impure
text: "It was said, 'O Allah's Messenger! Shall we use the water of Buda'ah well to perform ablution while it is a well in which menstruation rags, flesh of dogs and the putrid are dumped?" Allah's Messenger said: 'Indeed water is pure, nothing makes it impure.'"

chapter: Something Else For That
text: "I heard AlIah's Messenger while he was being asked about water in open areas of the land, and predators and beasts come to it." He said: 'So Allah's Messenger said: 'When the water is two Qullah it does not carry filth.'"

chapter: [What Has Been Related About] It Is Disliked Urinate In Stagnant Water
text: the Prophet said: "Let none of you urinate [in still water, then perform Wudu with it."1

chapter: What Has Been Related About Sea Water, That It Is Pure
text: "A man asked Allah's Messenger 'O Messenger of Allah! We sail the seas, and we only carry a little water with us. If we use it for Wudu then we will go thirsty. So shall we perform Wudu from the (water of the) sea?' Allah's Messenger said: 'Its water is pure, and its dead are lawful.'"

chapter: Severe Warning Against Not Shielding Oneself From Urine
text: "The Prophet passed by two graves. He said: 'These two are being punished. And they are not being punished for something major. As for this one, he would not protect himself from his urine. As for this one, he used to spread Namimah (slander).'"

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Sprinkling Water On The Urine Of Young Boy Before (He reaches The Age That) He Eats Food
text: "I entered upon the Prophet with a son of mine who was not yet eating food. He urinated on him, so he called for water which he sprinkled over it."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Urine Of That Whose Meat Is Eaten
text: "Some people from Urainah arrived in Al-Madinah, and they were uncomfortable (and ill from the climate). So Allah's Messenger sent them some camels from charity. He told them: "Drink from their milk and urine." So they killed the camel driver that Allah's Messenger sent, and they violently drove off the camels, and apostatized from Islam. So the Prophet came to them, he cut off their hands and feet on opposite side, and branded their eyes, and threw them in Al-Harrah." Anas said, "So I saw one of them working over the ground with his mouth, until they died."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Urine Of That Whose Meat Is Eaten
text:
"Allah's Messenger only poked out their eyes because they had poked out the eyes of the camel driver." Abu 'Eisa said: This Hadfth is Gharib. We do not know anyone who mentioned it other than this shaikh, from Yazid bin Zurai. And it is in accordance with the meaning of Allah's saying: 
"And wounds equal for equal"
It has been reported that Muhammad bin Sirin said: "The Prophet only did this to them before the legislated punishments were revealed."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Wudu For Breaking Wind
text: Allah's Messenger said: "There no Wudu except for a sound or a smell."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Wudu For Breaking Wind
text: Allah's Messenger said: "When one of you is in the Masjid, and he senses wind between his buttocks then he should not exit until he hears a sound or smells an odor."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Wudu For Breaking Wind
text: the Prophet said: "Indeed Allah does not accept the prayer of one of you when he commits Hadath, until he performs Wudu."

chapter: [What Has Been Reported] About Wudu From Sleep
text: he saw the Prophet sleeping, while in the prostration position, until he snored or snorted. Then he stoodup to pray. So I said: "O Messenger of Allah! You were sleeping?" He said: "Wudu is not required except for sleeping while reclining. For when one reclines, joints relax."

chapter: [What Has Been Reported] About Wudu From Sleep
text: "The companions of Allah's Messenger would sleep, then stand to pray, They would not perform Wudu."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Wudu From What Has Been Altered By Fire
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Wudu is (required) from what fire has touched, even if it be a piece of cheese."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Not Performing Wudu For What Has Been Altered By Fire
text: "Allah's Messenger went out and I went with him. He entered upon a woman from the Ansar. She slaughtered a sheep and he ate from it; and she brought a basket with ripe dates and he ate from it. Then he performed Wudu for Zuhr and prayed. Then he finished, so she brought him something from the remainder of the sheep. So he ate it, then prayed Asr and did not perform Wudu."

chapter: [What Has Been Related About] Wudu From Camel Meat
text: Allah's Messenger was asked about performing Wudu for camel meat. He said: "Perform Wudu for it." He Was asked about Wudu after eating goat meat. So he said: "Do not perform Wudu for it."

chapter: Wudu For Touching The Penis
text: the Prophet said: "Whoever touches his penis, then he is not to pray until he performs Wudu"

chapter: Wudu For Touching The Penis
text: a similar report (as no. 82) from the Prophet.

chapter: Wudu For Touching The Penis
text: the Prophet said a similar Hadith

chapter: [What Has Been Related About] Not Performing Wudu For Touching The Penis
narrated: Qais bin Talq bin Ali - [and he is] Al-Hanafi narrated from his father, that
text: the Prophet said: 'Is it other than a piece of his flesh?" Or: "part of him?"

chapter: [What Has Been Related About] Not Performing Wudu For Kissing
text: "The Prophet kissed one of his wives, then he went to the prayer and did not perform Wudu."  He (Urwah) said: "I said 'Who was it except you?'" [He said:] "So she laughed."

chapter: [What Has Been Related About] Wudu For Vomit And Nosebleeds
narrated: Madan bin Abi Talhah narrated from Abu Ad-Darda that
text: "Allah's Messenger vomited [so he broke fast] so he performed Wudu." So I met Thawban in a Masjid in Damascus, and I mentioned that to him. He said: 'He told the truth, I poured the water for his Wudu."

chapter: [What Has Been Related About] Wudu' With Nabidh
text: "The Prophet asked me: "What is in your Idawah (water skin)?" I said: "Nabidh." He said: "Dates are wholesome and water is pure." He said: "So he performed Wudu with it."

chapter: [About] Rinsing Out The Mouth After Drinking Milk
text:
the Prophet drank milk. Then he called for water to rinse out his mouth. Then he said: "Indeed it has fat." [He said:] There are narrations on this topic from Sahl bin Sa'd As-Sa'idi and Umm Salamah. 
Abu Eisa said: [And] this Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
Some of the people of knowledge held the view that one is to wash the mouth after drinking milk and this is recommended according us. Some others did not hold the view that one is to wash out the mouth after drinking milk.

chapter: It Is Disliked To Retum The Salam If One Does Not Have Wudu
text: "A man greeted the Prophet (with Salam), and he was urinating, so he did not respond to him."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Leftover Water A Dog Has Drank From
text: the Prophet said: "Wash the vessel the dog has drunk from seven times: the first or the last of them with dirt. And when the cat drinks out of it, wash it once."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Leftover Water A Cat Has Drunk From
narrated: Humaidah bint Ubaid bin Rifa'ah narrated
text: "Kabshah bint Ka'b bin Malik - she was (married) with Ibn Abi Qatadah - narrated "That Abu Qatadah visited her, [so she said:] 'So I poured water for him to use for Wudu.' She said: 'A cat came to drink, so he lowered he container until it drank.' Kabshah said: 'So he saw me looking at it and said, "O my niece! Are you surprised at that?" So I said yes. He said: "Indeed Allah's  Messenger said 'It is not impure, it is only one of those roam around among you.'"

chapter: [About] Wiping Over The Two Khuff
text: "Jarir bin Abdullah urinated, then he performed Wudu, wiping over his Khuff. So he was asked, 'You do this?' He replied, 'What prevents me, when I have seen Allah's Messenger doing it?" He [Ibrahim] said "And they were impressed by the narration of Jarir since he accepted Islam after the revelation Sural Al-Ma'idah." [This is the saying of lbrahim, that is, "They were impressed."] [He said:] There are narrations on this topic from Umar, Ali, Hudhaifah, AI-Mughirah, Bilil, Sa'd, Abu Ayyub, Salman, Buraidah, Amr bin Umayyah, Anas, Sahl bin Sa'd, Ya'la bin Murrah, Ubadah bin As-Samit, Usamah bin Shank, Abu Umamah, Jabir, Usamah bin Zaid, and Ibn Ubadah. They call him Ibn Imarah and Ubayy bin Imarah.

chapter: [About] Wiping Over The Two Khuff
narrated: It has been related from Sahr bin Hawshah that he said
text:
"I saw Jarir bin 'Abdullah performing Wudu and he wiped over his Khuff. I asked him about that. He replied, 'I saw 'I saw Allah's Messenger performing Wudu and he wiped over his Khuff.' So I said to him, before Surah AI-Ma'idah (was revealed) or after AI-Ma'idah?' So he replied, 'I did not acceot Islam until after Al-Ma'idah.'" Qutaibah narrated this to us; (saying) Khalid bin Ziyad At-Tirmidhi narrated it to us, from Muqatil bin Hayyan, from Shahr bin Hawshah, from Jarir.
He said: Baqiyyah related it from Ibrahim bin Adham from Muqatil bin Hayyan, from Shahr bin Hawshah, from Jarir.
This Hadith is explanatory, because some who dislike wiping over the Khuff give the interpretation that the Prophet's wiping over the two Khuff was before the revelation of Sural Al-Ma'idah. But in his Hadlth, Jarir mentions that he saw the Prophet wiping over his Khuff after the revelation of Surat Al-Ma'idah.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Wiping Over The Two Khuff For The Traveler and the Resident
text: "The Prophet was asked about wiping over the Khuff.  So he said: "Three (days) for the traveler, and one day for the resident."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Wiping Over The Two Khuff For The Traveler and the Resident
text: 'When we were traveling, Allah's Messenger would order us not to remove our Khuff for three days and nights, except for Janabah, but not for defecating, urinating, and sleep."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Wiping Over he Khuff: The Top Of It And The Bottom Of It
text: "The Prophet wiped over the Khuff and its bottom."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Wiping Over The Khuff, Their Tops
text: "I saw the Prophet wiping over the Khuff: on the tops of them."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Wiping Over Tbe Socks And The Sandals
text: "The Prophet performed Wudu' and wiped over his socks and sandals."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Wiping Over The Imamah
narrated: Ibn Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah narrated from his father
text: "The Prophet performed Wudu and wiped over the Khuff and 'Imamah." Abu Bakr (one of the narrators) said: "And indeed I heard it from Ibn Al Mughirah."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Wiping Over The Imamah
text: "The Prophet wiped over the Khuff and the Khimar."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Wiping Over The Imamah
narrated: Abu Ubaidah bin Muttammad bin Ammar bin Yasir said
text: "I asked Jabir bin Abdullah about wiping over the Khuff. He said, 'O my nephew! It is the Sunnah.'" [He said:] "And I asked him about wiping over the lmamah. He said, '[Wipe1 the hair [with water].'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Ghusl For Janabah
narrated: Ibn 'Abbas narrated that his maternal aunt Maimunah said
text: "I prepared some water for the Prophet to perform Ghusl for Janabah with. So he turned the vessel with his left hand, (pouring some water) over his right. Then he washed his hands. Then he entered his hand into the vessel to pour water over his private area, then he rubbed his hands on the wall, or the ground. Then he rinsed out his mouth and washed his nose by putting water in and blowing it out, and washed his face and forearms. Then he poured water over his head three times, then he poured water over the remainder of his body, then he moved from where he was and washed his feet."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Ghusl For Janabah
text: "When AlIah's Messenger wanted to perform Ghusl for Janabah, he would begin by washing his hands before putting them into the vessel. Then he would wash his private area, and perform the Wudu (as one does) for Salat. Then he would wet his hair with the water, then he would pour water over his head with his hands three times."

chapter: Should A Woman Undo Her Hair For Ghusl?
text: "I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I am woman with tight braids on my head, should I undo it to perform Ghusl for Janabah? He said: 'No. It is sufficient that you only pour three scoops of water (with hands held together) over your head, then pour water over the rest of your body, to be purified.'" Or he said: "Then you will be purified."

chapter: What Has Been Related About "Under Each Hair Is Sexual Impurity."
text: the Prophet said: "Under every hair is sexual impurity so wash (all of) the hair and cleanse the skin."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Wudu' After Ghusl
text: "The Prophet would not perform Wudu after the Ghusl."

chapter: What Has Been Related: When The Two Circumcised Organs Meet, Ghusl Is Required.
text: "When the circumcised meets the circumcised, then indeed Ghusl is required. Myself and Allah's Messenger did that, so we performed Ghusl."

chapter: What Has Been Related: When The Two Circumcised Organs Meet, Ghusl Is Required.
text: the Prophet said: "When the circumcised meets the circumcised then Ghusl is required."

chapter: What Has Been Related That 'Water Is For Water'
text: "Water is for water,' was only permitted in the beginning of Islam. Then it was prohibited."

chapter: What Has Been Related That 'Water Is For Water'
text: a similar narration (as Hadith no. 110) from, Az-Zuhri, with this chain.

chapter: What Has Been Related That 'Water Is For Water'
text: "Water is for water' is only about the wet dream."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About One Who Awakens To Find Wetness, But He Does Not Recall Having A Wet Dream
text: "The Prophet was asked about a man who finds wetness and he does not remember having a wet dream. So he said: 'He is to perform Ghusl. And (he was asked) about a man who had a wet dream but does not find any wetness, so he said: 'No Ghusl is required of him.' Umm Salamah said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Is the woman required to perform Ghusl if she sees that?' He replied: 'Yes. Indeed women are the partners of men.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Al-Mani And Al-Madhi
text: "I asked the Prophet about Al-Madhi. He said: "For Al-Madhi is Wudu, and for AI-Mani is Ghusl."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Al-Madhi That Touches The Garment
text: "I suffered from a severe and troubling case of Al-Madhi. I was performing Ghusl often because of it. So I mentioned that to Allah's Messenger and asked him about it. He said: "You only need to perform Wudu for that." I said: "O Messenger of Allah! How about when it gets on my clothes?" He said: "It is sufficient for you to take a handful of water and sprinkle it n your garment wherever you see that it has touched it."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About AI-Mani That Touches The Garment
text: "Aishah had a guest to whom she lent a yellow wrap for him to sleep in. He had a wet dream, and was too embarrassed to send it to her while the traces of the wet dream were present on it. So he submerged it (washing it) in water, then he sent it to her. Aishah said, "Why did he ruin our garment? It would have been sufficient for him to scrape it off with his fingers. Sometimes I would scrape it off of the garment of Allah's Messenger with my fingers."

chapter: Washing AI-Mani From The Garment
narrated: Sulaiman bin Yasar narrated from Aishah, that
text: she washed Mani from the garment of Allah's Messenger.

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About The Person Who Is Junub Sleeping Before performing Ghusl
text: "Allah's Messenger would sleep while he was Junub, and without touching water (performing Ghusl)."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About The Person Who Is Junub Sleeping Before performing Ghusl
text: There is a similar report (as no. 1I8) narrated via Abu Ishaq.

chapter: : [What Has Been Related] About Wudu For The Person Who Is Junub When He Wants To Sleep
text: he asked the Prophet: "Can one of us sleep while he is Junub?" So he replied: "Yes, when he performs Wudu."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Shaking Hands With The Junub Person
text: the Prophet met him while he was Junub. He said: "[So I slipped away from him - meaning:] I withdrew - to perform Ghusl. Then he returned, so he said: 'Where have you been?' Or: 'Where did you go?' I replied: 'I was Junub.' So he said: 'Indeed the believer is not defiled.'''

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Woman Who Sees In A Dream, Similar To What A Man Sees
text: Umm Sulaim bint Milhan came to the Prophet and she said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Indeed Allah is not embarrassed of the truth. So is it required of a woman - meaning Ghusl - when she sees in her sleep similar to what a man sees?' He replied: 'Yes. When she finds water (wetness), then she is perform Ghusl.'" Umm Salamah said: "I said to her: 'O Umm SuIaim! You have disgraced the women!'"

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About The Man Who Seeks The Warmth Of A Woman After Performing Ghusl
text: "Sometimes the Prophet would perform Ghusl from Janabah then come to seek warmth from me, he would hold me and not perform Ghusl."

chapter: [What has Been Related] About Tayammum For The Junub Person When He Does Not Find Water
text: AlIah's Messenger said: "Pure clean earth is a purifier for the Muslim; even if he did not find water for ten years. Then if he finds water, then let him use it (for purification) on his skin. For, that is better."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Al-Mustahadah
text: "Fatimah bint Abi-Hubaish came to the Prophet and said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I am a woman who suffers from persistent bleeding and I do not become clean. Shall I give up Salat?' He said: 'No. That is only a bIood vessel, it is not menstruation. When your menstruation begins then leave the Salat. And when it ends, then wash the blood from you and perform Salat."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Mustahadah Performing Wudu For Every Prayer
narrated: Adiyy bin Thabit narrated from his father, that
text: the Prophet said about the Mustahadah that she should: "Leave the Salat for the days of her period which she menstruates in, then perform Ghusl, and perform Wudu for every Salat, and observe Saum and perform Salat."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Mustahadah Performing Wudu For Every Prayer
text:
Abu Eisa said: Sharik is alone in narrating this Hadith from Abu Al Yaqzan.[He said:] I asked Muhammad (ibn Isma'il AI-Bukhari) about this Hadlth. I said: "Adiyy bin Thabit from his father, from his grandfather; what is the name of Adiyy's grandfather?" But Muhammad did not know his name. And I mentioned to Muhammad that Yahya bin Ma'in said his name is Dinar, and he did not contradict him.
Ahmad and 1shaq said ahout the Mustahadah: If she performs Ghusl for every prayer that is more prudent for her, and if she performs Wudu for each prayer, then that is acceptable from her, and if she combines between two prayers with (one) Ghusl then that is acceptable.

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About AI-Mustahadah That She Can Combine Two Prayers With One Ghusl
text: "I had a case of blood flow that was severe and excessive. So I went to the Prophet to inform him and ask him about it. I found him in the house of my sister Zainab bint Jahsh. I said, 'O Messenger of Allah! I suffer from a case of severe and excessive blood flow. So what do you order me to do for it, and does this prevent me from fasting and performing Salat?' He said: 'Tie a cotton rag around yourself and the bIood will go away.' I said, 'It is more than that.' He said: 'Make it tight.' I said, 'It is more than that.' He said: 'Then use a cloth (to bind it).' I said, it is more than that. It flows too much.' So the Prophet said: 'I will order you to do one of two things, which ever of them you do, it will be acceptable for you. You should know which of them you are able to do.' Then he said: 'This is only a blow from Shaitan. Menstruate for six or seven days, which Allah knows, then perform Ghusl. When you see that you have become pure and clean, then perform Salat for twenty-three or twenty-four nights and their days. Perform Salat and fast, and that will be acceptable for you. So do this (if you can) just as (other) women who menstruate and become pure during their periods of menstruation and purity. If (not, and) you are able to delay Zuhr and hasten Asr then perform Ghusl when you have become pure, and pray Zuhr and Asr together. Then delay Maghrib and hasten Isha, then perform Ghusl and combine the two prayers. So do this (if you are able). Then perform Ghusl with the dawn and pray. Do this, and fast if you are able to do so.' Then Allah's Messenger said: 'That is what is preferable to me of the two.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Al-Mustahadah That She Is To Perform Ghusl For Every Salat
text: "Umm Habibah hint Jahsh sought a verdict from Allah's Messenger. She said 'I suffer from persistent bleeding such that I do not become pere. Shall I give up the Salat?' He said: 'No, that is only a blood vessel. So perform Ghusl then pray.' So she would perform Ghusl for each prayer."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Menstruating Woman: That She Does Not Make Up The Missed Salat
text: a woman asked Aishah: "Shouldn't one of us make up her prayers the days of her menstruation?" So she said, "Are you one of the Haruriyyah? Indeed we would menstruate, and we were not ordered to make up."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Junub And The Menstruating Persons That They Do Not Recite The Qur'an
text: the Prophet said: "The menstruating woman does not recite - nor the Junub - anything from the Qur'an."  [He said:] There is narration on this topic from Ali

chapter: What Has Been Related About Fondling Menstruating Woman
text: "When I would menstruate, Allah's Messenger ordered me to wear a waist wrap, then he would fondle me."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Eating With A Menstruating Woman And Leftovers
text: I asked the Prophet about eating with a menstruating woman. He said: "Eat with her."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Menstruating Woman Getting Something From The Masjid
text: "Allah's Messenger said to me: 'Bring me the Khumrah from the Masjid.' She said: "I said: 'I am menstruating.' He said: 'Indeed your menstruation is not in your hand.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Dislike For Engaging In Sexual Intercourse With A Menstruating Woman
text: the Prophet said: "Whoever engages in sexual intercourse with a menstruating woman, or a woman in her anus, consults a soothsayer, then he has disbelieved in what was revealed to Muhammad."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Atonement For That
text: the Prophet said about a man who had sexual intercourse with his wife while she is menstruating: "He should give half a Dinar in charity."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Atonement For That
text: the Prophet said: "When the blood is red then (give) a Dinar. And when the blood is yellow then half Dinar."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Washing Menstrual Blood From The Garment
narrated: Asma' bint Abu Bakr narrated that
text: a woman asked the Prophet about a garment that was touched by some menstrual blood. So Allah's Messenger said: "Remove it, and scrub it, then rinse it and pray in it"

chapter: What Has Been Related About the Extent Of The Waiting During Nifas
text: "The time of waiting for Nifas during the time of AIlah's Messenger was forty days. We used to cover our faces with reddish-brown Wars."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Man Going To All Of His Women With One Ghusl
text: "Allah's Messenger would go around to his women with one Ghusl."

chapter: What Has Been Related [About The Junub Person] When He Wants To Repeat (Sexual Relations) He Should Perform Wudu
text: the Prophet said: When one of you comes to his wife, then he wants to repeat (it), let him perform Wudu between them."

chapter: What Has Been Related About When Standing For The Prayer, And One Of You Finds That He Has To Relieve Himself, [Then Let Him Relieve Himself First].
narrated: Hisham bin Urwah narrated from his father, (Urwah) from Abdullah bin AI-Arqam.
text: He (Urwah) said: "While standing for the prayer he (Abdullah bin Al-Arqam) took a man by the hand leading him forward, he (Abdullah) was in front of the people, and he said: 'I heard Allah's Messenger say: "When standing for the prayer and one of you finds that he has to relieve himself then let him relieve himself first."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Wudu Due To What One Has Walked In
narrated: Abdur-Rahman bin Awf's Umm Walad said,
text: "I said to Umm Salamah: 'Indeed I am a woman with lengthy hems, and I walk in places of filth.' So she said: 'Allah's Messenger said: "It is purified by what comes after it."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Tayammum
text: the Prophet ordered him to perform Tayammum by rubbing his face and two palms.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Tayammum
text: Ibn Abbas was asked ahout Tayammum. He said: "When Allah mentioned Wudu in His Book, He said: "So wash your faces and your hands (forearms) up to the elbows." And He said about Tayammum: "And rub therewith your faces and hands" And He said: "And the male thief and the female thief; cut off their hands." So the Sunnah for cutting is the two hands. So it is only the face and the hands, meaning, Tayammum."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Man Reciting The Qur'an Under Any Circumstances As Long As He Is Not Junub
text: "Allah's Messenger would recite the Qur'an in all conditions, as long as he was not Junub."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Urine That Touches The Ground
text: "A Bedouin entered the Masjid while the Prophet was sitting. He prayed, then when he was finished, he said: 'O Allah! Have mercy upon me and Muhammad, and do not have mercy on anyone along with us.' The Prophet turned, towards him and said: 'You have restricted something that is unrestricted.' It was not long before he was urinating in the Masjid. So the people rushed to him. But Prophet said: 'Pour a bucket of water over it - or - a tumbler of water over it.' Then he said: 'You have been sent to make things easy (for the people); you have not been sent to make things difficult for them.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Urine That Touches The Ground
narrated: Anas bin Malik narrated similar to this (no. 147).
text: [He said:] There are narrations on this topic from 'Abdullah bin Mas'ud, Ibn Abbas, and Wathilah bin AI-Asqa.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Prescribed Times for Salat From The Prophet
text: the Prophet said: "Jibril (peace be upon him) led me (in Salat) twice at the House. So he prayed Zuhr the first time when the shadow was similar to (the length of) the strap a sandal. Then he prayed Asr when everything was similar (to the length of) its shadow. Then he prayed Maghrib when the sun had set and the fasting person breaks fast. Then he prayed Isha when the twilight had vanished. Then he prayed Fajr when Fajr (dawn) began, and when eating is prohibited for the fasting person. The second time he prayed Zuhr when the shadow of everything was similar to (the length of) it, at the time of Asr the day before. Then he prayed Asr when the shadow of everything was about twice as long as it. Then he prayed Maghrib at the same time as he did the first time. Then he prayed Isha, the later one, when a third of the night had gone. Then he prayed Subh when the land glowed. Then Jibril turned towards me and said: "O Muhammad! These are the times of the Prophets before you, and the (best) time is what is between these two times."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Prescribed Times for Salat From The Prophet
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Jibril led me (in Salat)". He mentioned something similar to the Hadith of Ibn Abbas (no. 149) in meaning, but he did not mention: "At the time of Asr the day before."

chapter: Something else (about the timings of Salat)
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Indeed for (the time of) Salat (there is a) beginning and an end. The beginning of the time for the Zuhr prayer is when the sun passes the zenith, and the end of its time is when the time for Asr enters. The beginning of the time for the Asr [prayer] is when its time enters, and the end of its time is when the sun yellows (turns pale). The beginning of the time of Maghrib is when the sun as set, and the end of its time is when the twilight has vanished (i.e., the horizon is invisible because of darkness). The beginning of the time for Isha, the later one, is when the horizon has vanished, and the end of its time is when the night is at its half. The beginning of the time for Fajr is when Fajr begins, and its end is when the sun rises."

chapter: Something else
narrated: Sulaiman bin Buraidah narrated that his father said
text: "A man came to the Prophet to ask him about the times for Salat. So he said: 'Stay with us, In sha Allah.' So he ordered Bilal to call the Iqamah when Fajr began, then he ordered him to call the Iqamah when the Sun passed the zenith, then he prayed Zuhr. Then he ordered him to call the Iqamah to pray Asr while the sun was elevated and white. Then he ordered him (to call the Iqamah for) Maghrib when the (top) edge of the sun had set. Then he ordered him to call the Iqamah for Isha when the horizon (twilight) had vanished. Then he ordered him in the morning (to give the call for Fajr prayer), when the light of Fajr glowed. Then he ordered (him to call the Iqamah for) Zuhr, so he waited well until it had cooled. Then he ordered (him to call the Iqamah for) Asr, so he calIed the Iqamah while the sun was later in its position than what it was (the day before). Then he ordered him to delay Maghrib until right before the twilight had disappeared. Then he ordered (him to call the Iqamah for) Isha, so he called the Iqamah when a third of the night had passed. Then he said: 'Where is the one who asked about he times for the Salat?' So the man said, 'It is I.' So he said: 'The times [or the Salat are what are between these two.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Praying Fajr In The Dark
text: "Allah's Messenger would pray Subh (at such time that) the women would leave (after the prayer)" - AI-AnsarI (one of the narrators) said - the women would pass by wrapped in their Mirts and they would not be recognizable due to the darkness." And Qutaibah said: "covered." (instead of "wrapped.")

chapter: What Has Been Related About Al-Isfar In Fajr
text: "I heard Allah's Messenger saying: 'Perform Fajr at AI-Isfar, for indeed its reward is greater.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Hastening Zuhr
text: "I have not seen anyone who hastened Zuhr more than Allah's Messenger nor Abu Bakr, nor Umar."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Hastening Zuhr
text: "Allah's Messenger prayed Zuhr when the sun had passed the zenith."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Delaying Zuhr In Severe Heat
text: Allah's Messenger said: "In very hot weather, delay the (Zuhr) prayer until it becomes (a bit) cooler, because the severity of heat is from the raging of the Hell."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Delaying Zuhr In Severe Heat
text: "Allah's Messenger was on a journey and Bilal was with him. So he wanted to call for the prayer, but he (the Prophet) said: 'Let it get cooler.' Then he wanted to call for the prayer, so Allah's Messenger said: 'Let it get to the cooler time of Zuhr.'" He (i.e., Abu Dharr) said: "Until we saw the shadows of the hillocks, then he commanded that the Iqamah be called and then led the people in prayer. Allah's Messenger said: 'The severity of heat is from the raging of Hell, so wait until it becomes cooler for the (Zuhr) prayer.'"

chapter: : What Has Been Related About Hastening Asr Prayer
text: "Allah's Messenger prayed Asr while the sun was (shining) in her chamber, (and) no shadow appeared in her chamber."

chapter: : What Has Been Related About Hastening Asr Prayer
text: he visited Anas bin Malik in his home in Al Basrah after finishing Zuhr, and his home was next to the Masjid. So he said: 'Stand to pray Asr." He (Al-Ala) said: "So we stood to pray. When we were finished he (Anas) said: 'I heard Allah's Messenger saying: "That is the prayer of the hypocrite. He sits watching the sun, until when it is between the horns of the Shaitan he stands and pecks out four (units of prayer), not remembering Allah in them but a little."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Delaying The Asr Prayer
text: "Allah's Messenger would hasten Zuhr more than you (people), while you (people) hasten Asr more than him."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Delaying The Asr Prayer
text: [And I have in my book: "Ali bin Hujr informed me from lsma'il bin Ibrahim, from Ibn Juraij."]

chapter: What Has Been Related About Delaying The Asr Prayer
narrated: Similar narration is reported by Bishr ibn Mu'adh Al-Bari who said that
text: Isma'il ibn Ulayyah narrated to him from Ibn Juraij. This latter chain is more correct.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Time For Maghrib
text: "Allah's Messenger prayed Maghrib when the sun had set and it (the sun) had hidden in the veil (of darkness)."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Time For The Last Isha Prayer
text: "I am the most knowledgeable among the people about the prescribed time of this prayer: Allah's Messenger would pray it when the moon set on the third (of the month)."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Time For The Last Isha Prayer
text: A similar narration (from another chain linking to) this chain is also reported.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Delaying The Last Isha Prayer
text: Allah's Messenger said: "If it were not that it would be a hardship on my Ummah, then I would have ordered you to delay Isha until the third of the night, or its half."

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Sleep Before Isha And To Talk During The Night After It
text: "The Prophet would dislike to sleep before Isha and to talk after it."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Permitting Talk After Isha
text: "Allah's Messenger would talk during the night with Abu Bakr about matters concerning the Muslims while I was with them."

chapter: Virtue Of Performing Salat at the Beginning Of Its Prescribed Time
narrated: Umm Farwah - and she was one of those who gave pledge of allegiance to the Prophet  - narrated
text: "The Prophet was asked: 'Which deed is the best?' So he said: 'Salat in the beginning of its time.'"

chapter: Virtue Of Performing Salat at the Beginning Of Its Prescribed Time
narrated: Ali bin AbI Talib narrated that
text: the Prophet said to him: 'Ali! Three are not to be delayed: Salat when its time comes, a funeral whet it (a prepared body) is present, and the (marriage of a) single woman when there is an equal for her."

chapter: Virtue Of Performing Salat at the Beginning Of Its Prescribed Time
text: Allah's Messenger said: "The beginning of the time for Salat is pleasing to Allah, and the end of its time is pardoned by Allah."

chapter: Virtue Of Performing Salat at the Beginning Of Its Prescribed Time
text: "A man said to Ibn Mas'ud: 'Which deed is most virtuous?' He said: 'I asked Allah's Messenger (that). He said: "Salat at the beginning of its time." I asked him: "What is after that O Messenger of Allah?" He said: "Being dutiful to one's parents." I said: "What is after that [O Messenger of Allah]?" He said: "Jihad in the Way of Allah."

chapter: Virtue Of Performing Salat at the Beginning Of Its Prescribed Time
text: "Allah's Messenger did not pray any Salat at the end of its time two times, until Allah took him."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Forgetting The rime Of Asr
text: the Prophet said: "Whoever misses the Asr prayer, then it is as if he was robbed of his family and his property."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Hastening The Salat When The Imam Delays It
text: the Prophet said: "O Abu Dharr! There will be leaders after me who cause the Salat to die; so perform the Salat during its time. If you pray (with them) during its time, then that will be voluntary Salat for you, if not, then you will have attained your Salat."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Sleeping Past The Salat
text: "They asked the Prophet about when they sIept past the Salat. He said: 'There is no negligence in sleep, negligence is only while one is awake. So when one of you forgets a Salat, or sleeps through it, then let him pray it when he remembers it.'"

chapter: Been Related About A Man Who Forgets A Salat
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Whoever forgets a Salat then he is to pray it when he remembers it."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Misses Multiple Prayers And Which Of Them He Begin With
text: "The idolaters kept Allah's Messenger distracted from four prayers on the Day of Al-Khandaq (the battle of the Trench) until as much as Allah willed of the night had passed. So he ordered Bilal to call the Adhan, then he called the Iqamah to Zuhr, then he called the Iqamah to pray Asr, then he called the Iqamah to pray Maghrib, then he called the Iqamah to pray Isha."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Misses Multiple Prayers And Which Of Them He Begin With
text: "On the Day of Al-Khandaq (the battle of the Trench), Umar bin Al-Khattab came cursing the disbelievers of Quraish and said: 'O Allah's Messenger! I could not offer he Asr prayer until the sun was about to set.' The Prophet said: 'By Allah! I too have not offered the Salat.'" So he said: "We descended into Buthan, Allah's Messenger performed Wudu and we too performed Wudu. Allah's Messenger prayed Asr after the sun had set, then after it he prayed Maghrib."

chapter: : What Has Been Related About "Salatul-Wusta" [And It Has Been Said That It Is Zuhr]
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Salatul-Wusta is the Asr prayer."

chapter: : What Has Been Related About "Salatul-Wusta" [And It Has Been Said That It Is Zuhr]
text: the Prophet said: "Salatul-wusta is the Asr prayer."

chapter: : What Has Been Related About Prayer After Asr And After Fajr Is Disliked
text: "I head more than one of the Companions of the Prophet; Umar bin Al-Khattab among, and he was one of the most beloved among them to me - (narrating) that Allah's Messenger prohibited the Salat after Fajr until the sun had risen, and the Salat after Asr until the sun had set."

chapter: : What Has Been Related About Salat After Asr
text: "The Prophet only performed the two rak'ah (units of prayer) after Asr because some wealth came to him which distracted him from the two rak'ah after Zuhr, so he prayed them after Asr, then he did not repeat that."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Salat Before Maghrib
text: the Prophet said: "Between every two calls (to prayer) there is a Salat for whoever wills."

chapter: What Has Been Related About One Who Caught A Rak'ah About One Asr Before The Sun Has Set
text: the Prophet said: "Whoever catches a Rak'ah of Subh before the sun has risen, then he has caught Subh. Whoever catches a Rak'ah of Asr before the sun has set, then he has caught Asr."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Combining Two Prayers While [A Resident]
text: "Allah's Messenger combined the Zuhr and Asr (prayers), and the Maghrib and Isha (prayers) in Al-Madinah, without being in a state of fear, nor due to rain."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Combining Two Prayers While [A Resident]
text: the Prophet said: "Whoever combines two prayers without any excuse then he has committed something from the major sins."

chapter: What Has Been Related About How the Adhan Started
text: "When we awoke, we went to Allah's Messenger to inform him of the dream. He said: 'Indeed this dream is true. So go to Bilal, for he has a better and louder voice than you. Convey to him what was said to you, so that he may call (to the prayer) with that.'" He said: "When Umar bin Al-Khattab heard Bilal calling for the prayer he went to Allah's Messenger, and he was dragging his Izar, (as he was hurrying) saying: 'O Allah's Messenger! By the One Who sent you with the truth! I dreamt the same as what he said.''' He said: "So Allah's Messenger said: 'To Allah is the praise, so that confirms it even more.'''

chapter: What Has Been Related About How the Adhan Started
text: "When the Muslims arrived in AI-Madinah, they used to assemble for the Salat, and guess the time for it there was no one who called for it (the prayer). One day they discussed that and some of them said that they should use a bell like the bell the Christians use. Others said they should use a trumpet like the horn the Jews use. But Umar [bin Al-Khattab] said: 'Wouldn't it better if we had a man call for the prayer?'" He said: "So Allah's Messenger said: 'O Bilal! Stand up and call for the Salat.'"

chapter: : What Has Been Related About At-Tarji In The Adhan
text: Allah's Messenger sat with him and taught him the Adhan word for word. Ibrahim said, "It is the same as our Adhan." Bishr said: "So I said to him, 'Repeat it to me.' So he described the Adhan with At-Tarjl'."

chapter: : What Has Been Related About At-Tarji In The Adhan
text: the Prophet taught him the Adhan with nineteen phrases, and the Iqamah with seventeen phrases.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Saying The Phrases Of The lqamah Once
text: "Bilal was ordered to make the phrases of the Adhan even, and the phrases of the Iqamah odd."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Saying The Phrases Of The Iqamah Two Times Each
text: "Allah's Messenger would say each phrase of the call (for prayer) two times, for the Adhan and the Iqamah."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Saying The Phrases Of The Adhan With Deliberateness And Slowly
text: "Allah's Messenger said to Bilal: "O Bilal! When you call the Adhan then do so deliberately and slowly, and when you call the Iqamah then be quick. Allow enough time between your Adhan and Iqamah for the person eating to finish what he is eating, the person drinking to finish what he is drinking, and the one who needs time to relive himself, and do not stand until you see me."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Saying The Phrases Of The Adhan With Deliberateness And Slowly
text: (Another chain for) a similar narration (as no. 195).

chapter: What Has Been Related About Putting The Fingers In The Ears For The Adhan
text: "I saw Bilal calling the Adhan, and turning, and his (face) was following here and there, and his (index) fingers were in his ears, and Allah's Messenger was in a small red tent" - "I think," he (one of the narrators) said, "it was made from a hide" - so Bilal went out in front of him with an Anazah which he planted (in the ground) at Batha. Allah's Messenger prayed facing it, and a dog and a donkey passed in front of him; he was wearing a red Hullah, and it is as if I am now looking at the radiance of his shins." Sufyan said: "We think that it was a Hibrah."

chapter: What Has Been Related About AI-Tathwib In The Adhan
text:
"Allah's Messenger said [to me]: 'Do not say the Tathwib for any prayer except the Fajr prayer.'"

[He said:] There is something on this topic from Abu Mahdhurah.
Abu `Eisa said: We do not know of the Hadith of Bilal except as a narration of Abu Isra'il Al-Mula'i. Abu Isra'il did not hear this Hadith from Al-Hakam bin `Utaibah.

He said: He only reported it from Al-Hasan bin `Umarah, from Al-Hakam bin `Utaibah. Abu Isra'il's name is [Isma`il bin Abi Ishaq, and he is not strong according to the people of Hadith.

The people of knowledge have differed over the interpretation of At-Tathwib.

Some of them say that At-Tathwib is when one says "As-Salatu Khairummin An-Nawm, (prayer is better than sleep)" for the Adhan
of Fajr. This is the saying of Ibn Al-Mubarak and Ahmad.

Ishaq said something different about At-Tathwib, he said: "[The disliked Tathwib] is something that the people started after the Prophet; when the Mu'adh-dhin
calls the Adhan and the people are slow in coming, so between the Adhan and the Iqamah he says:
'Qad Qamatis-Salat, Hayya `Alasalat, Hayya `AlalFalah. (Prayer is ready, come to prayer, come to success.)"

[He said:] This Tathwib, which Ishaq mentioned, is the one that the people of knowledge dislike, which they innovated after the Prophet.

But Ibn Al-Mubarak and Ahmad explained that At-Tathwib is when the Mu'adh-dhin says: "As-Salatu Khairum minan-Nawm, (prayer is better than sleep)" for the Adhan of Fajr.
And this is the correct saying, and it is called At-Tathawwub as well, and this is the one chosen by the people of knowledge, and it is their opinion.

It has been reported from `Abdullah bin `Umar that he would say: "As-Salatu Khairum-minan-Nawm, (prayer is better than sleep)" for Fajr.

It has been reported from Mujahid that he said: "I entered a Masjid with `Abdullah bin `Umar in which the Adhan was called, and we wanted to pray in it. Then the Mu'adh-dhin said the Tathwib. So `Abdullah bin `Umar left the Masjid and said: 'Let us leave the place of this innovator' And he did not pray in it."

[He said:] `Abdullah only disliked the Tathwib that the people invented later on.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Whoever Calls The Adhan, He Is To Call The Iqamah
text: "Allah's Messenger ordered me to call the Adhan for the Fajr prayer. I called the Adhan, then Bilal wanted to call the lqamah. Allah's Messenger said: 'Indeed the brother from Suda' has called the Adhan, and whoever calls the Adhan he calls the Iqamah.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Call The Adhan Without Having Wudu
text: Allah's Messenger said: "None should call the Adhan except for one with Wudu."

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Call The Adhan Without Having Wudu
text: Abu Hurairah said: "None should call (for the prayer except for one with Wudu."

chapter: What Has Been Related That The Imam Has be Greatest Right To The Iqamah
text: The Mu'adh-dhin of Allah's Messenger would wait and he would not call the Iqamah until he saw the Allah's Messenger had come out, he would call the Iqamah when he saw him."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Adhan At Night
narrated: Salim narrated from his father (Ibn Umar) that
text: the Prophet said: "Indeed Bilal calls the Adhan in the night, so eat and drink until you hear the Adhan of Ibn Umm Maktum."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Dislike For Exiting The Masjid After The Adhan
text: "A man exited the Masjid after the Adhan for Asr had been called. So Abu Hurairah said: 'As for this person, he has indeed disobeyed Abul Qasim."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Adhan While Traveling
text: "A cousin of mine and I arrived as guests of Allah's Messenger. He said to us: 'When you travel then call the Adhan and Iqamah and let the eldest of you lead the prayer.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtues Of The Adhan
text: "The Prophet said: 'Whoever calls the Adhan for seven years, seeking reward for it, salvation from the Fire is written for him.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related That The Imam Is Answerable and the Mu'adh-dhin Is Entrusted
text: Allah's Messenger said: "The Imam is answerable and the Mu'adh-dhin is entrusted. O Allah! Guide the Imams and pardon the Mu'adh-dhins."

chapter: What Has Been Related About What Is Said [by A Man] When the Mu'adh-dhin Calls The Adhan
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Whenyou hear the call (to prayer) then say the similar to what the Mu'adh-dhin says"

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Dislike For The Mu'adh-dhin Taking A Wage For the Adhan
text: "Indeed, amount the last (of orders) Allah's Messenger ordered me with was to employ a Mu'adh-dhin who would not take a wage for his Adhan."

chapter: [What Has Been Related About] What Supplications Is Said [By A Muslim] When The Mu'adh-dhin Calls The Adhan
narrated: Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas narrated that
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Whoever says, when he hears the Mu'adh-dhin: (Wa Ana Ashadu An La Ilaha Illallah, Wahdahu La Sharika Lahu, Wa Anna Muhammadan Abduhu Wa Rasuluhu, Radittu Billahi Rabban Wa Bil-Islam Dinan, Wa Bi Muhammadin Rasulan) 'I too testify that none has the right to be worshiped but Allah, Alone without partners, and that Muhammad is His slave and Messenger, I am pleased with Allah as my Lord, with Islam as my religion and Muhammad as a Messenger.' - Allah will pardon his sins for him."

chapter: Something Else
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Whoever says, when he hears the call: (Allahumma, rabba hadhihidda 'watit-tammati was Salatilqa'imah, ati Muhammadanil wasilata wal-Fadilata, wab'athhu Maqamun Mahmudan alladhi wa'adtahu) 'O Allah! Lord of this perfect call and established prayer, grant Muhammad Al-Wasilah and Al-Fadilah, and raise him to the praised station that you promised him' - then intercession on the Day of Resurrection is made lawful for him."

chapter: Supplication Made Between Adhan and Iqamah Is Not Rejected
text: Allah's Messenger said: "The supplication made between the Adhan and Iqamah is not rejected."

chapter: What Has Been Related About How Many Prayers Allah Made Obligatory Upon His Servants
text: "On the Night of Isra, fifty prayers were made obligatory upon the Prophet. Then it was decreased until it was made five. Then it was called out: 'O Muhammad! Indeed My Word does not change; these five prayers will be recorded for you as fifty.'"

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About The Virtue Of The Five Prayers
text: Allah's Messenger said: "The five prayers, and Al-Jumuah (the Friday prayer) to Al-Jumuah are atonement for what is between them, as long as the major sins have not been committed."

chapter: What Has Been Related About the Virtue Of Salat In Congregation
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Salat in congregation is twenty-seven degrees more virtuous than a man's Salat alone."

chapter: What Has Been Related About the Virtue Of Salat In Congregation
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Indeed a man's Salat in the congregation is increased by twenty five rewards over his Salat alone."

chapter: What Has Been Related About One Who Heard the Call (to Prayer) But Did Not Respond To It
text: the Prophet said: "I was about to order my boys to collect bundles of firewood, then order Salat to be held, then burn (the homes) of the people who did not attend the Salat."

chapter: What Has Been Related About One Who Heard the Call (to Prayer) But Did Not Respond To It
text: "Ibn Abbas was asked about a man who fasted during the day and stood (in prayers) during the night, but he did not attend the Friday prayer nor congregational prayer. He replied: 'He is in the Fire.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Man Who Performs Salat Alone, Then He Comes Upon A Congregation
narrated: Jabir hin Yazid hin Al-Aswad [Al-Amir] narrated that his father said
text: "I attended Hajj with the Prophet. I prayed the Subh (Fajr) prayer with him in Masjid AI-Khaif." He said: "When the Prophet finished, he turned (from the Qiblah) and saw two men at the back of the people who had not prayed with him. He said, 'Bring them to me.' So I brought then while they were shuddering with fear. He said: 'What prevented you from praying with us?" They said: 'O Messenger of Allah!' We prayed at our camp.' So he said: 'Do not do that; when you pray in your camp then you come to a Masjid with a congregation, then pray with them. That will be a voluntary prayer for you.'"

chapter: : What Has Been Related About The Congregation In The Masjid Being Held Two Times
text: "A man came when Allah's Messenger had already prayed, so he said: 'Which of you will give some reward to this person?' So a man stood to pray with him."

chapter: : What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Isha And Fajr In Congregation
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Whoever attends Isha (prayer) in congregation, then he has (the reward as if he had) stood half of the night. And whoever prays Isha and Fajr in congregation, then he has (the reward as if he had) spend the entire night standing (in prayer)."

chapter: : What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Isha And Fajr In Congregation
text: the Prophet said: "Whoever prays the Subh then he is under the protection of Allah's covenant, so do not be treacherous with Allah in his covenant."

chapter: : What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Isha And Fajr In Congregation
text: the Prophet said: "Give glad tiding to those who walk to the Masajid in the dark; of a complete light on the Day of Resurrection."

chapter: : What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of The First Row
text: Allah's Messenger said: "The best rows for the men are the first of them, and the worst are the last of them. And the best rows for the women are the last of them, and the worst are the first of them."

chapter: : What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of The First Row
text: And the Prophet said: "If the people knew what (reward) is in the call (Adhan) and the first row, and they found no other way to get that except drawing lots, then they would draw lots."

chapter: : What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of The First Row
text: A Similar narration

chapter: : What Has Been Related About Keeping the Rows Straight
text: "Allah's Messenger would straighten our lines. One day he came out and saw a man whose chest was protruding from the people, so he said: 'You must straighten your lines, or Allah will cause disagreement to occur among your faces."

chapter: : What Has Been Related About "Let Those Among You With Understanding And Reason Be Close To Me."
text: the Prophet said: "Let those among you with understanding and reason be close to me, then those after them, then those after them. And do not separate or dissention will occur among your hearts, and beware of the commotion of the markets."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Dislike For Forming Rows Between Columns
text: "We prayed behind one of the Amirs, the people compelled us such that we prayed between two columns. When we had prayed, Anas bin Malik said: 'We would be prevented from this during the time of Allah's Messenger.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Salat Behind The Line Alone
text: "Ziyad bin Abi Al-Ja'd took me by the hand while we were in Ar Raqqah, he made me stand before a Shaikh who was called Wabisah bin Ma'bad, from Bani Asad. Ziyad said: 'This Shaikh narrated to me that a prayed alone behind the row' - and the Shaikh was listening - 'so Allah's Messenger ordered him to repeat the Salat.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Salat Behind The Line Alone
text: "A man prayed alone behind the row s the Prophet ordered him to repeat the Salat."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Prays While Another Man Is With Him
text: "I prayed with the Prophet one night. I stood at his left, so Allah's Messenger took me by my head, from behind me, to put me on his right (side)."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Prays With Two Men
text: "Allah's Messenger ordered us that when we were three, then one of us should stand forward."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Prays And A Man And A Woman Are With Him
text: "My grandmother Mutalikah invited Allah's Messenger to a meal that she prepared. He ate from it, then said: 'Stand so tht we may lead you in prayer.'" He said: "I got a Hasir of our which had become dark because of prolonged use, so I washed it with water. Allah's Messenger stood on it, and the orphan and I aligned behind him and the only lady stood behind us. He (Allah's Messenger) led us in two Rak'ah of prayer and then left."

chapter: [What Has Been Related About] Who Is Most Deserving Of Being The Imam
text: Allah's Messenger said: "The one who recites most of the Book of Allah is to lead the people (in prayers). If they are equal in recitation, then the most knowledgeable in the Sunnah among them. If they are equal regarding the Sunnah, then the earliest of them to emigrate. If they are equal in their emigration then the eldest among them. And a man is not to be led in prayer in the place of his authority, and his spot of esteem in his home is not to be sat on without his permission."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: "When One Of You Leads The People In Prayer, Then Let Him Be Brief."
text: the Prophet said: "When one of you leads the people in prayer then let him be brief, for indeed here are among them the young and the old, the weak and the ill. When one of you prays alone, then let him pray as he wishes."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: "When One Of You Leads The People In Prayer, Then Let Him Be Brief."
text: "Allah's Messenger was among the lightest of people in Salat with its completeness."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Tahrim And Tahlil Of Salat
text: Allah's Messenger said: "the key to Salat is the purification, its Tahrim is the Takbir, and its Tahlilis the Taslim, and there is no Salat for one who did not recite Al-Hamd and a Surah in the obligatory (prayer) or other prayers."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Spreading The Fingers With The Takbir
text: "When Allah's Messenger performed the Takbir for Salat he would spread his fingers."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Spreading The Fingers With The Takbir
text: "When Allah's Messenger would enter the Salat he would raise his hands while they were extended."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About the Virtue Of the First Takbir
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Whoever performs Salat for Allah for forty days in congregation, catching the first Takbir, two absolutions are written for him: absolution from the Fire, and absolution from the Fire, and absolution from hypocrisy."

chapter: What Is Said During The Opening Of The Salat
text: "When Allah;s Messenger stood for Salat during the night, he would say the Takbir (Allahu Akbar), then say: (Subhanaka Allahumma wa bihamdika wa Tabarakasmuka wa Ta'ala Jadduka wa la ilaha ghairuk.) 'Glorious You are O Allah, and with Your praise, and blesses is Your Name, and exalted is Your majesty, and none has the right to be worshipped but You' Then he would say: (A'udhu Bilahi As-Sami'il-Alimi min Ash-Shaitanir-Rajimi, min Hamzihi Wa Nafkhihi wa Nafthihi.)" 'Allah is undoubtedly the greatest.' (Allahu Akbaru Kabira). Then he would say: 'I seek refuge in Allah the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing, from the cursed Shaitan, from his madness, his arrogance, and his poetry.'

chapter: What Is Said During The Opening Of The Salat
text: "When the Prophet opened the Salat he would say: (Subhanaka Allahumma wa bihamdika wa tabarakasmuka, wa ta'ala jadduka wa la ilaha ghairuk)" 'Glorious You are O Allah, and with Your praise, and blessed is Your Name, and exalted is Your majesty, and none has the right to be worshipped but You.'

chapter: What Has Been Related About Not Saying "Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Rahim (In The Name Of Allah, The Merciful, The Beneficient)" Aloud
text: "While I was praying, I said: Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Rahim "In the Name of Allah, the Merciful, the Beneficent." My father heard me and said: "O my son this is a newly invented matter, beware of the newly-invented.'" He (Ibn Abdullah) said: "I have not seen any one of the Companions of Allah's Messenger who hated a newly invented matter in Islam more than him. And he said: 'Ihave performed Salat with the Prophet, and with Abu Bakr, and Umar, and with Uthman. I did not hear any one of them saying it. So do not say it. When you are performing Salat say: Al-Hamdu lilahi Rabbil-Alamin "All praise is due to Allah the Lord of all that exists.'"

chapter: Whoever Held The View That Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Rahim Was Recited Aloud
text: "The Prophet would open his Salat with (Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Rahim)."

chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Opening The Recitation With Al-Hamdulillahi Rabbil-Alamin (All Praise Is Due To Allah, The Lord Of All That Exits.)
text: "Allah's Messenger, Abu Bakr, Umar and Uthman opened the Salat with (Al-Hamdu-lillahi rabbil-alamin)."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: "There Is No Salat Except With Fatihatil-Kitab"
text: the Prophet said: "There is no Salat for the one who does not recite Fatihatil-Kitab."

chapter: What Has Been Related About At-Ta'min
text: "I heard the Prophet recite: (Not (the way) of those who earned Your anger, nor those who went astray) and he said: 'Amin.' And he stretched it out with his voice."

chapter: What Has Been Related About At-Ta'min
narrated: (Another chain) from Wa'il bin Hujr who narrated it from
text: the Prophet, and it is similar to the narrations of Sufyan from Salamah bin Kuhail

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of At-Tamin
text: the Prophet said "When the Imam says 'Amin' then (all of you) say 'Amin.' For whoever's 'Amin' concurs with the 'Amin' of the angels, then his past sins will be forgiven."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Two Pauses [During Salat]
text: Samurah said: "there are two pauses that I preserved from Allah's Messenger." But Imran bin Husain rejected that and said: "We preserved one pause." "So we wrote to Ubayy bin Ka'b in Al-Madinah. Ubayy wrote that Samurah was correct." Sa'eed said: "We said to Qatadah: 'What are those two pauses?' He said: 'When he entered into his Salat, and when he finished his recitation.' Then he (Qatadah) said after that: 'And when he recited (Nor those who went astray.)' And he said: 'He liked to pause when he finished the recitation until he caught his breath.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Placing The Right Hand Over The Left During the Salat
text: his father who said: "Allah's Messenger lead us in prayer and hold his left hand with his right."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Takbir For The Bowing And Prostration Positions
