text: (Another chain) from Abdullah bin Umar from the Prophet which is similar

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About Performing Ghusl On Friday
narrated: And Yunus and Ma'mar reported, from Az-Zuhri, from Salim Wudu from his father
text: "Umar bin Al-Khattab was giving a Khutbah on Friday when a man from the Companions of the Prophet entered. So he said: "What time is it?" So he said: 'I don't know, I heard the call and did nothing more than perform Wudu.' So he said: And Wudu again!? I know surely that the Messenger of Allah has ordered Ghusl.'"

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About Performing Ghusl On Friday
narrated: (Another chain reaching to Az-Zuhri) with this Hadith.Malik reported this Hadith from Az-Zuhri, from Salim who said
text: "Umar [bin al-Khattab] was giving a Khutbah on Friday." And he mentioned this Hadith.

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About The Virtue Of Ghusl On Friday
text: "Allah's Messenger said to me: 'Whoever performs Ghusl on Friday, and bathes completely, and goes early, arriving early, gets close and listens and is silent, there will be for him in every step he take the reward of a year of fasting and standing (in prayer).'"

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Wudu On Friday
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Whoever performs  Wudu on Friday, then he will receive the blessing, and whoever performs Ghusl then Ghusl is more virtuous."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Wudu On Friday
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Whoever performs Wudu, performing his Wudu well, then he comes to the Friday (prayer), and he gets close, listens and is silent, then whatever (sin) was between that and (the last) Friday are forgiven for him, in addition to three days. And whoever touches the pebbles, he has committed Lagha (useless activity)."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About Going Early To The Friday Prayer
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Whoever performs Ghusl on Friday - the Ghusl for Janabah - then he goes, he is like one who gave a camel in charity. Whoever goes in the second hour then he is like one who gave a cow in charity. Whoever goes in the third hour then he is like the one who have a ram in charity. Whoever goes in the fourth hour then he is like the one who gave a chicken in charity. Whoever goes in the fifth hour, then he is like one who gave an egg in charity. When the Imam comes out, the angels are present listening to the remembrance."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About Neglecting The Friday Prayer Without An Excuse.
narrated: Abu Al-Ja'd - meaning Ad-Damri - narrated, and he was a Companion according to the claim of Muhammad bin Amr
text: "Allah's Messenger said: 'Whoever neglects the Friday prayer three times (in a row) without an excuse, then Allah sets a seal upon his heart.'"

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About How Much Distance One Should Cover To Go To The Friday Prayer
narrated: Thuwair narrated from a man among the people of Quba, from his father, who was one of the Companions of the Prophet, that
text: he said: "The Prophet ordered us to attend the Friday prayer in Quba."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About How Much Distance One Should Cover To Go To The Friday Prayer
text: I heard Ahmad bin Husain saying: "We were with Ahmad bin Hanbal, so they mentioned the one upon whom the Friday prayer is obligatory. Ahmad did not mention anything about it from the Prophet." Ahmad bin Al-Hasan said: "I said to Ahmad bin Hanbal: 'There is something about it from Abu Hurairah, from the Prophet.' So Ahmad bin Hanbal said: 'From the Prophet?' I said: 'Yes.'" [Ahmed bin Hanbal said:] "Hajjaj bin Nusair narrated to us; Mubarik bin Abbad narrated to us from Abdullah bin Sa'eed Al-Maqburi, from his father, from Abu Hurairah that the Prophet said: "The Friday prayer is required from whomever can return to his family by the night." He said: "So Ahmad [bin Hanbal] became angry with me, and he said to me: 'Seek forgiveness from your Lord, seek forgiveness from your Lord.'"

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Time For The Friday Prayer
text: "The Prophet would pray the Friday prayer when the sun was declining."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Time For The Friday Prayer
text: from the Prophet, similarly.

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Khutbah On the Minbar
text: "The Prophet would give the Khutbah next to the trunk of a date palm. When he [the Prophet] began using the Minbar the trunk cried out for him until he came to it and held it, so it became quiet."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About Sitting Between Two Khutbah
text: "The Prophet would give a Khutbah on Friday, then sit, then stand and give (another) Khutbah." He said: "Similar to what they do today."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About Curtailing The Khutbah
text: "I would pray with the Prophet, and his prayer was moderate, and his Khutbah was moderate."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Recitation On The Minbar
narrated: Safwan bin Ya'la bin Umayyah narrated from his father who said
text: "I heard the Prophet reciting, when on the Minbar: And they will cry: "O Malik (keeper of Hell)!"." [He said:] There are narrations on this topic from Abu Hurairah and Jabir bin Samurah.

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Direction The Imam Faces When Delivering The Khutbah
text: "When Allah's Messenger descending the Minbar he would face our direction."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Two Rak'ah When One Arrives While the Imam Is Delivering The Khubah
text: "The Prophet was delivering a Khutbah on Friday when a man came. The Prophet said: 'Have you prayed?' He said no. So he said: 'Then stand and pray.'" Abu Eisa said: This Hadith is Hasan Sahih [It is the most correct thing about this topic.]

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Two Rak'ah When One Arrives While the Imam Is Delivering The Khubah
narrated: Iyad bin  Abdullah bin Abi Sarh narrated
text: "Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri entered (the mosque) on Friday while Marwan was giving the Khutbah, so he began praying. Two guards came to make him sit down but he refused until he had prayed. When he finished he came to us and we said: 'May Allah have mercy upon you. They nearly harmed you.' He said: 'I was not going to stop performing them (the two Rak'ah) after what I saw from Allah's Messenger.' Then he mentioned that a man who appeared untidy came on Fridy while the Prophet was delivering the Friday Khutbah, so he ordered him to pray two Rak'ah all the while the Prophet was delivering the Khutbah."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About If Being Disliked to Talk While The Imam Is Delivering The Khutbah
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Whoever said: 'Be quiet' while the Imam is giving the Khutbah then he has committed Laghw (useless activity)."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About It Being Disliked To Step Over (The Necks Of Others) On Friday
narrated: Sahl bin Ma'adh bin Anas al Jahni narrated from his father that
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Whoever steps over the necks of the people on Friday, he has taken a bridge to Hell."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About Al-Habwah Being Disliked While The Imam Is Delivering The Khutbah
narrated: Sahl bin Ma'adh narrated from his father
text: "The Prophet prohibited Al-Habwah on Friday while the Imam is delivering the Khutbah."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Raise The Hands On The Minbar
text: "I heard Umarah bin Rawaibah Ath-Thaqafi - while Bishr bin Marwan was delivering Khutbah and raising his hands in supplication - so Umarah said: 'May Allah disgrace these two insignificant hands, I have seen Allah's Messenger, and he would not do any more than this;'" and Hushaim (one of the narrators) motioned with his index finger.

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Adhan For The Friday Prayer
text: "The Adhan during the time of Allah's Messenger, Abu Bakr, and Umar was when the Imam came out, [and when] the Iqamah was called for the Salat. Then Uthman [may Allah be pleased with him] added a third call at Az-Zawra."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About Talking After The Imam Descends From The Minbar
text: "Allah's Messenger would talk as necessary after descending from the Minbar."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About Talking After The Imam Descends From The Minbar
text: "I saw the Prophet, after the Iqamah was called for Salat, talking to a man who was standing between him and the Qiblah, he did not stop talking, and I saw some of them getting sleepy from his lengthy standing the Prophet."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About the Recitation During The Friday Prayer
narrated: Ubaidullah bin Abi Rafi the freed slave of Allah's Messenger said
text: "Marwan left Abu Hurairah in charge of Al-Madinah and he went to Makkah. So Abu Hurairah led us in Salat in Friday, reciting Surah Al-Jumuah (in the first Rak'ah) and in the second prostration (Rak'ah): When the hypocrites come to you." Ubaidullah said: "So I caught up with Abu Hurairah and said to him: 'You recited two Surah that Ali recited in Al-Kufah. Abu Hurairah said: 'Indeed I heard Allah's Messenger reciting them.'"

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About What IS Recited In the Subh Prayer On Friday
text: "For the Fajr prayer on Friday, Allah's Messenger would recite: Alif Lam Mem (which is) revealed in (Surat) As-Sajdah and, Has there not been over man."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Salat Before the Friday Prayer And After
text: "The Prophet would pray two Rak;ah after the Friday prayer."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Salat Before the Friday Prayer And After
text: "When he prayed the Friday prayer, he left and prayed two prostrations (Rak'ah) in his house. Then he said: 'Allah's Messenger would do this.'"

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Salat Before the Friday Prayer And After
text: Allah's Messenger said: "Whoever among you is to pray after the Friday prayer, then let him pray four."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About One Who Catches A Rak'ah Of The Friday Prayer
text: the Prophet said: "Whoever catches a Rak'ah of the Salat then he has caught the Salat."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Having Siesta On Friday
text: "We would not have lunch during the time of Allah's Messenger, nor would we have a siesta, until after the Friday prayer."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About One Who Becomes Sleepy During The Friday Prayer, And That He Is To Change His Location
text: the Prophet said: "When one of you becomes sleepy during the Friday prayer, then let him move from where he is sitting."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: What Has Been Related About Traveling On Friday
text: "The Prophet sent Abdullah bin Rawahah to lead a military detachment, and that corresponded to a Friday. So his companions left early in the day, and he said: 'I will remain behind to pray with Allah's Messenger then meet up with them.' When he prayed with the Prophet, he saw him and said: 'What prevented you from leaving earlier with your companions?' He said: 'I wanted to pray with you then meet up with them.' He said: 'If you have spent [all of] what is in the earth, you would not have achieved the virtue you have had you left early in the day with them.'"

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About As-Siwak And Perfume On Friday
text: Allah's Messenger said: "It is a duty for the Muslims, that they perform Ghusl on Friday, and that each of them wear some of his family's perfume. If he does not find any, then water is a perfume for him."

book: The Book on the Day of Friday
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About As-Siwak And Perfume On Friday
text: (Another route for the same chain) similar in meaning.

book: The Book on the Two Eids
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Walking On The Day Of Eid
text: "It is from the SUnnah to leave for the Eid walking, and to eat something before leaving."

book: The Book on the Two Eids
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About The Eid Prayers Before The Khutbah
text: "Allah's Messenger, Abu Bakr, and Umar would pray during the two Eid before the Khutbah, then they would give the Khutbah."

book: The Book on the Two Eids
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About The Salat For The Two Eid Is Without An Adhan Nor An Iqamah
text: "I prayed the two Eid prayers with the Prophet - not one time, not two times - without and Adhan nor an Iqamah."

book: The Book on the Two Eids
chapter: [What Has Been Related About About] The Recitation During The Two Eid
text: "For the two Eid and the Friday prayer, the Prophet would recite: Glorify the Name of your Lord, the Most High, and Has there come to you the narration of the overwhelming? And sometimes they would occur on he same day, so he would recite the two of them."

book: The Book on the Two Eids
chapter: [What Has Been Related About About] The Recitation During The Two Eid
narrated: Ubaidullah bin Abdullah bin Utbah narrated
text: "Umar bin Al-Khattab asked Abu Waqid Al-Laithi what Allah's Messenger would recite during Al-Fitr and Al-Adha, so he said: 'He would recite: Qaf, By the Glorious Quran and the Hour has drawn near, and the moon has been cleft asunder.'"

book: The Book on the Two Eids
chapter: [What Has Been Related About About] The Recitation During The Two Eid
text: There is a another chain with similar narration.

book: The Book on the Two Eids
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About The Takbir On The Two Eid
narrated: Kathir bin Abdullah narrated from this father, from his grandfather
text: "The Prophet said the Takbir in the first (Rak'ah) sever (times) before the recitation, and in the last, five (times) before the recitation."

book: The Book on the Two Eids
chapter: What Has Been Related About 'There Is No Salat Before The Two Eid And No Salat After Them'
text: "The Prophet went out on the day of Al-Fitr, so he prayed two Rak'ah, then he did not pray before it nor after it."

book: The Book on the Two Eids
chapter: What Has Been Related About 'There Is No Salat Before The Two Eid And No Salat After Them'
narrated: Abu Bakr bin Hafs - and he is Ibn Umar bin Sa'd bin Abi Waqas - narrated about Ibn Umar, that
text: "He went out on the day of Eid, and he did not pray before it nor after it. He mentioned that the Prophet did so."

book: The Book on the Two Eids
chapter: About The Women Going Out For The Two Eid
text: "Allah's Messenger would order the virgins, the mature women, the secluded and the menstruating to go out for the two Eid. As for the menstruating women, they were to stay away from the Musalla and participate in the Muslims supplications." One of them said: 'O Messenger of Allah! What if she does not have a Jilbab? He said: 'Then let her sis lend her a Jilbab.'"

book: The Book on the Two Eids
chapter: About The Women Going Out For The Two Eid
narrated: There is a similar narration from Umm Atiyyah
text: with another chain.

book: The Book on the Two Eids
chapter: What Has Been Related About the Prophet Going To The Eid By One Route, And Returning By Another
text: "When Allah's Messenger would go out on the day of Eid by one route, he would return by another."

book: The Book on the Two Eids
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Eating On The Day Of Fitr Before Going Out
narrated: Abdullah bin Buraidah narrated from his father
text: "The Prophet would not leave on the Day of Fitr until he ate, and he would not eat on the day of Adha until he prayed."

book: The Book on the Two Eids
chapter: [What Has Been Related] About Eating On The Day Of Fitr Before Going Out
text: "The Prophet would have a breakfast of dates on the Day of Fitr before leaving for the Musalla."

chapter: (What Has Been Related About) Shortening The Prayer During Travels
text: "I traveled with the Prophet, Abu Bakr, Umar, and Uthman; they would pray Zuhr and Asr as two Rak'ah and two Rak'ah, not praying before them nor after them." And Ibn Umar said: "If I was going to pray before it or after it then I would pray it complete."

chapter: (What Has Been Related About) Shortening The Prayer During Travels
text: "Imran bin Husain was asked about the traveler's prayer. He said: 'I performed Hajj with the Messenger of Allah, and he prayed two Rak'ah. I performed Hajj with Abu Bakr, and he prayed two Rak'ah and with Umar, and he prayed two Rak;ah; and with Uthman for six years of his Khilafah, or eight years, and he prayed two Rak'ah."

chapter: (What Has Been Related About) Shortening The Prayer During Travels
text: "We prayed Zuhr as four with the Prophet in Al-Madinah, and Asr as two Rak'ah in Dhil-Hulaifah."

chapter: (What Has Been Related About) Shortening The Prayer During Travels
text: "The Prophet went from Al-Madinah to Makkah, not fearing anyone except Allah the Lord of the worlds, and he prayed two Rak'ah."

chapter: What Has Been Related About How Long The Prayer Is Shortened
narrated: Yahya bin Abi Ishaq Al-Hadrami narrated
text: that Anas bin Malik said: "We went with the Messenger of Allah from Al-Madinah to Makkah, and he prayed two Rak'ah." He said: "I said to Anas: 'How long did Messenger of Allah stay in Makkah?' He said: 'Ten (days).'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About How Long The Prayer Is Shortened
text: "The Messenger of Allah traveled on a journey and he prayed two Rak'ah for nineteen days." Ibn Abbas said: "So when we would stay somewhere for nineteen (days) we would pray two Rak'ah , and if we stayed longer than that we would complete the Salat."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Voluntary Prayers While Traveling
text: "I accompanied the Messenger of Allah on eighteen journeys, and I did not see him leave  the two  Rak'ah when the sun waned before Zuhr."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Voluntary Prayers While Traveling
text: "I prayed Zuhr with the Prophet on a journey as two Rak'ah, and two Rak'ah after it."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Voluntary Prayers While Traveling
text: "I prayed with the Prophet both, while a resident and while traveling. So I prayed four for Zuhr with him as a resident, and two Rak'ah after it. I prayed two Rak'ah for Zuhr with him while traveling and two Rak'ah after it, and two Rak'ah for Asr, and he did not pray anything after it. Maghrib while a resident and traveling is the same; three Rak'ah, it is not decreased as a resident nor while traveling. It is Witr of the day, and after it are two Rak'ah."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Combining Two Prayers
text: "While the Prophet as at the Battle of Tabuk, if he wanted to depart before the sun's decline he would delay Zuhr so that he could pray it together with Asr. If he wanted to depart after the sun's decline, he would hasten Asr to Zuhr, and pray Zuhr and Asr together, and then move it. If he wanted to depart before Maghrib he would delay Maghrib until he prayed it with Isha, and if he wanted to depart after Maghrib he would hasten Isha so that he would pray it along with Maghrib."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Combining Two Prayers
text: this Hadith to us, meaning the Hadith of Mu'adh]

chapter: What Has Been Related About Combining Two Prayers
text: "Ibn Umar had been requested to urgently attend to one of his wives, so he hurried en route and delayed Maghrib until the twilight disappeared, then he dismounted to combine them (the prayers). Then he informed them that the Messenger of Allah would do that when he was in a hurry on a trip."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Salat Al-Istisqa (The Prayer To Request Rain)
narrated: Abbad bin Tamim narrated from his uncle
text: "The Messenger of Allah went out with the people to seek rain. So he led them in prayer for two Rak'ah, reciting aloud in them, turning his upper wrap around, raising his hands, requesting rain, and facing the Qiblah."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Salat Al-Istisqa (The Prayer To Request Rain)
narrated: Umair, the freed slave of Abi Al-Lahm narrated from Abi Al-Lahm that
text: he saw the Messenger of Allah at Ahjar Az-Zait, supplicating for rain, and he was raising his hands in supplication.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Salat Al-Istisqa (The Prayer To Request Rain)
narrated: It is narrated from Hisham bin Ishaq - and he was from Ibn Abdullah bin Kinanah - from his father who said
text: "Al-Walid bin Uqbah, the governor of Al-Madinah, sent me to ask Ibn Abbas about how the Messenger of Allah would perform Salat Al-Istisqa. I came to him and he said: 'The Messenger of Allah would go out in modest dress, humbly, imploring, until he reached the Musalla. He would not give this Khutbah of yours, rather, he would continue supplication and imploring saying the Takbir, and pray two Rak'ah, just as he would pray for the Eid.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Salat Al-Istisqa (The Prayer To Request Rain)
narrated: (Another chain) from Hisham bin Ishaq bin Abdullah bin Kinanah, from his father,
text: and he mentioned a similar narration and added: "with humility" to it.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Salat Al-Kusuf (The Eclipse Prayer)
text: "The Prophet prayed during the eclipse. He recited, then bowed, then recited, then bowed, then recited, then bowed. (three times), then he performed two prostrations, and the next one (Rak'ah) was the same."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Salat Al-Kusuf (The Eclipse Prayer)
text: "The sun was eclipsed during the time of the Messenger of Allah, so the Messenger of Allah led the people in prayer. He recited a lengthy recitation, then he bowed a lengthy bowing, then he raised his head and recited a lengthy recitation that was less than the first. Then he bowed a lengthy bowing that was less than the first. Then he raised his head and prostrated. Then he did (similar to) that in the second Rak'ah."

chapter: The Manner Of The Recitation For The Eclipse
text: "The Prophet led us in prayer during an eclipse; we did not hear his voice."

chapter: The Manner Of The Recitation For The Eclipse
text: "The Prophet prayed the eclipse payer, and he recited aloud in it."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Salat Al-Khawf (The Fear Prayer)
text: "The Prophet prayed Salat Al-Khawf, praying one Rak'ah with one of the two groups, while the other group was facing the enemy. (When the first group finished they first Rak'ah with him), they went and took position (of the second group, facing the enemy). Then the second group came and he led them in another Rak'ah, then he said the Taslim to them, while the group proceeded to complete their (second) Rak'ah. Thereafter, the first group stood up to finish their (second) Rak'ah."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Salat Al-Khawf (The Fear Prayer)
narrated: Sahl bin Abi Hathmah said about Salat Al-Khawf
text: "The Imam stands facing the Qiblah while a group of them stand with him, and a group is before the enemy, facing the enemy. He leads them in a Rak'ah, and they perform a bowing by themselves, and they perform two prostrations in their places. Then they go to take the position of the others and the others come (for prayers). He (the Imam) bows for one Rak'ah with them and performs two prostrations with them. That is two for him and one for them, then they perform one bowing and two prostrations."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Salat Al-Khawf (The Fear Prayer)
text:
) Muhammad bin Bash-har said:
"I asked Yahya bin Sa'eed (narrators in no. 565) about this Hadith. So he narrated it to me from Shu'bah, from Abdur-Rahman bin Al-Qasim, from his father, from Salih bin Khawwat, from Sahl bin Abi Hathmah, from the Prophet - the same as the Hadith of Yahya bin Sa'eed Al-Ansari. And he (Yahya) said to me: "Write it next to it. He did not memorize the Hadith better though, rather it is the same Hadith as that of Yahya bin Sa'eed Al-Ansari'" (a Hadith similar to no. 565, with a different chain of narrators)

chapter: What Has Been Related About Salat Al-Khawf (The Fear Prayer)
narrated: It was reported by Malik from Yazid bin Ruman,
text: from Salih bin Khawwat, from someone who prayed Salat Al-Khawf with the Prophet, and he mentioned a similar narration.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Locations In The Qur'an Where One Is To Prostrate
text: "I performed eleven prostrations (of recitation) with the Messenger of Allah, among them was that which is in Surat An-Najm."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Locations In The Qur'an Where One Is To Prostrate
narrated: (Another chain in which) Abu Ad-Darda narrated
text: "I performed eleven prostrations with the Messenger of Allah, among them was that which is in Surat An-Najm."

chapter: (What Has Been Related) About Women Going Out To The Masjid
text: "We were with Ibn Umar, and he said: 'The Messenger of Allah said: "Permit the women to go at night to the Masajid." His son said: 'By Allah! We would not permit them lest they become insidious from that.' So he (Abdullah) retorted: 'May Allah do and such with you.' I say: "The Messenger of Allah said," and you say: "We do not permit them?"

chapter: (What Has Been Related) About It Being Disliked To Spit In The Masjid
narrated: Tariq bin Abdullah Al-Muharibi narrated that
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "When you are in Salat then do not spit on your right, but behind you or toward your left, or under your left foot."

chapter: (What Has Been Related) About It Being Disliked To Spit In The Masjid
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "To spit in the Masjid is a sin, and burying it is its atonement."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Prostrations (Of Recitation) In: When The Heaven If Split Asunder And: Read! In The Name Of Your Lord Who Has Created
text: "We prostrated with the Messenger of Allah in: 'Read! In the Name of your Lord' and 'When the heaven is split asunder.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Prostrations (Of Recitation) In: When The Heaven If Split Asunder And: Read! In The Name Of Your Lord Who Has Created
narrated: (Another chain in which) Abu Hurairah narrated
text: from the Prophet similarly.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Prostration In (Surat) An-Najm
text: "The Messenger of Allah prostrated for it - meaning (in Surat) An-Najm - and so did the Muslims, the idolaters, the Jinns, and the people."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The One Who Did Not Prostrate For It
text: "I recited Surat An-Najm to the Messenger of Allah, and he did not prostrate for it."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Prostration In (Surat) Sad
text: "I saw the Messenger of Allah prostrating for (Surat) Sad." Ibn Abbas said: "It is not one of the resolute prostrations."

chapter: (What Has Been Related) About The Prostration In (Surat) Al-Hajj
text: "I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Surah Al-Hajj has been esteemed by two prostrations?' He said: 'Yes, and whoever does not prostrate for them, he should not recite them.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About What Is Said During A Prostration For Recitation In The Quran
narrated: Al-Hasan bin Muhammad bin Ubaidullah bin Abi Yazid said
text: Ibn Juraij said to me: O Hasan! Ubaidullah bin Abi Yazid informed me that Ibn Abbas said: "A man came to the Prophet and said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I had a dream at night while I was sleeping in which I was praying behind a tree, when I prostrated the tree prostrated along with me. Then I heard it saying: (Allahummaktuh li biha indaka ajran, wad a anni biha wizran, waj'alha li biha indaka dhukhran, wa taqabbalha minni kama taqabbaltaha min abdiki Dawud.)" (O Allah! Record for me, a reward with You for it, remove a sin for me by it, and store it away for me with You, and accept it from me as You accepted it from Your worshipper Dawud). Al-Hasan said: "Ibn Juraij said to me: 'Your grandfather said to me: 'Ibn Abbas said: 'So the Prophet recited (an Ayah of) prostration then prostrated.'" (He said) "So Ibn Abbas said: 'I listened to him, and he was saying the same as the man informed that the tree had said.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About What Is Said During A Prostration For Recitation In The Quran
text: "When the Messenger of Allah would prostrate (for recitation of) the Qur'an, he would say: (Sajada wajhiya lilladhi khalaqahu wa shaqqa sam'ahu wa basarahu bihawlihi wa quwwatihi.) (I have prostrated my face to the One Who created it, and made its hearing and vision, though His ability and power.)"

chapter: What Has Been Related About One Who Missed His Section At Night, So He Makes It Up During The Day
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever slept, (missing) his section or some of it, then he recited it between the Fajr prayer and the Zuhr prayer, it is written for him as if he had recited it in the night."

chapter: What has been related about the severe warning regarding the one who raises his head before the Imam
text: "Muhammad said: 'Does not the one who raises his head before the Imam fear that Allah will transform his head into a donkey's head?'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About The One Who Prays The Obligatory Prayer, Then Leads The People In Prayer After That
text: 'Mu'adh bin Jabal would pray Al-Maghrib with the Messenger of Allah, then he would return to his people to lead them (in prayer)."

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About The Permission To Prostrate On The Clothing During The Heat And Cold
text: "When we prayed behind the Prophet in the midday heat, we would prostrate on our garments as a protection against the heat."

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About What Is Recommended When Sitting After The Subh Prayer Until The Sun Has Risen
text: "When the Prophet prayed Fajr he would remain seated where he had prayed until the sun had risen."

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About What Is Recommended When Sitting After The Subh Prayer Until The Sun Has Risen
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever prays Fajr in congregation, then sits remembering Allah until the sun has risen, then he prays two Rak'ah, then for him is the reward like that of a Hajj and Umrah." He said: "The Messenger of Allah said: 'Complete, complete, complete.'"

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About Looking Around During Salat
text: "The Messenger of Allah would glance toward the right and the left during Salat but he would not turn his neck to look behind him."

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About Looking Around During Salat
narrated: Sa'eed bin Abi Hind narrated from some of the companions of Ikrimah
text: "The Prophet would glance during Salat" and he mentioned a similar narration.

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About Looking Around During Salat
text: "The Messenger of Allah said to me: 'O my son! Beware of looking around during the Salat, for indeed looking around during Salat is destruction. If you must do so, then in the voluntary (prayers), not in the obligatory (prayers).'" (Da'if)

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About Looking Around During Salat
text: "I asked the Messenger of Allah about looking around during the Salat. He said: 'It is a portion which the Shaitan snatches during a man's prayer.'"

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About A Man Who Catches Up With The Imam (While He Is) In Prostration, What Should He Do?
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "When one of you comes to the Salat and (finds) the Imam is in a position, then do as the Imam is doing."

chapter: About It Being Disliked For The People To Wait For The Imam While They Are Standing At The Beginning Of The Prayer
narrated: Abdullah bin Abi Qatadah narrated from his father that
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "When the Iqamah is called for the prayer, then do not stand until you see that I have come out."

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About Praising Allah And Sending Salat Upon The Prophet Before Supplicating
text: "I was prayed and the Prophet, Abu Bakr, and Umar were there, so when I sat, I started off with praising Allah, then sending Salat upon the Prophet, then supplicating for myself. So the Prophet said: 'Ask, your request will be granted, ask, your request will be ranted.'"

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About Scenting The Masjid
text: "The Prophet ordered the construction of Masajid in all Dur and that they be kept clean and scented."

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About Scenting The Masjid
narrated: (Another chain) from Hisham bin Urwah, from his father
text: "That the Prophet ordered." And he mentioned similarly.

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About Scenting The Masjid
narrated: (Another chain) from Hisham from Urwah, from his father
text: "That the Prophet ordered." And he mentioned similarly.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Salat During The Night And The Day Is Two And Two
text: the Prophet said: "The Salat during the night and the day is two and two."

chapter: How The Prophet Performed Voluntary Prayers During The Day
text: "We asked Ali about the prayer of the Messenger of Allah during the day. He said: 'You will not be able to do that.' We said: 'Whoever among is able (he will)?' So he said: 'When the sun appeared over there (east) like it appears here (west) at Asr, the Messenger of Allah would pray two Rak'ah, and when the sun appeared over there (east) like it appears here (west) at Zuhr, he would pray four Rak'ah. And he would pray four before Zuhr and two after it, and four before Asr separating between every two Rak'ah with At-Taslim upon the angels that are close (to Allah) and those who follow them among the believers, and the Muslims."

chapter: How The Prophet Performed Voluntary Prayers During The Day
text: from the Prophet similarly (no. 598).

chapter: About Prayer In A Woman's Cover Being Disliked
text: "The Messenger of Allah would not pray in women's covers."

chapter: (Mentioning) What Is Allowed From Walking And Actions During Voluntary Salat
text: "I came while the Messenger of Allah was praying in the house and the door was closed. So he walked until he opened the door for me, then he returned to his place." And she described the door to be in the direction of the Qiblah.

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About Reciting Two Surat In A Rak'ah
text: "A man asked Abdullah bin Mas'ud about this phrase: 'Ghairi asin' or is it Yasin? So he said: 'You can recite all of the Quran besides this [phrase]?' He said: 'Yes.' He said: 'Indeed a people recite it, disbursing it like Ad-Daqqa are dispersed, without it passing their throats. Indeed I am aware of the surahs that are comparable which the Messenger of Allah would recite together.'" He said: "So we told Alqamah to ask him (what they were). He said: "Twenty surahs from the Mufassal from which the Prophet would combine, reciting every two Surah in a Rak'ah.'"

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About The Virtue Of Walking To The Masjid And What Rewards Are Written For Each Step One Takes
text: the Prophet said: "When a man performs Wudu and he performs his Wudu well, then he leaves to the Salat, and he did not leave - or he said: He had no urge - except for it, then there is not one step that he takes except that Allah raises him a degree from it, or removes a sin from him for it. "

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About Salat After Maghrib Is More Virtuous In The House
narrated: Sa'd bin Ishaq bin Ka'b bin Ujrah narrated from his father from his grandfather who said
text: "The Prophet prayed Maghrib in the Masjid of Banu Abdul-Ashbal, and some people stood to offer voluntary prayers, so the Prophet said: 'This Salat is to be performed by you in your homes.'"

chapter: (What Has Been Mentioned) About A Man Performing Ghusl When He Accepts Islam
text: he accepted Islam and the Prophet ordered him to perform Ghusl with water and Sidr.

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About The Tasmiyah When Entering The Area Of Relieving Oneself
narrated: Ali bin Abi Talid (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "The screen between the eyes of the jinns and nakedness of the children of Adam when one of you enters the area of relieving oneself is saying: 'Bismillah.'"

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned Of The Mark Of This Nation From The Traces Of Prostrations And Purification On The Day Of Resurrection
text: the Prophet said: "On the day of Resurrection, my nation will be radiant from prostrating and shining from Wudu."

chapter: That Starting From The Right Is Recommended In Purification
text: "The Messenger of Allah would love to start with the right side when he purified himself, and when he combed, and when putting his sandals on."

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About The Amount Of Water That IS Acceptable For Wudu
text: the Messenger of Allah said: The acceptable Wudu is with two Ratils of water."

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About Sprinkling Water On The Urine Of A Male Child Of Suckling Age
narrated: Ali bin Abi Talib (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that
text: the Messenger of Allah said, about urine of a male child that suckles: "The urine of the boy is sprinkled, and the girl's urine is washed." Qatadah (one of the narrators) said: "This is so, as long as they do not eat, when they eat, then both of them are washed."

chapter: What has been mentioned about the Prophet (saws) performing Mas-h after the revelation of (Surat) Al-Ma'idah
text: "I saw Jarir bin Abdullah performing Wudu and wiping over his Khuff." He said: "So I asked him: 'What is that?' He said: 'I saw the Prophet performing Wudu and he wiped over his Khuff.' So I said to him: 'Before Al-Ma'idah or after Al-Ma'idah?' He said: 'I did not accept Islam until after Al-Ma'idah.'"]

chapter: What has been mentioned about the Prophet (saws) performing Mas-h after the revelation of (Surat) Al-Ma'idah
text: (Another chain) from Khalid bin Ziyad with similar.

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About The Permission For The Sexually Impure (Junub) Person To Eat And Sleep When He Performs Wudu
text: "The Prophet permitted the Junub when he wanted to eat, drink, or sleep, to perform Wudu like the Wudu for Salat."

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About The Virtue Of The Salat
text: "The Messenger of Allah said to me: 'I seek refuge in Allah for you O Ka'b bin Ujrah from leader that will be after me. Whoever comes to their doors to approve of their lies and supports them in their oppression, then he is not of me and I am not of him, and he will not meet me at the Hawd. And whoever comes to their doors, or he does not come, and he does not approve of their lies and he does not support them in their oppression, then he is from me and I am from him, and he will meet me at the Hawd.  Ka'ab bin Ujrah! Salat is clear proof, and Sawm (fasting) is an impregnable shield, and Sadaqah (charity) extinguishes sins just as water extinguishes fire. O Ka'b bin Ujrah! There is no flesh raised that sprouts from the unlawful except that the Fire is more appropriate for it.'"

chapter: What Has Been Mentioned About The Virtue Of The Salat
text: "Ibn Numair narrated to us from Ubaidullah bin Musa, from Ghalib" with this (Hadith).

chapter: Something Else About That
text: "I heard Abu Umamah saying: I heard the Messenger of Allah giving a Khutbah during the Farewell Hajj, and he said: 'Have Taqwa of your Lord, and pray your five (prayers), and fast your month, and pay the Zakat on your wealth, and obey thosewho are in charge of you, you will enter the Paradise of your Lord.'" He said: "I said to Abu Umamah: 'How old were you when you heard this Hadith (from the Messenger of Allah)?' He said: 'I heard it when I was thirty years old.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related From The Messenger of Allah About The Severe Warning Against Withholding Zakat
text: "I came to the Messenger of Allah while he was sitting in the shade of the Ka'bah." He said: "He saw me approaching and he said: 'They are lost on the Day of Judgment! By the Lord of the Ka'bah!'" He said: "I said t myself: Woe is me! Perhaps something has been revealed about me!'" He said: "So I said: 'Who are they, and may my father and mother be ransomed for you.' So the Messenger of Allah said: 'They are those who have much, except for who says like this, and this, and this and motioned with his hand to his front, and t his right, and to his left.' Then he said: 'By the One in Whose Hand is my soul! No man will die, leaving a camel or a cow that he did not pay Zakat on, except that it will come on the Day of Judgment larger and fatter than it was, they will tread him under their hooves and butt him with their horns, all of them; such that when the last of them has had a turn, the first returns to him, until he is judged before the people.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About: When You Pay The Zakat You Have Fulfilled What Is Required Of You
text: that the Prophet said: "When you pay the Zakat you have fulfilled what is required of you."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: When You Pay The Zakat You Have Fulfilled What Is Required Of You
text: "We used to hope that an intelligent Bedouin would show up to question the Prophet while we were with him. So one while we were with him, a Bedouin came, kneeling in front of the Prophet, and he said: 'O Muhammad, your messenger came to us and told us that you say that Allah sent you.' So the Prophet say: 'Yes.' He said, 'So, (swear) by the One who raised the heaves, and spread out the earth, and erected the mountains; has Allah sent you?' The Prophet said, 'Yes.' He said: 'Your messenger told us that you say that there are five prayers required from us in a day and a night.' The Prophet said, 'Yes.' He said, 'By the One Who sent you, has Allah ordered that you you?' He said, 'Yes.' He said, 'Your messenger told us that you say that we are required to fast for a month out of the year.' He said, 'He told the truth.' He said, 'By the One Who sent you, has Allah ordered that you?' The Prophet said, 'Yes.' He said, 'Your messenger told us that Zakat is required from our wealth.' The Prophet said, 'He told the truth.' He said, 'By the One Who sent you, has Allah ordered you that?' The Prophet said, 'Yes.' He said, 'Your messenger told us that you say that we are required to perform Hajj to Allah's House if able to undertake the journey.' The Prophet said, 'Yes.' He said, 'By the One Who sent you, has Allah Commanded you that?' (The Prophet said:) 'Yes.' So he said: 'By the One Who sent you with the Truth, I will not leave any of them, nor surpass them.' Then he got up quickly (leaving). The Prophet said: 'If the Bedouin told the truth, then he will enter Paradise.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Zakat On Gold And Silver
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "I have exempted charity on horses and slaves. So bring charity for silver, one Dirham for every forty Dirham. There is nothing for me (to collect) on one hundred and ninety Dirham, so when it reaches two hundred, then five Dirham of it (are due)."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Zakat On Camels and Sheep
narrated: Az-Zuhri narrated from Salim from his father
text: "The Messenger of Allah had a letter written about charity, but he had not dispatched it to his governors until he died; he kept it with him along with his sword. When he died, Abu Bakr implemented it until he died, as did Umar until he died. In it was: 'A sheep (is due) on five camels, two sheeps on ten, three sheeps on fifteen, four sheeps for twenty, a Bint Makhad on twenty-five to thirty-five. When it is more than that, then a Bint Labun, (is due, till the number of the camels reaches) forty-five. When it is more than that, then a Hiqqah until sixty. When it is more than that, then a Jadhah until seventy-five. When it is more than one hundred and twenty, then a Hiqqah on every fifty, and a Bint Labun on every forty. For sheep; one sheep (is due) for every forty sheeps until one hundred and twenty. When it is more than that, then two sheeps until two hundred. When it is more than that, then three sheeps until three hundred sheep. When it is more than three hundred sheep, then a sheep on every hundred sheep. Then there is nothing until it reaches four hundred. There is no combining the (property of) individuals nor separating the collective (property) fearing Sadaqah. And fr whatever is mixed together that two own, then they are to refer to the total. Neither an old or defective (animal) may be taken for charity."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Zakat On Cows
text: the Prophet said: "A Tabi or a Tabi'ah (is due) on thirty cows, and a Musinnah (is due) on every forty."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Zakat On Cows
text: "The Prophet sent me to Yemen and ordered me to collect a Tabi or a Tabi'ah on every thirty cows, a Musinnah on every forty, a Dinar for every Halim, or its equivalent of Ma'afir."Abu Eisa said: This Hadith is Hasan. Some of them reported this Hadith from Sufyan, from Al-A'mash, from Abu Wa'il, from Masruq: "The Prophet sent Mu'adh to Yemen and ordered him to take..." and this is more authentic

chapter: What Has Been Related About Zakat On Cows
narrated: Muhammad bin Bash-shar (Al-Abdi) narrated to us,
text: Muhammad bin Ja'far narrated to us, from Shu'bah, from Amr bin Murrah who said: "I asked Abu Ubaidah bin Abdullah: 'Did you remember anything from Abdullah?' He said, 'No'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Take The Choicest Wealth For Charity
text: the Messenger of Allah sent Mu'adh to Yemen and said to him: "You are going to a people from the People of the Book, so invite them to testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah, and that I am the Messenger of Allah. If they comply with that, then inform them that Allah has made five prayers obligatory upon them in a day and a night. If they comply with that, then inform then that Allah has ordained a charity upon their wealth, which is to be taken from the rich among them and given to the poor among them. If they comply with that, then beware of their most precious wealth, and protect yourself from the supplication of the oppressed, for there is no barrier between it and Allah."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Charity Due On Plants, Fruits And Grains
text: the Prophet said: "There is no charity due on less than five camels, and there is no charity due on what is less than five Uqiyah (of silver), and there is no charity due on what is less than five Wasaq."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Charity Due On Plants, Fruits And Grains
narrated: (Another chain of narration that) Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri narrated that
text: the Prophet said (similar t Hadith no. 626).

chapter: What Has Been Related About: There Is No Charity Due On Horses And Slaves
text: the Messenger of Allah said:  "There is no charity due from a Muslim for his horse nor his slave."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Zakat On Honey
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "A Ziqq is due for every ten Ziqq of honey."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Zakat On Honey
text: Nafi said: "Umar bin Adbul-Aziz asked me about charity due on honey, so I said to him: 'We do not have honey that we could give charity from, but Al-Mughirah bin Hakim informed us that he (ﷺ) said: 'There is no charity due on honey.' So Umar said: 'That is fair enough for me.' So he wrote to the people that is be lifted, meaning (the duty of paying it) from them."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: There Is No Zakat On Acquired Wealth Until The Hawl Has Passed
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever acquired wealth, then there is no Zakat on it until the Hawl has passed (while it is in his possession)."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: There Is No Zakat On Acquired Wealth Until The Hawl Has Passed
text: "Whoever acquired wealth, then there is no Zakat on it until the Hawl has passed while it is in his possession."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: There Is No Jizyah Required From The Muslims
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Two Qiblahs in one land are of no benefit, and there is no Jizyah upon the Muslims."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: There Is No Jizyah Required From The Muslims
text: (A similar narration as no. 633.)

chapter: What Has Been Related About Zakat On Jewelry
narrated: Amr bin Al-Harith bin Al-Mustaliq narrated from the nephew of Zainab, the wife of Abdullah (Ibn Mas'ud) who said
text: "The Messenger of Allah delivered a sermon to us, and said: 'O you women! Give charity, even if it is from your jewelry, for indeed you will make up most of the people of Hell on the Day of Judgment.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Zakat On Jewelry
narrated: Amr bin Al-Harith, the nephew of Zainab, the wife of Abdullah, narrated that
text: Zainab, the wife of Abdullah narrated similarly from the Prophet.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Zakat On Jewelry
narrated: Amr bin Shu'aib narrated from his father, from his grandfather,
text: that two women came to the Messenger of Allah, and they each had a bracelet of gold on their forearms. So he said to them: "Have you paid their Zakat?" They said, "No." The Messenger of Allah said to them: "Would you like for Allah to fashion then into two bracelets of Fire?" They said, "No." He said: "Then pay its Zakat."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Zakat On Greens (Produce)
text: Mu'adh had written to the Prophet to ask him about greens - which is "herbs" - so he (ﷺ) said, "There is nothing due on them."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Charity On What Is Watered By Rivers Or Otherwise
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "For what is watered by the heavens and steams, the Ushr is due, and for what is watered by irrigation, half of the  Ushr."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Charity On What Is Watered By Rivers Or Otherwise
narrated: Salim narrated from his father that
text: the Messenger of Allah instituted the Ushr of what was watered by the heavens and steams, or through natural channels, and half of the Ushr for what is watered by irrigation.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Zakat On The Orphan's Wealth
narrated: Amr bin Shu'aib narrated from his father, from his grandfather that
text: the Prophet addressed the people and said: "As for one who is the guardian of an orphan who has wealth, then let him do business with it and not leave it until it becomes consumed by charity."

chapter: What Has Been Related That The Injuries Caused By The Animal Are Without Liability And The Khumus Is Due On Rikaz
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "The injuries caused by the animal are without liability, and mines are without liability, and wells are without liability, and the Khumus is due on Rikaz."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Al-Khars (Assessment)
narrated: Abdur-Rahman bin Mas'ud bin Niyar said
text: "Sahl bin Abi Hathmah came to a gathering of ours, and he narrated that the Messenger of Allah would say: "When you make an assessment, then take it and leave a third, if you do not leave a third, then leave a quarter."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Al-Khars (Assessment)
text: the Prophet said about Zakat on grapevines: "They are to be assessed just as the date-palm is assessed. Then its Zakat is paid in raisins just as the Zakat for the date-palm is paid in dried dates."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The One Who Works In Collecting Sadaqah In Truth
text: "I herd the Messenger of Allah saying: 'The one who works in collecting charity in truth is like the one who fights in the cause of Allah until he returns.'"

chapter: (What Has Been Related) About The One Who Commits Transgression With Charity
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "The one who commits transgression with charity is like the one who does not pay it."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Pleasing The Collector of Charity
text: the Prophet said: "When the charity collector comes to you, then he should not depart from you except while pleased."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Pleasing The Collector of Charity
text: similar (narration to no. 647 with a different chain) from the Prophet.

chapter: What Has Been Related About: Charity Is Taken from The Rich To Be Distributed To The Poor
narrated: Awn bin Abi Jubaitah narrated from his father
text: "The charity collector of the Prophet came to us. So he took the charity from our rich to our poor. I was a orphan boy, so he came to me and gave me a young she-camel from it."

chapter: (What Has Been Reported About) For Whom The Zakat Is Lawful
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever begs from the people while he has what he needs, he will come on the Day of Judgment and his begging with be scratches or lacerations, or bite marks on his face." They said: "O Messenger of Allah! 'How much is it that one needs?' He said: 'Fifty Dirham, or their value in gold.'"

chapter: (What Has Been Reported About) For Whom The Zakat Is Lawful
narrated: Mahmud bin Ghaydin narrated to us
text: Yahya bin Adam narrated to us, Sufyan narrated this Hadith to us from Hakim bin Jubair. So Abdullah bin Uthman, the companion of Shu'bah said to him (Sufyan): "If only someone besides Hakim had narrated this (Hadith)." Sufyan said to him, "So what is with Hakim; Shu'bah would not narrate from him?" He said: "Yes." So Sufyan said: "I heard Zubaid narrating this from Muhammad bin Abdur-Rahman bin Yazid."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: For Whom Charity Is Not Lawful
text: the Prophet said: "Charity is not lawful for the rich nor for the physically fit."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: For Whom Charity Is Not Lawful
text: "During the Farewell Hajj, while the Messener of allah was standing at Arafat, a Bedouin came to him begging while pulling on the edge of his Rida. He gave him something and he left. With that, begging was made unlawful, so the Messenger of Allah said: 'Begging is not lawful for the rich nor for the physically fit, except for the one who is severely poor or in perilous debt. And whoever begs the people (merely) to increase his wealth, then on the Day of Judgment (the wealth he begged for) will be lacerations on his face and heated coals from Hell will be provided for him to eat. Whoever wishes, let him take a little, and whoever wishes, then let him take a lot.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About: For Whom Charity Is Not Lawful
text: There is another chain with a similar narration.

chapter: (What Has Been Related About) The Indebted And Others For Whom Charity Is Lawful
text: "During the time of the Messenger of Allah, a man suffered a loss on fruits that he had sold, resulting in more debt. The Messenger of Allah said: 'Give him charity.' So the people gave him charity but it did not cover his debt. So the Messenger of Allah said to his debtors: 'Take what you have and there is nothing for you but that.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked For The Prophet, His Household, and His Mawali To Accept Charity
narrated: Bahz bin Hakim narrated from his father, from his grandfather who said
text: "When something was brought to him, the Messenger of Allah would ask: 'Is this charity or a gift?' If they said: 'Charity.' He would not eat it, and if they said, 'A gift' he would eat it."

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked For The Prophet, His Household, and His Mawali To Accept Charity
narrated: Abu Rafi (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that
text: the Messenger of Allah sent a man from Banu Makhzun to collect charity, so he said to Abu Rafi: "Accompany me so that perhaps you may have some of it." So he said: "Not until I ask the Messenger of Allah." So he went to the Prophet to ask him, and he said: "Charity is not lawful for us, and to be the Mawda of a people to be the same as them."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Charity For Near Relatives
narrated: Hafsah bint Sirin narrated from Ar-Rabab, from her uncle Salman bin Amir that he related that
text: the Prophet said: "When one of you breaks his fast, then let him do so with dried dates, for they are blessed. Whoever does not find dates, then water, for it is purifying." And he said: "Charity given to the needy is (counted as) charity, and if it is given to relatives it is (counted as) two: charity and nurturing (the ties of kinship)."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: There Is A Duty On Wealthy Aside From Zakat
text: she asked -or, the Prophet was asked - about Zakat, and he said: "Indeed there is a duty on wealthy aside from Zakat." Then he recited this Ayah which is in Al-Baqarah: 'It is not Al-Birr (piety, righteousness) that you turn your faces.' (Al-Baqarah 2:177)

chapter: What Has Been Related About: There Is A Duty On Wealthy Aside From Zakat
text: the Prophet said: "Indeed there is a duty on wealth aside from Zakat."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Charity
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "None gives charity from Tayyib - and Allah does not accept but Tayyib - but that Ar-Rahman accepts it with His Right (Hand). Even if it is a date, it is nurtured in the Hand of Ar-Rahman until it is greater than a mountain, just as one of you nurtures his foal or young camel."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Charity
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Indeed Allah accepts charity, and He accepts it with His Right (Hand) to nurture it for one of you, just like one of you would nuture his foal, until the bite (of food) becomes as large as Uhud." The Book of Allah, the Mighty and Sublime testifies to that: 'He accepts repentance from His worshipers, and accepts charity.'And: 'Allah will destroy Riba and give increase for charity.' (Abu Eisa) said: This Hadith is (Hasan) Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Charity
text: the Prophet was asked which fast was most virtuous after Ramadan? He said: "Sha'ban in honor of Ramadan" He said: "Which charity is best?" He (ﷺ) said: "Charity in Ramadan."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Charity
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Indeed charity extinguishes the Lord's anger and it protects against the evil death."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Right Of The One Asking
narrated: Abdur-Rahman bin Bujaid narrated from his grandmother;
text: Umm Bujaid - and she was one of those who gave the pledge to the Prophet - she said to the Messenger of Allah: "There is a needy person who stands outside my door, but I cannot find anything to give to him." So the Messenger of Allah said to her: "If you do not find anything to give him except a burnt trotter then hand it over to him."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Giving To Those Whose Hearts Are Inclined (Toward Islam)
narrated: Sa'eed bin Al-Musayyab narrated from Safwan bin Umayyah who said
text: "The Messenger of Allah gave to me on the Day of Hunain, and he was the most hated creature to me. But he did not stop giving to me until he was the most loved creature to me."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The One Who Gives Charity (Then) Inheriting His Charity
narrated: Abdullah bin Buraidah narrated from his father
text: "I was sitting with the Prophet when a woman came to him and said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I gave a slave girl to my mother in charity and she died.' He said: 'Your reward is already established, and your right to inherit her has returned it (that Sadaqah) to you.' She said: 'O Messenger of Allah! There was a month of fasting due on her, shall I perform the fast for her?' He said: 'Fast on her behalf.' She said: 'O Messenger of Allah! She never performed Hajj, shall I perform Hajj for her?' He said: 'Yes, perform Hajj on her behalf.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Take Back Charity
text: Umar gave a horse to be used in the cause of Allah. Then he saw it being sold, so he wanted to buy it, but the Prophet said: "Do not take back what you have given in charity."

chapter: What Has Been Related About (Giving) Charity On Behalf Of The Dead
narrated: Ikrimah narrated from Ibn Abbas that
text: a man said: "O Messenger of Allah! My mother died, will it benefit her if I give charity on her behalf?" He said: 'Yes.' He said: 'I have a Makhraf, so bear witness that I have given it in charity on her behalf.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Woman Spending From Her Husband's House
text: "During a sermon of his in the year of the Farewell Hajj, I heard the Messenger of Allah say: 'A woman is not to spend anything from her husbands house without her husband's permission.' They said: 'O Messenger of Allah! What about food?' He said: 'That is our most virtuous wealth.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Woman Spending From Her Husband's House
text: the Prophet said: "When a woman gives in charity from her husband's house, she will get the reward for it, and for her husband is the same as that, and for the trustee is the same as that. The reward of each them will not be decreased at all by the reward of the other, for him is what he earned, and for her is what she spent."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Woman Spending From Her Husband's House
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "When a woman gives from her husband's home, with a good heart, not to spoil it, then she will get a reward similar to his, for her is the good she intended - and the same is for the trustee."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Sadaqat al-Fitr
text: "We would give Zakat Al-Fitr - when the Messenger of Allah was among us - as a Sa of food, or a Sa of barely, or a Sa of dried dates, or a Sa of raisins, or a Sa of cheese. So we did not stop paying it (like that) until Mu'awiyah arrived in Al-Madinah and talked (about it). Among the things he addressed the people with, he said: 'I see that two Mudd of the wheat of Ash-Sham are equal to a Sa of dried dates.' So the people followed that." Abu Sa'eed said: "I will not stop giving it in the manner that I had been giving it."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Sadaqat al-Fitr
narrated: Amr bin Shu'aib narrated from his grandfather that
text: the Prophet sent a caller in the roads of Makkah proclaiming "Sadaqatul-Fitr is required upon every Muslim, male or female, free or slave, young or old; it is two Mudd of wheat or its equivalent of a Sa of food."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Sadaqat al-Fitr
text: "The Messenger of Allah made Sadaqatul-Fitr an obligation upon the male and female, the free and the bondsmen, as a Sa of dried dates or a Sa of barley." He said: "So the people equated that to half a Sa of wheat."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Sadaqat al-Fitr
text: "The Messenger of Allah made Sadaqatul-Fitr of Ramadan an obligation - a Sa of dried dates or a Sa of barley - required upon every free person and slave, male and female among the Muslims."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: It Is To Be Paid Before The Salat
text: the Messenger of Allah would order paying the Zakat before going to the Salat on the day of Fitr.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Paying Zakat In Advance
text: "Al-Abbas asked the Messenger of Allah about paying his charity (Zakat) in advance before its time is due (by being in possession for a whole year), he permitted him to do that."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Paying Zakat In Advance
text: the Prophet said to Umar: "We have taken this year's Zakat from Al-Abbas in the previous year."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Prohibition Of Begging
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that he heard
text: the Messenger of Allah saying: "For one of you to go out early to gather firewood and carry it on his back so that he can give charity from it and be free of need from the people, is better for him than to ask a man who may give that to him or refuse. Indeed the upper hand (giving) is more virtuous than the lower hand (receiving), and begin with (those who are) your dependants."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Prohibition Of Begging
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Asking is a labor that toils on a man's face, except if a man asks for something from the Sultan (ruler), or he asks for something that he cannot do without."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of The Month Of Ramadan
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "On the first night of the month of Ramadan, the Shayatin are shackled, the jinns are restrained, the gates of the Fires are shut such that no gate among them would be opened. The gates of Paradise are opened such that no gate among them would be closed, and a caller calls: 'O seeker of the good; come near!' and 'O seeker of evil; stop! For there are those whom Allah frees from the Fire.' And that is every night."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of The Month Of Ramadan
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever fasts Ramadan and stands (in the night prayer) for it out of faith and seeking a reward (from Allah), he will be forgiven what preceded of his sins. Whoever stands (in the night prayer) on the Night of Al-Qadr out of faith and seeking a reward (from Allah), he will be forgiven what preceded of his sins."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: Do Not Precede The Month With Fasting
text: the Prophet said: "Do not precede the month with a day nor with two days, unless that fast falls on a day that one of you would have (normally) fasted. Fast with its sighting and break fast with its sighting, and if it is cloudy, then count for thirty days, and then break (the fast)."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: Do Not Precede The Month With Fasting
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Do no precede the month of Ramadan by fasting a day or two before it, unless it is the case of a man who normally performs some fast, then let him fast it."

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Fast The Day OF Doubt
text: "We were with Ammar bin Yasir when a roasted sheep was brought and he said: 'Eat.' Someone among the people said: 'I am fasting.' So Ammar said: 'Whoever fasts on a day in which there is doubt, then he has disobeyed Abul-Qasim (ﷺ)."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Counting The (Appearances OF) The Crescent Of Sha'ban For Ramadan
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Count the (the appearances of) the crescent of Sha'ban for Ramadan."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: Fasting And Breaking Fast Are Based Upon The Sighting (Of The Crescent)
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Do not fast before Ramadan. Fast with its sighting, and break fast with its sighting, and if it is obscured from you, then complete thirty days."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: The Month Is Twenty-Nine Days
text:
"What I fasted with the Prophet that was twenty-nine (days), was more than what we fasted that was thirty."
(He said): There are narrations on this topic from `Umar, Abu Hurairah, `A'isha, Sa`d bin Abi Waqqas, Ibn `Abbas, Ibn `Umar, Anas, Jabir, Umm Salamah, Abu Bakrah, that the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The month is twenty nine (days)."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: The Month Is Twenty-Nine Days
text: "The Messenger of Allah vowed to stay away from his wives for a month, so he stayed in a loft for twenty-nine days. They said: 'O Messenger of Allah, your vow was for a month,' so he said: 'The month is twenty-nine (days).'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Fasting Based Upon Testimony
text: "A Bedouin came to the Prophet and said: 'I have seen the crescent.' So he said: 'Do you testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah? Do you testify that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'Yes.' So he said: 'O Bilal! Announce to the people that they should fast tomorrow.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About: The Two Months Of Eid Will Not Both Be Deficient
narrated: Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Bakrah narrated from his father that
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "The two months of Eid will not both be deficient: Ramadn and Dhul-Hijjah."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: For The People OF Every Land There Is A Sighting
text: "Kuraib informed me that Umm Al-Fadl bin Al-Harith sent him to Mu'awiyah in Ash-Sham. He said: 'So I arrived in Ash-Sham and finished her errand, and I saw the crescent of Ramadan while I was in Ash-Sham. We saw the crescent on the night of Friday. Then I arrived in Al-Madinah at the end of the month. Ibn Abbas was questioning me, then he mentioned the crescent and he said: "When did you see the crescent?" I said: "We saw it n the night of Friday." He said: "Did you see it on the night of Friday?" I said: "The people saw it, so they fasted, and Mu'awiyah fasted." He said: "But we saw it on the night of Saturday, so we will not stop fasting until we complete thirty days or we see it." So I said: "Is not the sighting and fasting of Mu'awiyah enough for you?" He said: "This is not how the Messenger of Allah ordered us."

chapter: What Has Been Related About What It Is Recommended To Break The Fast With
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever has dried dates, then let him break the fast with that, and whoever does not, then let him break the fast with water, for indeed water is purifying."

chapter: What Has Been Related About What It Is Recommended To Break The Fast With
narrated: Salman bin Amir Ad-Dabbi narrated that
text: the Prophet said: "When one of you breaks his fast, then let him do so with dried dates. And whoever does not find dates, then water, for it is purifying."

chapter: What Has Been Related About What It Is Recommended To Break The Fast With
text: "The Messenger of Allah would break the fast with fresh dates before performing Salat. If there were no fresh dates then (he would break the fast) with dried dates, and if there were no dried dates then he would take a few sips of water."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: (The Fast Is The Day The People Fast And) The Breaking Of The Fast IS The Day When the People Break The Fast, And The Sacrifice Is The Day The People Sacrifice
text: the Prophet said: "The fast is the day the people fast, the breaking of the fast is the day the people break their fast, and the sacrifice is the day the people sacrifice."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: When The Night Advances And The Day Retreats, Then The Fasting Person Break The Fast
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "When the night advances and the day retreats, and the sun is hidden, then the fast is to be broken."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Hastening To Break The Fast
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "The people will remain upon goodness as long as they hasten to break the fast."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Hastening To Break The Fast
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Allah, Mighty and Sublime is He, said: 'Those of My worshippers who are most beloved to me are the quickest to break their fast.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Hastening To Break The Fast
text: (A Hadith similar to no. 700 with a different chain).

chapter: What Has Been Related About Hastening To Break The Fast
text: "Masruq and I entered upon Aishah and we said: 'O Mother of the Believers! There are two men from the Companions of Muhammad, one of them hastens to break the fasts and he hastens to perform Salat. The other delays breaking the fast and he delays the Salat.' She said: 'Which of them hastens to break the fast and hastens to perform the Salat?' We said that it was Abdullah bin Mas'ud. She said: 'This is how the Messenger of Allah did it.' And the other was Abu Musa."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Delaying The Sahar
text: Zaid bin Thabit said: "We ate Sahar with the Messenger of Allah, then we stood for the Salat." I (Anas) said: "How long was that?" He said: "About the lengthy of fifty Ayahs."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Delaying The Sahar
text: (Another chain) except that he said: "About the length for reciting fifty Ayahs."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Clarifying Al-Fajr
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Eat and drink, and do not be disturbed by the rising glow, eat and drink until the redness appears to you on the horizon."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Clarifying Al-Fajr
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Do not let the Adhan of Bilal prevent you from your Sahar, nor the drawn out Fajr, but the Fajr that spreads on the horizon."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Severity Of Back Biting For The Fasting Person
text: the Prophet said: "Whoever does not leave false speech, and acting according to it, then Allah is not in any need of him leaving his food and his drink."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Sahar
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Partake of Sahar, for indeed there is a blessing in the Sahar."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Sahar
text: (similar to no. 708) from the Prophet.

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Fast While Traveling
text: "The Messenger of Allah went to Makkah in the Year of the Conquest, so he fasted until he reached Kura Al-Ghamim and the people were fasting with him. Then it was said to him: 'The fast has become difficult for the people, and they are watching you to see what you will do.' So after Asr, he called for a cup of water and drank it while the people were looking at him. Some of them broke the fast while some of them continued their fasting. It was conveyed to him that people were still fasting, so he said: "Those are the disobedient.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Permission To Fast While Traveling
text: Hamzah bin Amr Al-Aslami asked the Messenger of Allah about fasting while traveling, and he fasted regularly. So the Messenger of Allah said: 'If you wish then fast, and if you wish then break (the fast).'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Permission To Fast While Traveling
text: "We were on a journey with the Messenger of Allah during the month of Ramadan. No one objected to the fast of the one fasting nor the fast breaking of the one who broke his fast."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Permission To Fast While Traveling
text: "We were on a journey with the Messenger of Allah. Some of us were fasting and some of us broke their fast. The one who broke their fast had no objection to the one who fasted, and the one who fasted had no objection to the one who broke his fast. They saw that whoever had the strength to fast then that was good, and whoever was weak, then breaking it was better."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Permission For The One At War To Break The Fast
narrated: Ma'mar bin Abi Huyaiyah narrated that
text: he asked Ibn Al-Musaiyab about fasting on a journey, so he narrated to him that Umar bin Al-Khattab said: "We fought in two battles along with the Messenger of Allah during Ramadan; the Day of Badr, and the Conquest (of Makkah), so we broke our fast during them."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Permission For The Pregnant And Breast-Feeding Women To Break The Fast
narrated: Anas bin Malik, a man from Banu Abdullah bin Ka'b said
text: "Some cavalry man of the Messenger of Allah came galloping upon us, so I came to the Messenger of Allah and found him having lunch. He said: "Come and eat." I said: 'I am fasting.' So he said: 'Come and I will narrate to you about the fast - or fasting. Indeed Allah Most High lifted (the fast and) half of the Salat from the traveler, and (He lifted) the fast - or fasting - from the pregnant person, or the breast-feeding person.' And by Allah! The Prophet said both of them or one of them. So woe to me! For I did not eat from the meal of the Prophet."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Fasting On Behalf Of The Dead
text: "A woman came to the Prophet and said: 'My sister died while she had two consecutive months of fasting due.' So he said: 'Do you not see that if there was a debt due from your sister then you would have to pay it?' She said: 'Yes.' He said: 'Then the right of Allah is more appropriate.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Fasting On Behalf Of The Dead
text: (A Hadith similar to no. 716 with a different chain.)

chapter: (What Has Been Related About The Atonement)
text: the Prophet said: "Whoever died while he had a month to fast, then a needy person should be fed on his behalf in place of every day."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Fasting Person Who Is Overcome By Vomiting
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Three things do not break the fast of the fasting person: Cupping, vomiting, and the wet dream."

chapter: What Has Been Related About One Who Vomits Purposely
text: the Prophet said: "Whoever is overcome by vomiting, then he is not required to make up (the fast), and whoever vomits on purpose, then he must make it up."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Fasting Person Eating Or Drinking Forgetfully
narrated:
Abu Hurairah narrated that
the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Whoever eats or drinks forgetfully, then he has not broken (the fast), for it was only a provision that Allah provided for him."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Fasting Person Eating Or Drinking Forgetfully
text: (Another chain) with the same or similar (Hadith as no. 721).

chapter: What Has Been Related About Breaking The Fast On Purpose
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever breaks the fast during Ramadan without an allowance or illness, then if he fasted for all time, his fasting would not make up for it."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Atonement For Breaking The Fast During Ramadan
text: A man came and said: "O Messenger of Allah; I am ruined!" He said: "What has ruined you?" He said: "I had sexual relations with my wife during Ramadan." He said: "Are you able to free a slave?" He said, "No." He said: "Then are you able to fast for two consecutive months?" He said, "No." He said: "Then are you able to feed sixty needy people?" He said, "No." He said: "Sit." So he sat. A big basket full of dates was brought to the Prophet, and he said: "Give it in charity." So he said: "There is no one needier than us between its two mountains." So the Prophet laughing until his pre-molar teeth appeared, and he said: "Then take it to feed your family."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Siwak For The Fasting Person
narrated: Abdullah bin Amir bin Rabi'ah narrated from his father who said
text: "I saw the Prophet - (a number of times) such that I was not able to count - using the Siwak while he was fasting."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Kuhl For The Fasting Person
text: a man came to the Prophet and said: "My eyes are bothering me, can I use Kuhl while I am fasting?" He said: "Yes."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Kissing For The Fasting Person
text: "The Prophet would kiss during the month of fasting."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Embracing For The Fasting Person
text: "The Messenger of Allah would fondle me while he was fasting, and he had the most control among you of his limb (li irbihi)."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Embracing For The Fasting Person
text: "The Messenger of Allah would kiss and fondle while he was fasting, and he had the most control among you of his limbs."
