text: The Messenger of Alllah said: "(Real) Patience is at the first stroke of the calamity."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Kissing The Dead
narrated: Al-Qasim bin Muhammad narrated from Aishah
text: "The Prophet kissed Uthman bin Maz'un when he died, and he was crying." Or, he (one of the narrators) said: "His eyes were brimming with tears."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Washing The Dead
text: "One of the daughters of the Prophet died, so he said: 'Wash her an odd number of times, three, or five, or more than that as you see fit. Wash her with water and Sidr, and in the last (washing) add camphor, or something from camphor. When you are finished then inform me.' When we finished we informed him so he gave us his waist-sheet and said 'Wrap her in it.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Using Musk when Washing The Dead
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "The best scent is the perfume of musk."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Using Musk when Washing The Dead
text: The Prophet was asked about musk and he said: "It is the best of your perfumes."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Performing Ghusl For The One Who Has Washed The Deceased
text: The Prophet said: "Ghusl for one who washed him and Wudu for one who carried himm."

chapter: What Has Been Related About What Is Recommended For Shrouding
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Wear the white among your garments, for indeed they are among the best of your garments, and shroud your dead in them."

chapter: Ordering The Believer To Shroud His Brother With The Best
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "When one of you shrouds his brother, then let him use the best of his shrouds."

chapter: What Has Been Related About How Many Shrouds Were Used For The Prophet
narrated: Hisham bin Urwah narrated from his father that
text: Aishah said: "The Prophet was shrouded in three white Yemeni cloths, there was no shirt nor turban among them." He said: "So they mentioned the saying of the others to Aishah, that there were two garments and a Habir Burd. She said: 'A Burd was brought, but they refused it and they did not shroud him in it.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About How Many Shrouds Were Used For The Prophet
text: "The Messenger of Allah shrouded Hamzah bin Abdul-Muttalib in one cloth of Namirah."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Preparing Food For The Family OF The Deceased
text: "When the news of the death of Ja'far came, the Prophet said: 'Prepare some food for the family of Ja'far, for indeed something has happened to them that will keep them busy.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About the Prohibition Of Slapping The Cheeks And Tearing The Clothes During A Calamity
text: The Prophet said: "He who slaps (his) cheeks, tears (his) clothes and calls with the call of the Jahliyyah is not one of us."

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Wail
text: "A man died among the Ansar named Qarazah bin Ka'b, and he was being wailed over. So Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah came and ascended the Minbar. He uttered thanks and praise to Allah and said: "As for the gravity of wailing in Islam, indeed I heard the Messenger of Allah saying: 'The one who is wailed over is punished as long as he is being wailed over.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Wail
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "There are four matters in my nation that are from the matters of Jahiliyyah which the people will not leave: Wailing, slandering one's lineage, Al-Adwa - a camel gets mange, so one hundred camels get mange - but who gave the first camel mange? And Al-Anwa (saying): "We got rain because of this or that celestial positioning.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Cry Over The Deceased
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "The deceased is punished for the crying of his family over him."

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Cry Over The Deceased
narrated: Musa bin Abi Musa Al-Asha'ri narrated from his father that
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "No one dies and they stand over him crying and saying: 'O what a great man he was! O how respectful he was!' except that two angels are appointed for him to poke him (saying): 'Is that you?'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Permission For Crying Over The Deceased
narrated: Yahya bin Abdur-Rahman narrated from Ibn Umar that
text: The Prophet said: "The deceased is punished for the crying of his family over him." So, Aishah said: "May Allah have mercy upon him. He has not lied, but he is mistaken. It is only that the Messenger of Allah said about a Jewish man who died: 'The deceased is being punished and his family is crying over him.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Permission For Crying Over The Deceased
text: "The Prophet took Abdur-Rahman bin Awf by the hand and went with him to his son Ibrahim. He found him in his last breaths, so he took him and put him on his lap and cried. Abdur-Rahman said to him: 'You cry? Didn't you prohibit (your followers) from crying?' He said: 'No. But I prohibited two foolish immoral voices: A voice during a calamity while clawing at one's face and tearing one's clothes, and Shaitan's scream.'" And there is more that is stated in the Hadith.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Permission For Crying Over The Deceased
narrated: Abdullah bin Abi Bakr - and he is Ibn Muhammad bin Amr bin Hazm - narrated from his father, that
text: Amrah informed him that she heard Aishah, while it was being mentioned to her that Ibn Umar had said that the deceased would be punished for the crying of the living (over him). So Aishah said: 'May Allah forgive Abu Abdur-Rahman. He has not lied, but he is mistaken in the understanding. Rather, the Messenger of Allah passed by a Jewish woman who was being cried over, so he said: 'They are crying over her and she is being punished in her grave.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Walking In Front Of (The Deceased Being Carried For) The Funeral
text: His father said: "I saw the Prophet, Abu Bakr, and Umar walking in front of the funeral."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Walking In Front Of (The Deceased Being Carried For) The Funeral
narrated: Salim bin Abdullah narrated that his father said
text: "I saw the Prophet, Abu Bakr, and Umar walking in front of the funeral."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Walking In Front Of (The Deceased Being Carried For) The Funeral
text: "The Prophet, Abu Bakr, and Umar would walk in front of the funeral." Az-Zuhri said: "Salim informed me that his father would walk in front of the funeral."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Walking In Front Of (The Deceased Being Carried For) The Funeral
text: "The Messenger of Allah would walk in front of the funeral, as did Abu Bakr, Umar and Uthman."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Walking Behind (The Deceased Being Carried For) The Funeral
narrated: Yahya, the Imam of Banu Taimillah, narrated from Abu Majid
text: From Abdullah bin Mas'ud who said: "We asked the Messenger of Allah about walking behind the funeral. He said: 'Less than a trot. For if he was good, then you will be hastening him to it (goodness), and if he was evil, then it id only an inhabitant of the Fire that is being taken away."  The funeral is (to be) followed. The one who precedes it shall not have the reward of those who follow it.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Ride Behind The Funeral
text: "We went with the Prophet (following) a funeral. He saw people riding so he said: 'Are you not ashamed? Indeed Allah's angels are on their feet, while you are on the backs of your beasts'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Permitting That
text: "We were with the Prophet (following) the funeral of Ibn Ad-Dahbah, and he was on a horse that was walking quickly, and we were around him, and he was trotting."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Permitting That
text: "The Prophet followed the funeral of Ibn Ad-Dahdah walking and he returned on horseback."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Haste For The Funeral (Procession)
text: The Prophet said: "Hurry up with the funeral (procession) for if it was good, you are advancing it to good, and if it was evil, then you are taking it off your necks."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Those Killed At Uhud, and Mention of Hamzah
text: "The Messenger of Allah came to Hamza on the Day of Uhud, he stood over him and saw that he had been mutilated. He said: Had it not been that Safiyyah would be distressed, then I would have left him to be eaten by the beasts until he was gathered on the Day of Judgment from their stomachs." He said: "Then he called for a Namirah to shroud him with. When it was extended over his head, it left his feet exposed, and when it was extended over his feet, it left his head exposed." He said: "There were many dead and few cloths." He said: "One, two and three men were shrouded in one cloth and buried in one grave." He said: "So the Messenger of Allah was asking which of them knew the most Quran, so he could put him toward the Qibalh." He said: "So the Messenger of Allah buried them and he did not perform (funeral prayers) for them."

chapter: Something Else (Regarding The Sunnah For Visiting The Sick And Attending The Funeral)
text: "The Messenger of Allah would visit the sick, attend the funerals, ride a donkey, accept the invitation of a slave, and on the Day of Banu Quraizah he was on a donkey muzzled with a cord of fibers and a pack-saddle made of fibers."

chapter: Where Are The Prophets To Be Buried?
text: "When the Messenger of Allah died, they disagreed over where to bury him. So Abu Bakr said: 'I heard the Messenger of Allah saying something which I have not forgotten, he said: "Allah does not take (the life of ) a Prophet except at the location in which He wants him to be buried.'" So they buried him at the spot of his bed."

chapter: Something Else (Regarding The Order To Mention Good Things About The Deceased And To Refrain From Mentioning Their Evil)
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Mention good things about your dead, and refrain from (mentioning) their evil."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Sitting Before The Deceased Is Placed In The Grave
text: "When the Messenger of Allah follows a corpse, he would not sit until (the deceased was) placed in the Lahd. A rabbi came upon him and said: 'This is what we do, O Muhammad'" He said: "So the Messenger of Allah sat, and he said: 'Differ from them.'"

chapter: The Virtue In The Calamity When One Patiently Seeks A Reward For It
text: "I buried my son Sinan and Abu Talhah Al-Khawlani was sitting on the rim of the grave. When I wanted to leave he took me by my hand and said: 'Shall I not inform you of some good new O Abu Sinan!' I said: 'Of course.' He said: 'Ad-Dahhak bin Abdur-Rahman bin Arzab narrated to me, from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari: "The Messenger of Allah said: 'When a child of the slave (of Allah) died, Allah says to the angels: "Have you taken the fruits of his work." They reply: "Yes." So He says: "What did My slave say?" They reply: "He praised you and mentioned that to You is the return." So Allah says: "Build a house in Paradise for My slave, and name it 'the house of praise.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Takbir For the Funeral (Prayer)
text: "The Prophet prayed and in the funeral prayer he for An-Najashi, said four Takbir."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Takbir For the Funeral (Prayer)
text: "Zaid bin Arqam would say four Takbir for our funerals. (Once) he said five Takbir for a funeral so we asked him about that and he said: 'The Messenger of Allah would say those Takbir.'"

chapter: What Is To Be Said In The Salat For The Deceased
text: from his father who said: "When the Messenger of Allah would perform  the Salat for the funeral he would said: (Allahammaghfir li-hayyina wa mayyittina, wa shahidina wa gha'ibina, wa saghirina wa kabirina, wa dhakarina wa unthana) 'O Allah! Forgive our living and our deceased, our present and our absent, our young and our old, our male and our female.'"

chapter: What Is To Be Said In The Salat For The Deceased
text: "I heard the Messenger of Allah, while he was performing Salat for a deceased person. I could hear him saying in his prayer: (Allahummagfir lahu, war hamhu, waghsilhu bil-baradi (waghsilhu) kama yughsaluth-thawb) 'O Allah! Forgive him, have mercy upon him, and wash him with (snow or ice) (and wash him) just as a garment is washed.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Recitation OF Fatihatil-Kitab For The Funeral (Prayer)
text: "The Prophet recited Fatihatil-Kitab for a funeral (prayer)." (Da'if Jiddan)

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Recitation OF Fatihatil-Kitab For The Funeral (Prayer)
narrated: Talhah bin Abdullah bin Awf narrated
text: "Ibn Abbas performed Salat for a funeral and he recited Fatihatil-Kitab. So I asked him about it and he said: 'It is from the Sunnah' or, 'From the completeness of the Sunnah.'"

chapter: How To Perform Salat For The Deceased, And Interceding For Him
text: "When Malik bin Hubairah performed Salat for a funeral and the people were few he would divide them into three groups (rows) then say: 'The Messenger of Allah said: "For whomever three rows perform Salat, then it is granted."

chapter: How To Perform Salat For The Deceased, And Interceding For Him
text: The Prophet said: "No one among the Muslim dies, and Salat is performed for him by a community of Muslims reaching one hundred, and they intercede (supplicate) for him, except that their intercession for him is accepted." In his narration, 'Ali bin Hujr said: "One hundred or more than that."

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Pray The Funeral Salat While The Sun Is Rising And While It Is Setting
text: "There are three times that the Messenger of Allah prohibited us from performing Salat in, burying our dead in: When the sun's rising appears until it has risen up; when the sun is at the zenith until it passes, and when the sun begins its setting, until it has set."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Salat For (The Funerals Of) Children
text: The Prophet said: "The rider is to be behind the funeral (procession), and the walker where he wishes, and the child should be prayed over."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Not Performing The Salat For The Child Until One Is Sure He Was Alive At Birth
text: The Prophet said: "The child is not prayed over, nor does he inherit, nor is he inherited from until one is sure he was alive at birth."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Salat For The Deceased In The Masjid
text: "The Messenger of Allah performed Salat over Suhail bin Al-Baida in the Masjid."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Where The Imam Is To Stand For the Man And For The Women
text: "I prayed for the funeral of a man with Anas bin Malik, so he stood parallel to his head. Then they came with the body of a woman from the Quraish. They said: 'O Abu Hamzah perform the prayer for her.' So he stood parallel to her waist. Al-Ala bin Ziyad said to him: 'Is this how you saw the Messenger of Allah standing in the place for the funeral as you did for her, and for a place that you stood for the man?' He said: 'Yes.' When he was finished he said: 'Remember (this).'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Where The Imam Is To Stand For the Man And For The Women
text: "The Prophet prayed over a woman, so he stood at her middle."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Not Performing The (Funeral) Salat For The Martyr
narrated: Abdur-Rahman bin Ka'b bin Malik narrated that
text: Jabir bin Abdullah informed him that the Prophet had put two men together in one cloth from those who were killed at (the battle of) Uhud, then he said: "Which of them memorized the more of the Qur'an?" When one of them was indicated to him, he put him in the Lahd (first) and said: "I am a witness for those people on the Day of Judgment." And he ordered that they be buried in their blood, and that they not be prayed over, nor washed.

chapter: What Has Been Related About (Performing) The (Funeral) Salat At The Grave
text: Ash-Sha'bi said: "I was informed by one who saw the Prophet: He (ﷺ) saw a solitary grave, s he lined his Companions (behind him) to pray over it." It was said to him (Ash-Sha'bi): "Who informed you?" He said: "Ibn Abbas."

chapter: What Has Been Related About (Performing) The (Funeral) Salat At The Grave
text: "Umm Sa'd died while the Prophet was absent. So when he arrived he performed Salat over her, and a month had already passed."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Prophet Performing Salat For (The Death Of) An-Najashi
text: the Prophet said: "Indeed your brother An-Najashi has died. So stand to perform Salat for him." He (Imran) said: "We stood and lined up just as the deceased is lined up for, and we prayed for him just as the deceased is prayed for."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Salat For A Funeral
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever performs the funeral prayer then he will get a reward equal to a Qirat. Whoever follows it until it is buried then he will get a reward equal to two Qirat, one of them, or the least of them, is similar to Uhud (mountain)." This was mentioned to Ibn Umar, so he sent a message to Aishah to ask her about that, and she said: "Abu Hurairah has told the truth." So Ibn Umar said: "We have missed many Qirat."

chapter: Something Else (About The Extend Of What Is Acceptable (To Fulfill The Obligation) For Following The Funeral And Carrying It)
text: "I accompanied Abu Hurairah for ten years, and I heard him saying: 'I heard the Messenger of Allah saying: "Whoever follows a funeral, and carries it three times, then he has fulfilled the right that is required from him."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Standing For The Funeral (Procession)
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whenever you see a funeral (procession), stand up until it goes ahead of you or it is put down."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Standing For The Funeral (Procession)
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whenever you see a funeral (procession), stand up (for it). Whoever follows it, then do not sit down until it is put down."

chapter: Regarding Permission To Not Stand For It
narrated: Mas'ud bin Al-Hakim narrated that standing for the funeral (procession) until it is put down was mentioned, and 'Ali bin Abi Talib mentioned and 'Ali bin Abi Talib said
text:
"The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) stood, then (later) he sat". (Sahih)


There are narrations on this topic from Al-Hasan bin 'Ali, and Ibn 'Abbas. 


Abu Eisa said: The Hadith of 'Ali is a Hasan Sahih Hadith, regarding which there are narrations from four of the Tabi'in narrating it from each other. This is acted upon according to some of the people of knowledge. Ash-Shafi'i said: "This is the most correct thing on this topic" This Hadith abrogates first Hadith: "Whenever you see a funeral (procession), stand up [for it]."


Ahmad said: "If he wants, he stands, and if he wants, he does not stand." His proof is that it has been reported that the Prophet (ﷺ) stood, then sat, and this is what Ishaq bin Ibrahim said.


(Abu Eisa said:) As for the saying of 'Ali: The Prophet (ﷺ) stood for the funeral and then sat, he means that the Prophet (ﷺ) would stand when he saw a funeral (procession), then he did not do so later, so he would not stand when he saw the funeral (procession).

chapter: What has been related about the saying of the Prophet (saws): The Lahd is for us and the Hole is for other than us
text: The Prophet said: "The Lahd is for us and the hole is for other than us."

chapter: What Has Been Related About What Is Said When Putting The Deceased In The Grave
text: "When he Prophet put the deceased in the grave" He said: And Abu Khalid (one of the narrators) said [one time]: "When he placed the deceased in the Lahd" - "He said one time: 'In the Name of Allah, by His command and upon the Millah of the Messenger of Allah.' and one time he said: 'In the Name of Allah, by His command and upon the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The One Cloth That Is Placed Under The Deceased In The Grave
text: His father said: "The one who made the Lahd in the grave of the Messenger of Allah was Abu Talhah. And the one who placed the velvet cloth under him was Shuqran a freed slave of Messenger of Allah."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The One Cloth That Is Placed Under The Deceased In The Grave
text: "A red velvet cloth was placed in the grave of the Prophet."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Leveling The Grave
text: "Ali said to Abu Al-Hayyaj Al-Asadi: 'I am dispatching you with what the Prophet dispatched me: "That you not leave an elevated grave without leveling it, nor an image without erasing it."

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Tread On Graves, Sit On Them, (And Pray Towards Them)
text: The Prophet said: "Do not sit on the graves nor perform Salat towards them."

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Tread On Graves, Sit On Them, (And Pray Towards Them)
text: from the Prophet, similar (to no. 1050), but it does not contain "From Abu Idris" and this is what is correct.

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Plaster Graves And Write On Them
text: "The Messenger of Allah prohibited plastering graves, writing on them, building over them, and treading on them."

chapter: What A Man Is To Say When He Enters A Graveyard
text: "The Messenger of Allah passed by the graves of Al-Madinah, so he turned his face towards them and said: (As-Salamu alaikum ya ahlul-qubur! Yaghfirul-lahu lana wa lakun, antum salafuna wa nahnu bil-athar.) 'Peace be upon you O inhabitants of the grave! May Allah forgive us and you; you are our predecessors and we are to follow you.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Permission To Visit The Graves
narrated: Sulaiman bin Buraidah narrated from his father that
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "I had prohibited you from visiting the graves. But Muhammad was permitted to visit the grave of his mother: so visit them, for they will remind you of the Hereafter."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Women Visiting Graves
text: "Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Bakr died in Al-Hubshi" He said: "He was carried to Makkah to be buried there. So when Aishah arrived she went to the grave of Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Bakr and she said: "We were like two drinking companions of Jadhimah for such a long time that they would say: 'They will never part.' So when we were separated it was as if I and Malik - due to the length of unity - never spent a night together."

chapter: What has been related about it being disliked for women to visit the graves
text: "Indeed the Messenger of Allah cursed the women who visit the graves."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Burial During The Night
text: "The Prophet entered a grave during the night, so a torch was lit for him. He took it (the deceased) in from the direction of the Qiblah, and he said: 'May Allah have mercy upon you, you were often invoking (Allah) by reciting the Qur'an.' And he said: 'Allahu Akbar four times."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Praise For The Deceased
text: "A funeral (procession) passed by the Messenger of Allah and they were praising him with good statements. So the Messenger of Allah said: 'Granted.' Then he said: 'You are Allah's witnesses on the earth.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Praise For The Deceased
text: "I arrived in Al-Madinah and while I was sitting with Umar bin Al-Khattab they passed by with a funeral, over (a person) whom they were praising with good. Umar said: 'Granted.' I said to Umar: 'What is granted?' He said: 'I said as the Messenger of Allah said: "There is no Muslim about whom three bear witness, except that he is granted Paradise." He said: "And two (as well)." He said: 'We did not ask the Messenger of Allah about one.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Rewards For One Whose Child Died Before Him
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Any Muslim who has lost three of his children will not be touched by the Fire, except for what will fulfill the oath."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Rewards For One Whose Child Died Before Him
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever has three that precede him (in death) while they did not reach the age of puberty, then they will be a well-fortified fortress for him against the Fire."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Rewards For One Whose Child Died Before Him
text: "I heard my grandfather, the father of my mother, Simak bin Al-Walid Al-Hanadi narrating, that he heard Ibn Abbas narrated, that he heard the Messenger of Allah saying: "Whoever has two predecessors (in death) among my Ummah, then Allah will admit them into Paradise."So Aishah said to him: "What about one from your Ummar who has one precessor?" He (ﷺ) said: "And whoever has one predecessor O Muwaffaqqah!" So she said: "What about one who does not have a predecessor from your Ummah?" He said: "I am the predecessor for my Ummah: you will never suffer (in grief) for (the loss of) anyone similar to me."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Who The Martyrs Are
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "The martyrs are five: Those who die of the plague, stomach illness, drowning, being crushed, and the martyr in the cause of Allah"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Who The Martyrs Are
text: "Sulaiman bin Surad said to Khalid bin Urfutah - or, Khalid said to Sulaiman - 'Did you hear the Messenger of Allah saying: "Whoever is killed by his stomach then he will not be punished in the grave"?' One of them said to the other: "Yes."

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Flee From The Plague
text: The Prophet mentioned the plague and said: "It is an abiding punishment or chastisement that was sent upon a group of the children of Isra'il. So when it occurs in a land while you are in it, then do not leave it. And when it occurs in a land while you are not in it, then do not enter it."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: Whoever Loves To Meet Allah, Then Allah Loves To Meet Him
text: The Prophet said: "Whoever loves to meet Allah, then Allah loves to meet him. And whoever dislikes meeting Allah, then Allah dislikes meeting him."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: Whoever Loves To Meet Allah, Then Allah Loves To Meet Him
text: Aishah mentioned that the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever loves to meet Allah, then Allah loves to meet him. And whoever dislikes meeting Allah, then Allah dislikes meeting him." She said: "O Messenger of Allah! All of us dislike death." He said: "It is not like that. But when the believer is given the good news of Allah's mercy, His pleasure, and His Paradise, then he loves to meet Allah and Allah loves to meet him. Whereas when the disbeliever is given the news of Allah's punishment and His wrath, he dislikes meeting Allah, and Allah dislikes meeting him."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: The Funeral Prayer Is Not Performed For A Person Who Killed Himself
text: "A man killed himself, so the Prophet did not perform Salat over him."

chapter: What Has Been Related About (Prayer Over) The Indebted
narrated: Abdullah bin Abi Qatadah narrated from his father that
text: The Prophet was brought a (deceased) man to perform Salat over. So the Prophet said: "Pray for your companion; for indeed he had a debt upon him." Abu Qatadah said: "It shall be upon me." So the Messenger of Allah said: "To pay it off?" (He said: "To pay it off.") So he performed the prayer for him.

chapter: What Has Been Related About (Prayer Over) The Indebted
text: "A deceased man would be brought to the Messenger of Allah while a debt was due upon him. So he would say: 'Has he left anything to pay off his debt?' If he was told that he had left something to pay it then he would pray (the funeral prayer) for him. Otherwise he would tell the Muslims: 'Pray for your companion.' So when Allah granted him the victories, he stood and said: 'I am more worthy in the case of the believers than they themselves are. So whoever among the believers dies and leaves a debt behind, then it is up to me to fulfill it. And whoever leaves wealth behind, then it is for his heirs.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Punishment In The Grave
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "When the deceased - or he said when one of you - is buried, two angels, black and blue (eyed_ come to him. One of them is called Al-Munkar, and the other An-Nakir. They say: 'What did you used to say about this man?' So he says what he was saying (before death) 'He is Allah's slave and His Messenger. I testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah and that Muhammad is His slave and His Messenger.' So they say: 'We knew that you would say this.' Then his grave is expanded to seventy by seventy cubits, then it is illuminated for him. Then it is said to him: 'Sleep.' So he said: 'Can I return to my family to inform them?' They say: 'Sleep as a newlywed, whom none awakens but the dearest of his family.' Until Allah resurrects him from his resting place.""If he was a hypocrite he would say: 'I heard people saying something, so I said the same; I do not know.' So they said: 'We knew you would say that.' So the earth is told: 'Constrict him.' So it constricts around him, squeezing his ribs together. He continues being punished like that until Allah resurrects him from his resting place."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Punishment In The Grave
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "When a person dies, he is shown his place [both in the morning and the evening]. If he is one of the people of Paradise; he is shown his place among the people of Paradise, and if he one of the people of the Fire; he is shown his place among the people of the Fire. Then it is said to him: 'This is your place until Allah resurrects you on the Day of Judgment.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About: The Reward For One Who Consoles A Person With An Affliction
text: The Prophet said: "Whoever consoles a person with an affliction, then he gets the same reward as him."

chapter: What Has Been Related About One Who Died On Friday
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "No Muslim dies on the day of Friday, nor the night of Friday, except that Allah protects him from the trials of the grave."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Hastening The Funeral
narrated: Ali bin Abi Talib narrated that
text: The Messenger of Allah said to him: "O Ali! Three are not to be delayed: Salat when it is due, the funeral when it is presented, and (marriage) for the single woman when someone compatible is found."

chapter: Something Else About The Virtue Of Consoling
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever consoles a bereaved mother, he will be clothes with a Burd in Paradise."

chapter: What Has Been Related Abut Raising The Hands For The Funeral (Prayer)
text: "The Messenger of Allah said, 'Allahu Akbar' over the deceased, so he raised his hands with the first Takbir, and he placed his right (hand) over his left."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: The Believer's Soul Is Suspended By His Debt Until It Is Settled For Him
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "The believer's soul is suspended by his debt until it is settled for him."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: The Believer's Soul Is Suspended By His Debt Until It Is Settled For Him
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "The believer's soul is suspended by his debt until it is settled for him."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtues Of Marriage And Encouraging It
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Four are from the Sunan of the Messengers: Al-Hayat, using Atar, the Siwak, and marriage."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtues Of Marriage And Encouraging It
text: "We went with Allah's Messenger, while we were young men who had nothing. He said: 'O young men! You should marry, for indeed it helps in lowering the gaze and protecting the private parts. Whoever among you is not able to marry, then let him fast, for indeed fasting will diminish his sexual desire."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Prohibition Of Celibacy
narrated: Qatadah narrated from Al-Hasan, from Samurah that
text: The Prophet prohibited celibacy.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Prohibition Of Celibacy
narrated: Sa'eed bin Al-Musayyab narrated from Sa'b bin Abi Waqqas
text: "The Messenger of Allah refused Uthman bin Ma'zun (when he asked) regarding celibacy, and if he had permitted it for him, then we would have castrated ourselves."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: If You Are Pleased With Someone's Religion Then Marry Him
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "When someone whose religion and character you are pleased with proposes to (someone under the care) of one of you, then marry to him. If you do not do so, then there will be turmoil (Fitnah) in the land and abounding discord (Fasad)."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: If You Are Pleased With Someone's Religion Then Marry Him
text:
The Messenger of Allah said: "When someone whose religion and character you are pleased with comes to you then marry (her to) him. If you do not do so, then there will be turmoil (Fitnah) in the land and discord (Fasad). If you do not do so, then there will be turmoil (Fitnah) in the land and discord (Fasad)." They said: "O Messenger of Allah! What if there was something about him?"
He said: "When someone whose religion and character you are pleased with comes to you then marry him." (And he (ﷺ) said this) three times.

chapter: What Has Been Related About: One Who Is Married For Three Things
text: The Prophet said: "Indeed the woman is married for her religion, her wealth, and her beauty, so take the one with religion, and may your hands be dusty."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Looking at The Proposed Woman
narrated: Bakr bin Abdullah Al-Muzani narrated that
text: Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah proposed to a woman, so the Prophet said: "Look at her, for indeed that is more likely to make things better between the two of you."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Publicizing The Marriage
narrated: Abu Al-Balj narrated from Muhammad bin Hatib Al-Jumahi who said that
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "The distinction between the lawful and the unlawful  is the Duff and the voice."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Publicizing The Marriage
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Publicize this marriage, and hold it in the Masjid, and beat the Duff for it."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Publicizing The Marriage
text: "The morning after the consummation of my marriage, the Prophet came and sat on my bed as far from me as you are sitting now, and our little girls started beating the Duff and reciting verses mourning my father who had been killed in the battle of Badr. One of them said: 'Among us is a Prophet who knows what will happen tomorrow.' On that the Prophet said: 'Stop saying this, and keep on saying what you were saying before.'"

chapter: What (Has Been Related About What) To Say To The Newlywed
text: When supplicating for the newlywed, the Prophet would say: (Barak Allahu laka wa baraka alaik, wa jama'a bainakuma fi khair.) "May Allah bless you and send blessings upon you, and bring goodness between you."

chapter: What Has Been Related About What Is Said When One Has Intercourse With His Wife
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "If anyone of you, when having sexual intercourse with his wife, says: (Bismillah, Allahumma jannibnash-Shaitana wa jannibish-Shaitana ma razaqtana) 'In the Name of Allah, O Allah! Protect me from Shaitan and protect what you bestow upon us from Shaitan' - then if Allah decrees that they should have a child, Shaitan will not be able to harm him.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Times In Which Marriage Is Recommended
text: "The Messenger of Allah married me in Shawwal, and he took up residence with me in Shawwal."

chapter: What Has Been Related About (Al-Walimah) The Banquet
text: The Messenger of Allah saw some traces of saffron on `Abdur-Rahman bin `Awf so he said: 'What is this?' He said: 'I married a woman for the amount of gold equal to a date stone.' So he said: 'May Allah bless you. Have a banquet, even if with only one sheep.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About (Al-Walimah) The Banquet
text: "The Prophet had a banquet for Safiyyah bint Huyayy with Sawiq and dates."

chapter: What Has Been Related About (Al-Walimah) The Banquet
narrated: (Another chain similar to the narration as no. 1095)
text: Others have reported this Hadith from Ibn Uyainah, from Az-Zuhri, from Anas, and they did not mention "from Wa'il, from his son Nawf" in it.

chapter: What Has Been Related About (Al-Walimah) The Banquet
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Having food on the first day is was is obligatory, and having food on the second day is Sunnah, and having food on the third day is to be heard of, and whoever wants to be heard of, Allah will make him heard of."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Accepting The Invitation
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Accept the invitation when you are offered."

chapter: What Has Been Related About One Who Comes To A Banquet Without An Invitation
text: "A man named Abu Shu'aib came to a slave of his, who was a butcher, and said: 'Prepare some food for me that will be sufficient for five, for I have seen hunger in the face of the Messenger of Allah.' So he prepared some food. Then he sent a message to the Prophet inviting him and those who were sitting with him. When the Prophet stood, he was followed by a man who was not with them when they were invited. When the Messenger of Allah arrive at the door he said to the owner of the house: 'A man who was not with us when you invited us followed us, if you permit him, he will enter.'" He said: We have permitted him, let him enter."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Marrying Virgins
text: "I married a woman and went to the Prophet, he said: 'O Jabir! Have you married?' I said: 'Yes.' He said: 'A virgin or a matron?' I said: 'A matron.' He said: 'Why didn't you marry a young girl, so that you may play with her and she with you?' I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Abdullah (his father) died and left behind seven - or nine - daughter, so I have brought someone who can look after them.'" (He said:) "So he supplicated for me."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: There Is No Marriage Except With A Wali
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "There is no marriage except with a Wali."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: There Is No Marriage Except With A Wali
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whichever woman married without the permission of her Wali her marriage is invalid, her marriage is invalid, her marriage is invalid. If he entered into her, then the Mahr is for her in lieu of what he enjoyed from her private part. If they disagree, then the Sultan is the Wali for one who has no Wali."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: There Is No Marriage Except With Proof (Bayyinah)
text: the Prophet said: "The adulteresses are the ones who marry themselves without Bayyinah (proof)."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: There Is No Marriage Except With Proof (Bayyinah)
narrated: (Another chain) from Sa'eed bin Abi Arubah, with similar (narration),
text: And he did not narrate it in Marfu form, and this is more correct.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Marriage Khutbah
text:
"The Messenger of Allah taught us the Tashah-hud for Salat and the Tashah-hud for Al-Hajjah." He said: "The Tashah-hud for Salat is: (At-Tahiyyatulilah, was-walawtu wat-tayyibatu. As-Salamu alaika ayyuhan-Nabiyyu wa rahmatullilahi wa barakatuhu, As-Salamu alina wa ala ibadillahis-salihin. Ashahadu an la ilaha illallah, wa ashhadu anna Muhammadan abduha wa Raduluh.) 'All greetings, prayers, and pure words are for Allah. Peace be upon you O Prophet, and Allah's mercy and His blessings. Peace be upon us and all of the righteous worshippers of Allah. I testify that none has the right to be worshiped but Allah. and I testify that Muhammad is His slave and His Messenger."And the Tashah-hud for Al-Hajjah is: 'Indeed all praise is due to Allah, we seek His aid, and we seek His forgiveness, and we seek refuge with Allah from the evils of our souls and the mischief of our deeds. (Innal-Hamdlillahi nasta'inuhu, wa nastaghfirhu, wa na'udhu billahi min sharuri anfusina, wa sayy'ita a'malina, man yahdihi, sala mudilla lahu, wa manyudlil, fala Hadiya lahu, wa ashadu an la ilaha illallah wa ashadu anna Muhammadan abduhu wa Rasuluh) 'Whoever He guides - meaning Allah - then here is none to lead him astray, and whomever He misleads, then there is no guide for him. I testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah, and I testify that Muhammad is His worshipper and Messenger.'"
He said: "And he recited three Ayat."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Marriage Khutbah
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Every Khutbah that does not have the Tashah-hud in it, then it is like a severed hand."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Seeking The Permission Of The Virgin And The Matron
text: The Prophet said: "A matron should not be given in marriage until she is consulted, and a virgin should not be given in marriage until her permission is sought, and her silence is her permission."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Seeking The Permission Of The Virgin And The Matron
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "The matron has more right to herself than her Wali, and the virgin is to give permission for herself, and her silence is her permission."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Coercing A Female Orphan To Marry
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "An orphan is to be consulted about herself, then if she is silent that is her permission, and if she refuses, then do not authorize it (the marriage) for her" (meaning: when she attains the age of puberty and refuses it.)

chapter: What Has Been Related About Two Wali Giving The Same Woman In Marriage
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whichever woman is given in marriage by two Wali, then her case is in accordance with the first of them, and whoever sells something to two men, then it is for the first of them."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Slave Marrying Without The Permission Of His Owner
text: The Prophet said: "Whichever slave gets married without the permission of his owner, then he is a fornicator."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Slave Marrying Without The Permission Of His Owner
narrated: (Another chain) Jabir bin Abdullah narrated that
text: Abdullah narrated that the Prophet said: "Whichever slave gets married without the permission of his owner, then he is a fornicator."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Women's Dowries
narrated: Abdullah bin Amr bin Rabi'ah narrated from his father
text: "A woman from Banu Fazarah was married for (the dowry of) two sandals. So the Messenger of Allah said to her: 'Do you approve of (exchanging) yourself and your wealth for two sandals?' She said: 'Yes.'" He said: "So he permitted it."

chapter: Something Else
narrated: Sahl bin Sa'd As-Sa'idi narrated that
text: A woman came to the Messenger of Allah and said: "I present myself to you (for marriage)." So she stood for a long time. Then a man said: "O Messenger of Allah! Marry her to me if you have no need of her." So he said: "Do you have anything to give her as a dowry?"  He said: "I have nothing except this Izar." So the Messenger of Allah said: "If you give her your Izar then you will have no Izar, so search for something." He said: "I did not find anything." He said: "Search for something, even if it just an iron ring." He said: So he searched but he did not find anything. The Messenger of Allah said: "Do you have any Qur'an (memorized)?" He said: "Yes. This Surat and that Surat." And he named the Surat. So the Messenger of Allah said: "I marry her to you for what you have (memorized) of the Qur'an."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Emancipates A Slave Woman, Then Marries Her
text: "The Messenger of Allah emancipated Safiyyah and he made her emancipation her dowry."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of That
narrated: Abu Burdah bin Abi Musa narrated from his father that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Three will receive their reward twice: A slave who fulfills the rights of Allah and the rights of his owners, then he will be given his reward twice. And a man who has a beautiful slave girl, so he teaches her good manners, then he frees her, then he married her seeking the Face of Allah by that; then he will be given his reward twice. And a man who believed in an earlier Book, then another Book came to him and he believed in it; then he will be given his reward twice."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Person Who Marries A Woman, Then Divorces Her Before Having Intercourse With Her: Can He Marry Her Daughter Or Not?
narrated: Amr bin Shu'aib narrated from his father, from his grandfather that
text: The Prophet said: "Whichever man married a woman and entered into her, then it is not lawful for him to marry her daughter. If he did not enter into her then he may marry her daughter. And whichever man married a woman and he entered into her, or he did  not enter into her, then it is not lawful for him to marry her mother."

chapter: : What Has Been Related About One Who Divorced His Wife Three Times, Then She Married Someone Else, And He Divorced Her Before Having Intercourse With Her
text: "The wife of Rifa'ah Al-Qurzi came to the Messenger of Allah and said: 'I was with Rifa'ah and he divorced me irrevocably. Then I married Abdur-Rahman bin Az-Zubair, but he only has the likes of the fringe of a garment.' So he said: 'Perhaps you want me to return to Rifa'ah? No, not until you taste his sweetness, and he tastes your sweetness.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Muhill And The One Who The Muhallal Was Done For
narrated: Jabir bin Abdullah and Ali narrated
text: "The Messenger of Allah cursed the Muhill and the one the Muhallal was done for."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Muhill And The One Who The Muhallal Was Done For
text: "The Messenger of Allah cursed the Muhill and the one the Muhallal was done for."

chapter: What Has Been Related About (The Prohibition of) Mut'ah
text: "The Prophet prohibited the Mut'ah with women, and the meat of domestic donkeys during (the campaign of) Khaibar."

chapter: What Has Been Related About (The Prohibition of) Mut'ah
text: Ibn Abbas said: "Mut'ah was only during the beginning of Islam. A man would arrive in a land that he was not familiar with so he would marry a woman for the extent of time that he thought he would remain there. So his Mut'ah was upheld and his case was fine until the (following) Ayah was revealed: Except their wives or what their right hands possess. Then every private part other than those became unlawful."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Prohibition Of The Shigar Marriage
text: The Prophet said: "There is no Jalab, no Janab, and no Shighar in Islam. And whoever takes some property by force, then he is not from us."

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Prohibition Of The Shigar Marriage
text: "The Prophet prohibited Shighar."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: A Woman Should Not Be Married Along With Her Paternal Aunt Nor Her Maternal Aunt
text: "The Prophet prohibited marrying a woman along with her paternal aunt or along with her maternal aunt."

chapter: What Has Been Related About: A Woman Should Not Be Married Along With Her Paternal Aunt Nor Her Maternal Aunt
text: "The Messenger of Allah prohibited that a woman be married along with her paternal aunt, or the paternal aunt along with her brother's daughter, or a woman with her maternal aunt, or the maternal aunt along with her sister's daughter, and the younger is not to be married with the older, nor the older with the younger."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Conditions When Contracting A Marriage
narrated: Uqbah bin Amir Al-Juhani narrated that
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Indeed the conditions most deserving to be fulfilled are those that make the private parts lawful among you."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Accepted Islam While Having Ten Wives
text: "Ghilan bin Salamah Ath-Thaqafi accepted Islam and he had ten wives in Jahiliyyah who accepted Islam along with him. So the Prophet ordered (him) to chose four (of them)."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Accepts  Islam While He Is Married To Two Sisters
text: He heard Ibn Fairuz Ad-Dhailami narrating from his father: "I went to the Prophet and said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I accepted Islam and I had two sisters (as wives).' So the Messenger of Allah said: 'Chose whichever of them you will.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Accepts  Islam While He Is Married To Two Sisters
narrated: [Abu Wahb Al-Jaishani narrated from Ad-Dhahhak bin Fairuz Ad-Dailami from his father
text: "I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I accepted Islam and I had two sisters (as wives).' So Messenger of Allah said: 'Chose whichever of them you will.'"]

chapter: (What Has Been Related About) A Man Who Buys A Slave Girl Who Is Pregnant
text: the Prophet said: "Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, then he does not levy his water on someone else's child."

chapter: What Has Been Related (About A Man) Who Captures A Slave Woman That Has A Husband, Is It Lawful For Him To Have Relations With Her?
text: "We got some captives on the day of Awtas, and they had husbands among their peopled. They mentioned that to the Messenger of Allah, so the following was revealed: And women who are already married, except those whom your right hands posses.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Dowry Of The Baghi
text: "The Messenger of Allah prohibited the price of a dog, the dowry of a fornicator, and the payment made to the fortune-teller."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Man Is Not To Propose To A Woman Who Has Been Proposed To By His Brother
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "A man is not to sell over his brother's sale, nor is he to propose to whom his brother has proposed."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Man Is Not To Propose To A Woman Who Has Been Proposed To By His Brother
text: "Abu Salamah bin Abdur-Rahman and I visited Fatimah bint Qais. She narrated to us that her husband had divorced her three times, and he did not leave her with anywhere to live nor any wealth. She said: 'He left ten Aqfizah for me with the son of his uncle: five were of barley, five of wheat.' She said: 'I went to the Messenger of Allah and mentioned that to him.' She said: 'He said: 'He is correct.'" (She said: ) 'So he ordered me to complete my Iddah in the home of Umm Sharik. But then the Messenger of Allah said to me: "Umm Sharik's home is visited by Muhajirun, so spend your Iddah in the home of Ibn Umm Maktum, for there you can remove your garments and he will not see you. Then when your Iddah is completed and someone proposed to you come to me." 'So when my Iddah completed. Abu Jahm and Mu'awiyah proposed to me.' She said: 'I went to the Messenger of Allah and mentioned that to him, and he said: "As for Mu'awiyah, he is a man with no wealth,  and as for Abu Jahm he is a man who is harsh with women." She said: 'Then Usamah bin Zaid proposed to me, and he married me. So Allah blessed me with Usamah.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Azl
text: "We said: 'O Messenger of Allah! We practice Azl, but the Jews claim that it is minor infanticide.'  So he said: 'The Jews lie. When Allah wants to create it, nothing can prevent Him.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Azl
text: "We practiced Azl while the Qur'an was being revealed."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Azl Being Disliked
text: "Azl was mentined before the Messenger of Allah and he said: 'Why would one of you do that?'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About Dividing Time For The Virgin And The Matron
narrated: Abu Qilabah narrated from Anas bin Malik,
text: He (Abu Qilabah) said: "If I wish, I could say: 'The Messenger of Allah said'" but he said: "The Sunnah when a man married a virgin after he already has a wife, is that he stays with her seven (nights). And when he married a matron when he already has a wife, he stays with her three (nights)."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Equality Between Co-Wives
text: The Prophet would divide (his time) equally between his wives and said: "O Allah! This is my division in what I have control over, so do not punish me for what You have control over which I do not have control over."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Equality Between Co-Wives
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "When a man has two wives and he is not just between them, he will come on the Day of Judgment with one side drooping."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Married Couple Who Are Idolaters, Then One Of Them Accepted Islam
narrated: Amr bin Shu'aib narrated from his father, from his grandfather
text: "The Messenger of Allah returned his daughter Zainab to Abul-As bin Ar-Rabi with a new dowry and a new wedding."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Married Couple Who Are Idolaters, Then One Of Them Accepted Islam
text: "The Prophet returned his daughter Zainab to Abul-As bin Ar-Rabi after six years in the first marriage without renewing the marriage."

chapter: What Has Been Related About A Married Couple Who Are Idolaters, Then One Of Them Accepted Islam
text: "A man became a Muslim during the time of the Prophet, then his wife became a Muslim, so he said: 'O Messenger of Allah! She accepted Islam along with me, so return her to me.' So he returned her to him."

chapter: What Has Been Related About a Man Who Died Before Stipulating The Dowry For Her
text: Ibn Mas'ud was asked about a man who married a woman and he did not stipulate the dowry for her, and he did not enter into her until he died. So Ibn Mas'ud said: "She gets the same dowry as other women, no less and no more, she has to observe the Iddah, and she gets inheritance." So Ma'qil bin Sinan Al-Ashja'I stood and said: "The Messenger of Allah judged the same as you have judged regarding Birwa bint Washiq, a woman of ours." So Ibn Mas'ud was happy about that.

chapter: What has been related about: Suckling makes unlawful whatever lineage makes unlawful
narrated: Ali (bin Abi Talib) narrated that The Messenger of Allah said
text:
"Indeed Allah has made unlawful through suckling
whatever He made unlawful through lineage."

chapter: What has been related about: Suckling makes unlawful whatever lineage makes unlawful
narrated: Aishah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Indeed Allah has made unlawful through suckling whatever He made unlawful through birth."

chapter: What has been related about a man's milk
text: "My uncle through suckling came and asked permission (to enter) but I refused to admit him until I asked the Messenger of Allah. So the Messenger of Allah said: "Let him in since he is your uncle.'" She said: "It is only the woman who suckled me; I was not suckled by the man.' So he said: 'Indeed he is your uncle, so let him in.'"

chapter: What has been related about a man's milk
narrated: Amr bin Ash-Shariq narrated that Ibn Abbas was asked about the case in which a man had two slave girls, one of them suckled a girl and the other suckled a boy, is it lawful for the boy to marry the girl? She said
text: "No, the semen is the same."

chapter: What has been related about: One sip or two sips will not make a prohibition
narrated: Abdullah bin Az-Zubair narrated from Aishah from the Prophet who said
text: "One sip or two sips do not make a prohibition."

chapter: What has been related about one woman's testimony about suckling
text: "Ubaid bin Abi Maryam narrated to me from Uqbah bin Al-Harith" and, he (Abdullah bin Abi Mulaikah) said: "And I heard it from Uqbah bin Al-Harith, but to me, the narration of Ubaid is better preserved; he said: (Uqbah bin Al-Harith narrated: ) "I married a woman, then a black woman came to us and she said: 'I suckled both of you.' So I went to the Prophet and said: 'I married so-and-so the daughter of so-and-so, then a black women came to us, and said: "I suckled both of you" but she is a liar.'" He said: "Then he (ﷺ) turned away from me." He said: "So I went around to face him (and he (ﷺ) turned his face away from me) so I said: 'She is a liar.' He said: 'How can you stay with her while she claims that she suckled both of you? Leave her.'"

chapter: What has been related about: Suckling does not make a prohibition except during infancy less than two years
narrated: Umm Salamah narrated that The Messenger of Allah said
text: "No prohibition results from suckling except for what penetrates the intestines while on the breast before weaning."

chapter: What fulfills the rights of the foster relationship (from suckling)
narrated:
Hajjaj bin Hajjaj Al-Aslami narrated that
His father asked the Prophet
text: "O Messenger of Allah! What will remove the responsibility of the foster relationship from me?" So he said: "A Ghurrah: a male slave or a female slave."

chapter: What has been related about a slave woman who is freed but she has a husband
text: "Barfah's husband was a slave, so the Messenger of Allah let her chose, and she chose herself, and if he was a free man she would not have had a choice."

chapter: What has been related about a slave woman who is freed but she has a husband
text: "Barfah's husband was a free man, so the Messenger of Allah let her choose."

chapter: What has been related about a slave woman who is freed but she has a husband
text: "Barfahs husband was a black slave belonging to Banu Al-Mughirah. On the day that Barirah was freed. By Allah! It is as if I can see him in the streets of Al-Madinah behind her. Indeed tears were flowing down his beard while he was trying to get her to chose to stay with him, but she did not do it."

chapter: What has been related about the child the bed belong to
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that The Messenger of Allah said
text: "The child is for the bed, and for the fornicator is the stone."

chapter: What has been related about a man who sees a woman and becomes fascinated with her
text: "The Prophet saw a woman, then he went to Zainab to fulfill his need and he left. He said: 'Indeed when the woman enters, she enters in the image of Shaitan. So when one of you sees a woman that he is fascinated with, then let him go to his wife, for indeed with her (his wife) is the same as that which is with her."

chapter: What has been related about the husband's rights over the wife
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that The Prophet said
text: "If I were to order anyone to prostrate to anyone, then I would order the wife to prostrate to her husband."

chapter: What has been related about the husband's rights over the wife
narrated: Talq bin Ali narrated that The Messenger of Allah said
text: "When a man calls his wife to fulfill his need, then let her come, even if she is at the oven."

chapter: What has been related about the husband's rights over the wife
narrated: Umm Salamah narrated that The Messenger of Allah said
text: "Whichever woman dies while her husband is pleased with her, then she enters Paradise."

chapter: What has been related about a woman's rights over her husband
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that The Messenger of Allah said
text: "The most complete of the believers in faith, is the one with the best character among them. And the best of you are those who are best to your women."

chapter: What has been related about a woman's rights over her husband
narrated: Sulaiman bin Amr bin Al-Ahwas said
text: "My father narrated to me that he witnessed the farewell Hajj with the Messenger of Allah. So he thanked and praised Allah and he reminded and gave admonition. He mentioned a story in his narration and he (the Prophet) said: "And indeed I order you to be good to the women, for they are but captives with you over whom you have no power than that, except if they come with manifest Fahishah (evil behavior). If they do that, then abandon their beds and beat them with a beating that is not harmful. And if they obey you then you have no cause against them. Indeed you have rights over your women, and your women have rights over you. As for your rights over your women, then they must not allow anyone whom you dislike to treat on your bedding (furniture), nor to admit anyone in your home that you dislike. And their rights over you are that you treat them well in clothing them and feeding them."

chapter: What has been mentioned about it being disliked to enter women in their behinds
narrated: Ali bin Talq narrated that A Bedouin came to the Prophet and said
text: "O Messenger of Allah! A man among us would be in the desert and a small smell would come from him, (what should he do) while the water is scarce? So the Messenger of Allah said: "When one of you breaks wind then let him perform Wudu, and do not go into your women in their behinds for indeed Allah is not shy of the truth."

chapter: What has been mentioned about it being disliked to enter women in their behinds
narrated: Ibn Abbas narrated that The Messenger of Allah said
text: "Allah will not look at a man who enters a man or a woman in the behind."

chapter: What has been mentioned about it being disliked to enter women in their behinds
narrated: Ali narrated that The Messenger of Allah said
text: "When one of you breaks wind then let him perform Wudu, and do not go into your women through their behinds."

chapter: What has been related about it being disliked for women to go out while wearing their adornments
narrated: Maimunah bin Sa'd who was a servant for the Prophet, narrated that The Messenger of Allah said
text: "The parable of the woman who walks to impress others in adornments for other than her family, is that of darkness on the Day of Judgment: There is no light for her."

chapter: What has been related about jealousy
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that The Messenger of Allah said
text: "Allah becomes jealous and the believer becomes jealous.  Allah's jealousy occurs when a believer does what He has made unlawful for him."

chapter: What has been related about it being disliked for a woman to travel alone
narrated: Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri narrated that The Messenger of Allah said
text: "It is not lawful for a woman who believers in Allah and the Last Day to travel on a trip that is three days or more, unless she is accompanied by her father, her brother, her husband, her son, or someone who is a Mahram to her."

chapter: What has been related about it being disliked for a woman to travel alone
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that The Messenger of Allah said
text: "A woman is not to travel the distance of a day and a night unless she is accompanied by someone who is a Mahram."

chapter: What has been related about it being disliked to enter upon women whose husbands are absent
narrated: Uqbah bin Amir narrated that The Messenger of Allah said
text: "Beware of entering upon women." So a man from the Ansar said: '"O Messenger of Allah! What do you think about Hamu? So he said: "The Hamu is death."

chapter: The warning about that due to the Shaitan flowing (through the body) like the flow of blood
narrated: Jabir narrated that The Prophet said
text: "Do not enter upon Al-Mughibar (the women whose husband are absent), for indeed the Shaitan flows through one of you as the blood flows." We said: "And you?" He said: "And me, but Allah helped me over him, so I am safe."

chapter: The Shaitan seeks to tempt the woman when she goes out
narrated: Abdullah narrated that The Prophet said
text: "The woman is Awrah, so when she goes out, the Shaitan seeks to tempt her."

chapter: The threat for the woman who annoys her husband
narrated: Mu'adh bin Jabal narrated that The Prophet said
text: "No woman annoys her husband in the world except that his wife among the Al-Huril-Ain said: 'Do not annoy him, may Allah destroy you, he is only like a guest with, soon he will part from you for us.'"

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about the Sunnah divorce
text: "I asked Ibn Umar about a man who divorced his wife while she was menstruating. So he said: 'Don't you know Abdullah bin Umar?' Indeed he divorced his wife while she was menstruating, so Umar asked the Prophet about that, and he ordered him to take her back.'" He said: "I said: And that divorce is counted? He said: And that divorce is counted? He said: 'What else would you think if he was helpless and foolish?'"

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about the Sunnah divorce
text: His father divorced his wife during her menses, so Umar asked the Prophet about that and he said: "Tell him to take her back, then let him divorce her while she is pure or pregnant."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about a man who divorces his wife irrevocably
narrated: Abdullah bin Yazid bin Rukanah narrated from his father, from his grandfather who said
text: 'O Messenger of Allah! I irrevocably divorced my wife.' So he said: 'What did you intend by that?' I said: 'One (divorce).' He said: '(Do you swear) By Allah?' I said: 'By Allah.' He said: 'Then it is as you intended.'"

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about: Your case is up to you
text: "I said to Abu Ayyub: 'Do you know of anyone who said that: "Your case is up to you?" counts as three besides Al-Hasan?' He said: "No, not besides Al-Hasan.' Then he said: 'O Allah forgive me - except for what has been narrated to me by Qatadah, from Kathir the freed slave of Banu Samurah, from Abu Salamah, from Abu Hurairah, that the Prophet said: "Three.'"Abu Ayyub said: 'So I met Kathir the freed slave of Banu Samurah and asked him about it, but he was not aware of it. So I returned to Qatadah and informed him about that and he said: "He forgot."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about the choice
text: "The Messenger of Allah gave us the choice, so we chose him. So was that a divorce?"

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about: The woman with three divorces gets no housing nor maintenance (from the husband)
text: "My husband divorced me three times during the time of the Prophet. So the Messenger of Allah said: 'There is no housing for you nor maintenance.'" Al-Mughirah (one of the narrators) said: "I mentioned that to Ibrahim and he said: Umar said: "We do not leave the Book of Allah and the Sunnah of our Prophet for the saying of a woman, and we do not know if she remembered or forgot." And Umar used to give her (the divorced woman) housing and maintenance.'"

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about: There is no divorce before marriage
narrated: Amr bin Shu'aib narrated from his grandfather, from his father, that
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "There is no vow for the son of Adam over what he has no control, and there is no emancipating he can do for one whom he does not own, and there is no divorce for him regarding that which he has no control over."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about: Divorce for a slave woman is twice
narrated: Muzahir bin Aslam narrated that Al-Qasim narrated from Aishah that
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "The divorce for a slave woman is two divorces, and her Iddah is two menstruations."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about the man who thinks to himself about divorcing his wife
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Allah has permitted my Ummah what occurs in their mines, as long as it is not spoken or acted upon."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about seriousness and jest regarding divorce
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Three are serious when they are serious, and serious when they are in jest: Marriage, divorce, and return."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about Khul'
narrated: AR-Rubayyi bint Mu'awwidh bin Al-Afra narrated
text: that she got a Khul during the time of the Prophet. So the Prophet ordered her - or: she was ordered - that she observe an Iddah of a menstruation."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about the women who seek a Khul'
text: The Prophet said: "The women who seek a Khul are hypocrites."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about the women who seek a Khul'
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whichever woman seeks a Khul from her husband without harm (cause), then the scent of Paradise will be unlawful for her."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about treating women kindly
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Indeed the woman is like a rib, if you try to straighten her you will break her, and if you leave her, what you enjoy from her will be with the crookedness."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about a man whose father asks him to divorce (his wife)
text: "I had a wife whom I loved, but my father disliked her, so he ordered me to divorce her but I refused. I mentioned that to the Prophet and he said: 'O Abdullah bin Umar! Divorce your wife.'"

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about: No woman should ask for the divorce of her sister
text: The Prophet said: "No woman should ask for the divorce of her sister (in religion) in order to spill what is in her container."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about the divorce pronounced by the Ma'tuh person
text: The Messenger of Allah said: "Every divorce is valid except the divorce of the Ma'tuh person whose reason is overcome." (Da'if Jiddan)

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: The revelation of Allah's saying: "Divorce is two times"
narrated: Hisham bin Urwah narrated from his father, from Aishah that she said
text: "The people were such that a man would divorce his wife when he wanted to divorce her, and she remained his wife when he wanted to take her back while she was in her Iddah, and he could divorce a hundred times, or even more, such that a man could say to his wife: 'By Allah! I will neither divorce you irrevocably, nor give you residence ever!' She would say: 'And how is that?' He would say: 'I will divorce you, and whenever your Iddah is just about to end I will take you back. So a woman went to Aishah to inform her about that, and Aishah was silent until the Prophet came. So she told him and the Prophet was silent, until the Qur'an was revealed: Divorce is two times, after that, retain her on reasonable terms or release her with kindness.'" So Aishah said: "So the people could carry on with divorce in the future, (knowing) who was divorced, and who was not divorced."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about the pregnant woman who gives birth after her husband dies
narrated: Al-Aswad narrated from Abu As-Sanabil bin Ba'kak who said
text: "Subai'ah delivered twenty-three or twenty-five days after her husband had died. So when she was ready (finished post-natal bleeding) she adorned herself for marriage, but she was rebuked for doing that, so it was mentioned to the Prophet and he said: "If she has done that then her time has come.'"

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about the pregnant woman who gives birth after her husband dies
text: Abu Hurairah, Ibn Abbas and Abu Salamah bin Abdur-Rahman mentioned the pregnant women whose husband died and she gave birth after the death of her husband. So Ibn Abbas said: "She observes Iddah until the end of the two terms." Abu Salamah said: "Rather, she is allowed when she gives birth." Abu Hurairah said: "I am with my nephew," meaning Abu Salamah.So he sent a message to Umm Salamah the wife of the Prophet. She said: "Subai'ah Al-Aslamiyyah gave birth a short time after her husband died, so she sought the judgment of the Messenger of Allah and he ordered her to get married."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about the 'Iddah of a woman whose husband dies
text: Zainab bint Abi Salamah said: "I entered upon Umm Habibah, the wife of the Prophet when her father Sufyan bin Harb died. So she asked for some perfume that had something yellow saffron or something else, so a girl applied it to her and put some on her cheeks. Then she said: 'By Allah! I have no need for perfume except that I heard the Messenger of Allah saying: "It is not lawful for a woman who believers in Allah and the Last Day to mourn for the dead more than three days, except for her husband (in which case it is) four months and ten days."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about the 'Iddah of a woman whose husband dies
text: Zainab said: "So I entered upon Zainab bint Jahsh when her brother died. She called for some perfume and put it on, then said: 'By Allah! I have no need for perfume except that I heard the Messenger of Allah said: "It is not lawful for a woman who believes in Allah and the Last Day to mourn for the dead more than three nights, except for her husband (in which case it is) four months and ten days."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about the 'Iddah of a woman whose husband dies
text: Zainab said: "And I heard my mother, Umm Salamah said: 'A woman came to the Messenger of Allah and she said: "O Messenger of Allah! My daughter's husband died, and she is suffering from an eye ailment, so can she use Kohl?" the Messenger of Allah said: "No" two or three time. Each time (she asked) he said "no." Then he said: "It is just a mater of four months and ten (days). During Jahliyyah one of you would throw a clump of camel dung when one year passed."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about the one who has uttered Zihar and has intercourse (with his wife) before atoning
text: that the Prophet said, about the one who uttered Zihar and had intercourse before the atonement: "One atonement."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about the one who has uttered Zihar and has intercourse (with his wife) before atoning
text: A man came to the Prophet, and he had uttered Zihar upon his wife then he had intercourse with her. So he said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I uttered Zihar against my wife, then I had intercourse with her before atoning.' He (ﷺ) said: "What caused you to do that, may Allah have mercy upon you?' He said: 'I saw her anklets in the moonlight.' He said: 'Then do not go near her until you have done what Allah ordered (for it).'"

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about the atonement for Zihar
narrated: Abu Salamah and Muhammad bin Abdur-Rahman (bin Thawban) narrated that
text: Salman bin Sakhr Al-Ansari - from Banu Bayadah -  said that his wife was like the back of his mother to him until Ramadan passed. After half of Ramadan had passed he had intercourse with his wife during the night. So he went to the Messenger of Allah to mention that to him. The Messenger of Allah said to him: "Free a slave." He said: "I don't have one." So he said: "Then fast two consecutive months." He said: "I am unable." He said: "Feed sixty needy people." He said: "I can not." So the Messenger of Allah said to Farwah bin Amr: "Give him that Araq - and it is a large basket that holds fifteen or sixteen Sa - to feed sixty needy people."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about Ila'
text: "The Messenger of Allah swore Ila from his wives, and he made something unlawful and he made himself unlawful what was lawful, and he made atonement for his oath."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about Li'an
text:
"I was asked about those who were involved in the case of Li'an and if they are to be separated, during the leadership of Mus'ab bin Az-Zubair. I did not know what to say. So I went to the house of Abdullah bin Umar and I sought permission to enter. I was told that he was taking a nap, but he heard me talking and he said: 'Is it Ibn Jubair? Enter. You would not have come except for a need.'"He said: "So I entered and found him lying on a saddlecloth from his mount. I said: 'O Abu Abdur-Rahman! Are those involved in Li'an separated?' He said: 'Glorious is Allah! Yes. The first who asked about that was so-and-so the son of so-and-so. He came to the Prophet and said: "O Messenger of Allah! If one of us saw his wife committing adultery what should he do? If he were to say anything, his statement would be a horrible matter, and if he were to remain silent, his silence about the matter would be horrible."
"He said: 'So the Prophet remained silent and did not answer him. Afterwards he came to the Prophet and said: "The one who asked you about it has been tried by it." So Allah revealed these Ayat from Surat An-Nur. And those who accuse their wives and have no witnesses except themselves - until the end of those Ayat. So he called for the man and recited the Ayat to him and admonished him, reminded him, and he told him: "Indeed the punishment of the world is less than the punishment of the Hereafter." So he said: "Nay! By the One Who sent you with the truth! I did not lie about her." Then he did the same with the woman, admonished her and reminding her and he told her: "Indeed the punishment of the world is less than the punishment of the Hereafter." She said: "Nay! By the One Who sent you with the truth! He is not telling the truth.'"
"He said: 'So he started with the man: He testified four times, by Allah that he is one of the truthful, and the fifth time that the curse of Allah be upon him if he was one of the liars. Then the same with the woman: She testified four times by Allah, that he was one of the liars, and the fifth time that the wrath of Allah be upon her if he was one of the truthful. Then he separated the two of them.'"

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What has been related about Li'an
text: "A man pronounced the Li'an on his wife, and the Prophet separated the two of them, and he decide that the child belonged to the mother."

book: The Book on Divorce and Li'an
chapter: What is reported on where the widow observes her 'Iddah
narrated: Zainab bint Ka'b bin Ujrah narrated that
text: Al-Furay'ah bint Malik bin Sinan - the sister of the Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri - informed her that she went to the Messenger of Allah to ask him if she could return to her family in Banu Khudrah. Her husband had gone out searching for his runaway slaves, and when he was in Turaf Al-Qadum he caught up with them and they killed him. She said: "So I asked the Messenger of Allah if I could return to my family since my husband had not left me a home that he owned nor any maintenance." She said: "So the Messenger of Allah said: 'Yes.' Then I left. When I was in the courtyard," or, "in the Masjid, the Messenger of Allah called me" or, "summoned for me to come back t him and he said: 'What did you say?'" She said: "So I repeated the store that I had mentioned to him about the case of my husband. He said: 'Stay in your house until what is written reaches its term.'" She said: "So I observed my Iddah there for four months and ten (days)." She said: "During the time of Uthman, he sent a message to me asking me about that, so I informed him. He followed it and judged accordingly."
