He said: There are narration on this topic from 'Aishah and Abu Hurairah.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] We do not know of this Hadith except through the narration of 'Abdul-Karim. Some of the people of knowledge have criticized 'Abdul-Karim Al-Mu'allim because of his memory, Ayyub As-Sakhtiyani was among them.

chapter: What Has Been Related From The Prophet (saws) Permitting One To Cut Meat With A Knife
narrated: Narrated Ja'far bin 'Amr bin Umayyah Ad-Damri
text:
From his father who said that he saw the Prophet (ﷺ) making incisions (with a knife) into a piece of a lamb shoulder which he ate from, then he went to perform Salat without performing Wudu'.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih and there is something on this topic from Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Which Meat The Messenger Of Allah (saws) Used To Like Most
text:
"Some meat was brought to the Prophet (ﷺ) and a foreleg was presented to him, and he used to like it, so he bit from it."


He said: There are narrations on this topic from Ibn Mas'ud, 'Aishah, 'Abdullah bin Ja'far, and Abu 'Ubaidah.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. Abu Hayyan's (a narrator in the chain) name is Yahya bin Sa'eed bin Hayyan At-Taimi. Abu Zur'ah bin 'Amr bin Jarir's name is Harim.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Which Meat The Messenger Of Allah (saws) Used To Like Most
text:
"The foreleg was not the part of the meat that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) liked most, but he would not get meat but occasionally. So it would be hastened to him because it cooks quickly."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib, we do not know of it except from this route.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Vinegar
text: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "What an excellent condiment vinegar is."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Vinegar
text:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "What an excellent condiment vinegar is."


Another chain with similar except that he (ﷺ) said: "What an excellent condiment, or, (the most excellent of) condiments is vinegar."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih Gharib from this route. It is not known as a Hadith of Hisham bin 'Urwah except through the narration of Sulaiman bin Bilal.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Vinegar
narrated: Narrated Umm Hani' bint Abi Talib
text:
"The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) entered upon me and said: 'Do you have anything?' I said: 'No, except a piece of hard bread and vinegar.' so he said: 'Bring it, for a house that has vinegar is not impoverished of condiments."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib from this route. We do not know of it as a Hadith of Umm Hani' except through this route. Abu Hamzah Ath-Thumali's (a narrator in the chain) name is Thabit bin Abi Safiyyah. And Umm Hani' died some time after 'Ali bin Abi Talib. I asked Muhammad about this Hadith. He said: "I do not know Ash-Sha'bi hearing from Umm Hani'." So I said: "How is Abu Hamzah according to you?" He said: "Ahmad bin Hanbal criticized him, but he is Muqarib (average) in Hadith to me."

chapter: What Has Been Related About Vinegar
text:
That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "What an excellent condiment vinegar is."


There are narrations on this topic from 'Aishah and Umm Hani', and this is more correct than the narration of Mubarak bin Sa'eed (no. 1839).

chapter: What Has Been Related About Eating Melon With Fresh Dates
text:
"The Prophet (ﷺ) would eat melon with fresh dates."


He said: There is something on about this from Anas.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib. Some of them reported it form Hisham bin 'Urwah from his father in Mursal form from the Prophet (ﷺ), without mentioning "from 'Aishah" in it, And Yazid bin Ruman reported this Hadith from 'Urwah, from 'Aishah.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Eating Snake Cucumber With Fresh Dates
text:
"The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) would eat snake cucumber with fresh dates.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih Gharib, we do not know of it except as a narration of Ibrahim bin Sa'd.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Drinking Camel Urine
text:
"Some of people from 'Urainah arrived in Al-Madinah, and they were uncomfortable (with the climate). So the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) sent them some camels from charity. He told them: "Drink from their milk and urine."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih Gharib as a narration of Thabit. This Hadith has been reported through other routes from Anas. Abu Qilabah reported it from Anas, and Sa'eed bin Abu 'Arubah reported it from Qatadah, from Anas.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Wudu' Before Meals And Afterwards
text:
"I read in the Tawrah that the blessing for food is in the Wudu' after it. So I mentioned that to the Prophet (ﷺ), telling him what I read in the Tawrah. So the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: 'The food's blessing is in the Wudu' before it and the Wudu' after it.'"


He said: There are narrations on this topic from Anas and Abu Hurairah.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] We do not know of this Hadith except as a narration of Qais bin Ar-Rabi'. Qais [bin Ar-Rabi'] was graded weak in Hadith. Abu Hashim Ar-Rumani's (a narrator in the chain) name is Yahya bin Dinar.

chapter: About Not Performing Wudu Before Eating
text:
"The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) cae out from the toilet and some food was brought to him. They said: 'Shall we bring you some water for Wudu'?' He said: 'I have only been ordered to perform Wudu' when standing for Salat.'"


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan [Sahih]. 'Amr bin Dinar has reported it from Sa'eed bin Al-Huwairith, from Ibn 'Abbas. 'Ali bin Al-Madini said: 'Sufyan Ath-Thawri disliked washing the hands before eating food, and he disliked placing the bread under the bowl.'"

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Tasmiyah For Eating
text:
"Banu Murrah bin 'Ubaid sent me to bring the Sadaqah from their wealth of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). I arrived with him in Al-Madinah and found him sitting between the Muhajirin and the Ansar." He said: "Then he took my hand and brought me to the home of Umm Salamah and he said: 'Do you have any food?' So a bowl containing a lot of Tharid with pieces of meat was brought to us, and presented for us to eat from it. So I began wandering my around it while the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) ate from what was in front of him. He grabbed my right hand with his left hand, then he said: 'O 'Ikrash! Eat from one spot, for indeed the food is one.' Then a plate containing various dried dates" - or fresh dates - 'Ubaidullah (a narrator) was not sure. He said: "I began eating what was in front of me, while the hand of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) roamed about the plate. He said: 'O 'Ikrash! Eat from wherever you like, for indeed it is not all from the same variety.' Then water was brought, so the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) washed his hands, and with the wetness of his hands he wiped his face, his forearms, and his head, and he said: 'O Ikrash! This is the Wudu' for that which has been altered by fire.'"


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib, we do not know of it except through the narration of Al-'Ala' bin Al-Fadl, and Al-Ala'was alone with this narration, and there is more in the story in the Hadith. And we do not know a Hadith from the Prophet (ﷺ) by 'Ikrash except this.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Eating Gourd
text:
"I entered upon Anas bin Malik while he was eating gourd, and he was saying: 'O you tree! I do not like you but because of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) liked you.'"


He said: There is something on this topic from Hakim bin Jarir, from his father.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib from this route.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Eating Gourd
text:
"I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) taking from the sides around the dish - meaning the gourd. Since then I still like it."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. This Hadith has been reported through more than one route from Anas bin Malik.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Eating Olive OIl
text:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Eat olive and use its oil, for indeed it is a blessed tree."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] We do not know of this Hadith except through the narration of 'Abdur-Razzaq from Ma'mar (narrators in the chain of this Hadith). 'Abdur-Razzaq would narrate this with Idtirab. Sometimes he mentioned in it: "From 'Umar, from the Prophet (ﷺ)" and sometimes he reported it indicating doubt, saying: "I think it is from 'Umar from the Prophet (ﷺ)." And sometimes he said: "From Zaid bin Aslam, from his father, from the Prophet (ﷺ)" in a Mursal form.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Eating Olive OIl
text:
"The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Eat of its oil and use it (the olives), for indeed it is from a blessed tree."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib from this route. We only know of it from the narration of Sufyan At-Thawri, from 'Abdullah bin 'Eisa.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Eating With Slaves (And Dependants)
text:
From his father that Abu Hurairah informed them that the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "When the servant of one of you has endured heat and smoke preparing his food for him, then let him take him by the hand and make him sit him down with him. If he refuses, then let him take a morsel and feed him with it."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. Abu Khalid is the father of Isma'il, his name is Sa'd.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtues Of Feeding Others
text:
That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Spread the (greetings of) Salam, feed others, strike the heads (of the enemy disbelievers); you will inherit Paradise."


He said: There are narrations on this topic from 'Abdullah bin 'Amr, Ibn 'Umar, Anas, 'Abdus-Salam, 'Abdur-Rahman bin 'Aish, and Shuraih bin Hani' from his father.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih Gharib as a narration of [Ibn Ziyad] from Abu Hurairah.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtues Of Feeding Others
text:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "(All of you) worship Ar-Rahman, feed others, spread the (greeting of) Salam, then you will enter Paradise in security."


He said: This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Al-'Asha'
text:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Take the 'Asha' meal, even if it is just with a handful of something to fill. For indeed avoiding the 'Asha' is from senility."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Munkar, we do not know of it except from this route. 'Anbasah was graded weak is Hadith. 'Abdul-Malik bin 'Allaq is unknown.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Tasmiyah Over Food
text:
That he entered upon the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) while he has some food. He said: "Sit down O my son! Mention Allah's Name and eat with your right hand, and eat what is nearest to you."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] It has been reported from Hisham bin 'Urwah, from Abu Wajzah As-Sa'idi, from a man from Muzainah, from 'Umar bin Abu Salamah. The Companions of Hisham bin 'Urwah differed in reporting this Hadith. Abu Wajzah As-Sa'di's name is Yazid bin 'Ubaid.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Tasmiyah Over Food
text: From 'Aishah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "When one of you eats food, then let him say: 'Bismillah.' If he forgets in the beginning, then let him say: 'Bismillah Fi Awwalihi Wa Akhirih (In the Name of Allah in its beginning and its end.)"

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Spend While One Has A Smell On His Hand
text:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Indeed Ash-Shaitan has a sense of taste, for which he licks, so beware of him. So whoever spends the night with [a smell] on his hand and something happens to him, then let him not blame anyone but himself."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib from this route. It has also been reported in a narration of Suhail bin Abi Salih, from his father, from Abu Hurairah, from the Prophet (ﷺ).

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Spend While One Has A Smell On His Hand
text:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever spends the night with [a smell] on his hand and something happens to him, then let him not blame anyone but himself."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib, we do not know of it as a narration of Al-'Amash except through this route.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Drinking Khamr
text:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Every intoxicant is Khamr, and every intoxicant is unlawful. Whoever drinks Khamr in this world, and dies continuing it, he will not drink it in the Hereafter.


He said: There are narrations on this topic from Abu Hurairah, Abu Sa'eed, 'Abdullah bin 'Amr, 'Ubadah, Abu Malik Al-Ash'ari, and Ibn 'Abbas.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Ibn 'Umar is a Hasan Sahih Hadith. It has been reported through other routes from Nafi', from Ibn 'Umar, from the Prophet (ﷺ). Malik bin Anas reported it from Nafi' from Ibn 'Umar in Mawquf - not Marfu' form.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Drinking Khamr
text:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever drinks Khamr, Salat is not accepted from him for forty days. If he repents, then Allah will accept his repentance. It he returns to it, then Allah will not accept his Salat for forty days. If he repents, then Allah will accept his repentance. If he returns to it, then Allah will not accepts his Salat for forty days.
If he repents, then Allah will accept his repentance. If he returns to it a fourth time, Allah will not accept his Salat for forty days, and if he were to repent, Allah would not accept his repentance, and he will be given to drink from the river of Al-Khabal." They said: "O Aby 'Abdur-Rahman! What is the river of Al-Khabal?" He said: "A river of the pus from the inhabitants of the Fire."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan. Similar to this has been reported from 'Abdullah bin 'Amr and Ibn 'Abbas from the Prophet (ﷺ).

chapter: What Has Been Related About: Every Intoxicant Is Unlawful
text:
That the Prophet (ﷺ) was asked about Bit' so he said: "All drinks that intoxicate are unlawful."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related About: Every Intoxicant Is Unlawful
text:
That the Prophet (ﷺ) "Every intoxicant is unlawful."


He said: There are narrations on this topic from 'Umar, 'Ali, Ibn Mas'ud, Anas, Abu Sa'eed, Abu Musa, Al-Ashajj, Al-Asri', Dailam, Maimunah, 'Aishah, Ibn 'Abbas, Qais bin Sa'd, An-Nu'man bin Bashir, Mu'awiyah, 'Abdullah bin Mughaffal, Umm Salamah, Buraidah, Abu Hurairah, Wa'il bin Hujr, and Qurrah Al-Muzani.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan. Similar was reported from Abu Salamah, from Abu Hurairah, from the Prophet (ﷺ). Both of these are Sahih. More than one narrator reported similarly from Muhammad bin 'Amr, from Abu Salamah, from Abu Hurairah, from the Prophet (ﷺ), and from Abu Salamah, from Ibn 'Umar, from the Prophet (ﷺ).

chapter: What Has Been Related About Whatever A Lot Of It Intoxicates, A Little Of It Is Unlawful
text:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whatever a lot of it intoxicates, a little of it is unlawful."


He said: There are narrations on this topic from Sa'd, 'Aishah, 'Abdullah bin 'Amr, Ibn 'Umar, and Khawwat bin Jubair.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib as a narration of Jabir.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Whatever A Lot Of It Intoxicates, A Little Of It Is Unlawful
text:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Every intoxicant is unlawful. Whatever a Faraq of it intoxicates, then a handful of it is unlawful."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] One of them said in his Hadith: "A sip of it is unlawful."


He said: This Hadith is Hasan. Al-Laith bin Abi Sulaim and Ar-Rabi' bin Sabih reported similar to the narration of Mahdi bin Maimun from Abu 'Uthman Al-Ansari. Abu 'Uthman Al-Ansari's (a narrator in this chain) name is 'Amr bin Salim, and they say: "Umar bin Salim" (as well).

chapter: What Has Been Related About Nabidh Prepared In Earthenware Containers
text:
From Tawus, that a man came to Ibn 'Umar and said: "Did the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibit Nabidh prepared in eartherware vessels?" He said: "Yes" So Tawus said: "I heard that from him, by Allah."


He said: There are narrations on this topic from Ibn Abu Awfa, Abu Sa'eed, Suwaid, 'Aishah, Ibn Az-Zubair, and Ibn 'Abbas.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Is Disliked To Prepare Nabidh In Ad-Dubba', An-Naqir, And An-Hantam
text:
"I asked Ibn 'Umar about what containers the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited. He informed us in your language, and he explained it to us in our language. He said: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited Al-Hantamah, and it is an earthenware container, and he prohibited Ad-Dubba', and it is gourd, and he prohibited An-Naqir, and it is the trunk of a date-palm that is hollowed out or carved, and he prohibited Al-Muzaffat, and it is coated with pitch. And he ordered that Nabidh be prepared in water-skins."


He said: There are narrations on this topic from 'Umar, 'Ali, Ibn 'Abbas, Abu Sa'eed, Abu Hurairah, 'Abdur-Rahman bin Ya'mur, Samurah, Anas, 'Aishah, 'Imran bin Husain, 'A'idh bin 'Amr, Al-Hakam Al-Ghifari, and Maimunah.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related Permitting That Nabidh Be Prepared Ibn Containers
text:
From his father, that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "I had indeed forbidden you from using containers, but the container does not make anything lawful nor unlawful, rather every intoxicant is unlawful." 


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related Permitting That Nabidh Be Prepared Ibn Containers
text:
"The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited using (certain) containers. So the Ansar complained about that to him. They said: 'We will have no vessels!' so he said: 'If so then use them.'"


He said: There are narrations on this topic from Ibn Mas'ud, Abu Hurairah, Abu Sa'eed, and 'Abdullah bin 'Amr.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Preparing Nabidh In A Water Skin
text:
"We would prepare Nabidh for the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) in a water-skin which was fastened at the top and it has a small hole. We would prepare Nabidh in it during the morning, and drink it during the evening. And we would prepare Nabidh in it during the evening and drink it during the morning."


He said: There are narrations on this topic from Jabir, Abu Sa'eed, and Ibn 'Abbas.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib, we do not know of it as a narration of Yunus bin 'Ubaid except through this route. This Hadith has also been reported through routes other than this from 'Aishah.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Grains (And Berries) From Which Khamr Is Derived
text:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Indeed Khamr comes from wheat, Khamr comes from barely, Khamr comes from dates, Khamr comes from rasins, and Khamr comes from honey."


He said: There are narrations on this topic from Abu Hurairah.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Grains (And Berries) From Which Khamr Is Derived
text: "Indeed Khamr comes from wheat." And he mentioned this Hadith.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Grains (And Berries) From Which Khamr Is Derived
text:
"Indeed Khamr comes from wheat."


[After mentioning this, he said:] and this is more correct than the narration of Ibrahim bin Muhajir (no. 1872). 'Ali bin Al-Madini said: "Yahya bin Sa'eed said: 'Ibrahim bin Al-Muhajir is not strong [in Hadith].'" And it has also been reported through other rotes from Ash-Sha'bi, from An-Nu'man bin Bashir.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Grains (And Berries) From Which Khamr Is Derived
text:
That he heard Abu Hurairah saying that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Khamr comes from these two trees (plants): The datepalm and the grape (vine)."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. Abu Kathir As-Suhaimi is Al-Ghubari, and his name is Yazid bin 'Abdur-Rahman bin Ghufailah and Shu'bah reported this Hadith from 'Ikrimah bin 'Ammar.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Mixing Unripe Dates And Dates
text:
"The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited making Nabidh from unripend dates and fresh dates together.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Mixing Unripe Dates And Dates
text:
"The Prophet (ﷺ) prohibited mixing of unripe dates and dates, and mixing of raisins and dates (for making Nabidh), and he prohibited the jars that Nabidh is made in."


He said: There are narrations on this topic from Anas, Jabir, Abu Qatadah, Ibn 'Abbas, Umm Salamah, and Ma'bad bin Ka'b from his mother.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Drink From Gold And Silver Vessels
text:
"I heard Ibn Abi Laila narrating that Hudhaifah asked for water, so someone brought him a vessel made from silver. He threw it, and said: 'I have indeed forbade him, but he refused to stop! Indeed the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited drinking from silver and gold vessels, and from wearing silk and Dibaj, and he (ﷺ) said: "If is for them in this world, and for you in the Hereafter."


He said: There are narrations on this topic from Umm Salamah, Al-Bara', and 'Aishah.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Prohibition Of Drinking While Standing
text:
From Anas: "The Prophet (ﷺ) prohibited that a man should drink while standing." (Qatadah said:) So it was said: "And eating ?" He (Anas) said: "That is worse."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Prohibition Of Drinking While Standing
text:
"We would eat during the time of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) while we were walking, and we would drink while we were standing."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih Gharib as a narration of 'Ubaidullah bin 'Umar, from Nafi', from Ibn 'Umar. 'Imran bin Hudair reported this Hadith from Abu Al-Bazari, from Ibn 'Umar. Abu Al-Bazari's name is Yazid bin 'Utarid.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Prohibition Of Drinking While Standing
text:
"The Prophet (ﷺ) prohibited drinking while standing."


And there are narrations on this topic from Abu Sa'eed, Abu Hurairah, and Anas. And this Hadith is Hasan Gharib. This Hadith was reported from other narrators, from Sa'eed, from Qatadah, from Abu Muslim, from Al-Jarud, that the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The Muslim's wandering (animal) stirs the Fire." Al-Jarud bin Al-Mu'alla is called Ibn Al-'Al' but what is correct is Al-Mu'alla.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Permission For Drinking While Standing
text:
"The Prophet (ﷺ) drank from Zamzam while he was standing."


He said: There are narrations on this topic from 'Ali, Sa'd, 'Abdullah bin 'Amr and 'Aishah.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Permission For Drinking While Standing
text:
From his father, from his grandfather who said: "I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) drinking while standing and sitting."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Breathing Into The Vessel
text:
That the Prophet (ﷺ) would breathe three times in the vessel and say: "It is more wholesome and thirst quenching."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib. Hisham Ad-Dastawa'i reported it from Abu 'Isam, from Anas.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Breathing Into The Vessel
text:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Let none of you drink all at once like the camel. But drink two or three times, mentioning Allah's Name when you drink, and praising Him when you (finish)."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib. Yazid bin Sinan Al-Jazari is Abu Farwah Ar-Ruhawi.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Drinking With Two Breaths
text:
"When the Prophet (ﷺ) drank, he would breathe two times."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib, we do not know of it except as a narration of Rishdin bin Kuraib.


He said: I asked [Abu Muhammad] 'Abdullah bin 'Abdur-Rahman about Rishdin bin Kuraib: "Is he stronger (in narration), or Muhammad bin Kuraib?" He said: "Neither are better to me. Rishdin bin Kuraib is preferred over them to me." He said: I asked Muhammad bin Isma'il about this, so he said: "Muhammad bin Kuraib is preferred over Rishdin bin Kuraib." To me, the correct view is what Abu Muhammad 'Abdullah bin 'Abdur-Rahman said: Rishdin bin Kuraib is more preferred and he is elder. He lived to see Ibn 'Abbas, and they are brothers, and they both have Munkar narrations in their reports."

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Blow Into The Drink
text:
That the Prophet (ﷺ) prohibited blowing into the drink. A man said: "What about if one sees something floating in the vessel?" He said: "Spill it out (removing that)." He said: "I can not drink in one breath." He said: "Then remove the cup away from your mouth."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Blow Into The Drink
text:
"The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited breathing in the vessel, or blowing into it."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Breath Into The Vessel
text:
From his father, that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "When one of you drinks, then do not breathe into the vessel."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The Prohibition Of Beding The Mouths Of Water-Skins
narrated:
'Ubaidullah bin 'Abdullah narrated a report (of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) from Abu Sa'eed, that he prohibited bending the mouths of the water-skins.


He said
text:
There are narrations on this topic from Jabir, Ibn 'Abbas, and Abu Hurairah.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related Permitting That
text:
From his father who said: "I saw the Prophet (ﷺ) standing at a hanging water-skin, so he bent it, then drank from it."


He said: There is something on this topic from Umm Salamah.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] The chain of this Hadith is not Sahih. 'Abdullah bin 'Umar Al-'Umari (a narrator in the chain) was graded weak due to his memory, and I do not know if he heard from 'Eisa or not.

chapter: What Has Been Related Permitting That
text:
From his grandmother Kabshah who said: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) entered upon me. He drank from a hanging water-skin while standing. So I went to its mouth and cut it off."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih Gharib. Yazid bin Yazid bin Jabir is the brother of 'Adbur-Rahman bin Yazid bin Jabir. He died earlier than him.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Those On The Right Have More Right To The Drink
text:
"The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was brought some milk which was mixed with some water. On his right was a Bedouin and on his left was Abu Bakr. So he drank, then he gave it to the Bedouin and said: 'The right, then the right.'"


He said: There are narrations on this topic from Ibn 'Abbas, Sahl  bin Sa'd, Ibn 'Umar, and 'Abdullah bin Busr.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related About The One Providing Water For People Is The Last Of Them To Drink
text:
That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The one providing water for people is the last of them to drink."


He said: There is something on this topic from Ibn Abi Awfa.


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Which Drink Was The Most Beloved To The Messenger Of Allah (saws)
text:
"The drink most beloved to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was the sweet, cool drink."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This was reported similarly by more than one narrator from Ibn 'Uyainah from Ma'mar, from Az-Zuhri, from 'Urwah from 'Aishah. What is correct what was reported by Az-Zuhri from the Prophet (ﷺ) in Mursal form.

chapter: What Has Been Related About Which Drink Was The Most Beloved To The Messenger Of Allah (saws)
text:
"The Prophet (ﷺ) was asked: 'Which drink is the best ?' He said: 'The sweet, cool drink."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This is how 'Abdur-Razzaq reported it from Ma'mar, from Az-Zuhri, from the Prophet (ﷺ) in Mursal form. This is more correct that the narration of Ibn 'Uyainah (no. 1895).

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Being Dutiful To Parents.
narrated: Bahz bin Hakim narrated from his father, from his grandfather who said
text:
"I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Who most deserves(my) reverence?' He said: 'Your mother.'" He said: "I said: 'Then who?' He said: 'Your mother.'"
He said: "I said: 'Then who?' He said: 'Your mother.'"
He said: "I said: 'Then who?' He said: 'Then your father, then the nearest relatives, then the nearest relatives.'"

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: Also About That
text:
"I asked the Messenger of Allah: 'O Messenger of Allah! Which is the most virtuous of deeds?' He said: 'Salat during its appropriate time.' I said: 'Then what, O Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'Being dutiful to one's parents.' 
I said: 'Then what, O Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'Jihad in the cause of Allah.'
Then the messenger of Allah was silent, and if I had asked him more, he would have told me more.'"

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been About The Virtue Of Pleasing One's Parents
text: the Prophet said: "The Lord's pleasure is in the parent's pleasure, and the Lord's anger is in the parent's anger."(Hasan).

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been About The Virtue Of Pleasing One's Parents
narrated: Abu 'Abdur-Rahman As-Sulami  narrated from Abu Ad Darda'.
text: He said that a man came and said : "I have a wife whom my mother has ordered me to divorce." So Abu Ad-Darda said: " I heard the Messenger of Allah saying: 'The father is the middle gate to Paradise. So if you wish, then neglect that door, or protect it.'"

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Disobeying Parents
narrated: 'Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Bakrah narrated from his father who said
text: " The messenger of Allah said: 'Shall I not tell you of the biggest of the major sins?' they said : 'Of course! O Messenger of Allah!' He said: 'To join partners with Allah, and disobeying one's parents.'"He said : " He sat up, and he had been reclining. He said: 'And false testimony, or false speech.' And the Messenger of Allah would not stop saying it until we said (to ourselves): 'I wish that he would stop.'"

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Disobeying Parents
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "It is among the greatest of sins that a man should curse his parents." They said: "O Messenger of Allah! Does a man curse his parents?" He said: "Yes. He verbally abuses the father of a man, who in turn, verbally abuses his father, and he (retaliates and) curses his mother , so he curses his mother."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What  Has Been Related About Honoring The Father's Friends
text: the Prophet said:  "Among the most dutiful of deeds is that a man nurture relations with the people his father was friends with."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: About Being Dutiful To The Maternal Aunt
text: the Prophet said: "The maternal aunt holds the same status as the mother."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Supplicating For One's Parents
narrated: Abu Harairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Three supplications are  accepted , there is no doubt in them (about them being accepted): The  supplication of the oppressed, the supplication of the traveler,  and the supplication of his father against his son."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Parent's Rights
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "A son could not  do enough for his father, unless he found him as a slave and purchased him to set him free."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Severing the Ties Of Kinship
text: " Abu[Ar-Raddad] Al-Laithi complained(of an illness). So 'Abdur-Rahman bin 'Awf  visited him. He said: 'The best of you, and the most apt to maintain good relations, as far as I know, is Abu Muhammad('Abdur-Rahman bin 'Awf). So 'Abdur-Rahman bin 'Awf' said: 'I heard the Messenger of Allah saying : "Allah, Most Blessed and Most High, said: 'I am Allah, and I am Ar-Rahman. I created the Rahim(womb), and named it after My Name. So whoever keeps good relations with it, I keep good relation with him, and whoever severs it, I am finished with him.'"

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Connecting The Ties Of Kinship
text: the Prophet said: "Merely maintaining the ties of kinship is not adequate. But connecting the ties of kinship is when his ties to the womb are severed and he connects it."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Connecting The Ties Of Kinship
narrated: Muhammad bin Jubair bin Mut'im narrated from his father, that
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "The one who severs ties will not enter Paradise." Ibn Abi 'Umar said: "Sufyan said: 'Meaning: Ties of the womb."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Love Of A Parent For His Child
text: 'a righteous woman, Khawlah bint Hakim said: "The Messenger of Allah came out during the middle of the day, while holding one of the sons of his daughter in his arms. He was saying: 'You are what makes them stingy, cowardly and ignorant. And you are but Raihanillah

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Being Merciful With The Children
text: "Al-Aqra' bin Habis saw the prophet kissing Al-Hasan"- Ibn Abi 'Umar (one of the narrators) said:"Al-Hasan and Al-Husain." So he said: 'I have ten children and I do not kiss any one of them.' So the Messenger of Allah said: 'Whoever shows no mercy, he will be shown no mercy."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Spending on Daughters And Sisters
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "There is no one who has three daughters, or three sisters, and he treats them well, except that he enters paradise."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Spending on Daughters And Sisters
text: Messenger of Allah said:"Whoever is tried with something from daughters, and he is patient with them, they will be a barrier from the Fire for him."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Spending on Daughters And Sisters
narrated: Abu Bakr bin 'Ubaidullah bin Anas bin Malik narrated [from Anas] that
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever raises two girls then I and he will enter Paradise like these two." And he indicated with his two fingers.

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Spending on Daughters And Sisters
text: "A woman came to me with two daughters. She was asking (for food) but I did not have anything with me except a date. So I gave it to her and she divided it between  her two daughters without eating any of it herself. Then she got up to leave, and the Prophet entered, and I informed him about her. So the Prophet said: " Whoever is tested something from these daughters (and he/she passes the test), they will be a screen for them from the Fire."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Spending on Daughters And Sisters
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever has three daughters, or three sisters, or two daughters, or two sisters and he keeps good company with them and fears Allah regarding them, then Paradise is for him.

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Being Merciful With The Orphan And Raising Him
text: the Prophet said: Whoever takes in an orphan among the Muslims to raise, to feed him and give him drink, Allah admits him into Paradise without a doubt, unless he has done a sin for which he is not forgiven."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Being Merciful With The Orphan And Raising Him
text: the Messenger of Allah said: " I and the sponsor of an orphan shall be in Paradise like these two."And he indicaed with his fingers, meaning his index and his middle finger

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Being Merciful With Boys
text: "An older man came to talk to the Prophet, and the people were hesitant to make room for him. The Prophet said: ;He is not one of us who does not have mercy on our young and does not respect our elders."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Being Merciful With Boys
narrated: Amr bin Shu'aib  narrated that his father, from his grandfather, who said that the Messenger of Allah said
text: 'He is not one of us who does not have mercy upon our young, nor knows the honor of our elders."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Being Merciful With Boys
narrated: Ibn Abbas narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: " He is not one of us who does not have mercy upon our young, respect our elders, and command good and forbid evil."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Being Merciful With People
narrated: Jarir bin Abdullah  narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Whoever does not show mercy to the people, Allah will not show mercy to him."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Being Merciful With People
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that Abul- Qasim said
text: "Mercy is  not removed  (from anyone) except from a wicked one."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Being Merciful With People
narrated: Abdullah bin 'Amr narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "The merciful are shown mercy by Ar-Rahman. Be merciful on the earth, and you will be shown mercy from Who is above the heavens. The womb is named after Ar-Rahman, so whoever connects it, Allah connects him, and whoever severs it, Allah severs him."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: (What Has Been Related) About An-Nasihah
text: " I pledged to the Prophet to establish the Salat, give the Zakat,  and to give sincere advice to every Muslim."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: (What Has Been Related) About An-Nasihah
text: the Messenger of Allah said: "The religion is An-Nasihah" three times. They said: "O Messenger of Allah! For Whom?" He said : "To Allah , His books, the A'immah of the Muslims, and their average people."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Muslim's Compassion For the Muslim
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text:
:
"The Muslim is the brother to the Muslim, he does not cheat him, lie to him, nor deceive him. All of the Muslim is unlawful to another Muslim: His Honor, his wealth, and his blood. At-taqwa is here. It is enough evil for a man that he belittle his brother Muslim."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Muslim's Compassion For the Muslim
narrated: Abu Musa Al-Ash'arf narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text:
:
The believer is to the believer like parts of a building, each one of them supporting the other."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Muslim's Compassion For the Muslim
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text:
:
"Indeed (each) one of you is the reflection of his brother. So if he sees something harmful in him, then let him remove it from him."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Covering(The Faults) Of The Muslims
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text:
:
"Whoever relieves a Muslim of a burden from the burdens of the world, Allah will relieve him of a burden from the burdens on the Day of Judgement. And whoever helps ease a difficulty in the world, Allah will grant him ease from a difficulty in the world and in the Hereafter. And whoever covers (the faults of) a Muslim, Allah will cover (his faults) for him in the world and the Hereafter. And Allah is engaged in helping the worshipper as long as the worshipper is engaged in helping his brother."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Defending (The Honor Of) The Muslim
narrated: Abu Ad-Darda narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Whoever protects his brother's honor, Allah protects his face from the Fire on the Day of Resurrection."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Shunning (The Muslim) Being Disliked
narrated: Abu Ayyub Al-Ansari narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text:
:
It is not lawful for the Muslim to shun his brother for more than three (days); they come fare to fare and this one turns away, and that one turns away. The best of them is the one who initiates the Salam."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Consoling The Brother
text:
:
"When 'Abdur-Rahman bin 'Awf arrived in Al-Madinah, the Messenger of Allah established a bond of brotherhood between him and sa'd bin Ar-Rabi. So he said to him: "Come here, I will divide my wealth and give you half, and I have two wives, I will divorce one of them, and when she completes her waiting period you may marry her." He said: " May Allah bless you in your family and your wealth. Show me where the market is." So they showed him where the market was and he did not return that day except with some cottage cheese and cooking fat which he had earned as a profit. The Messenger of Allah saw him after that, and he had traces of yellow on him. So he said to him: "What is this?" He said: "I married a woman from the Ansar." He said : " What dowry did you give her?" He said: " A date-stone(of gold) - ( one of the narrators) Humaid said: "Or he said: - gold equal to the weight of a date-stone." So he said: 'Have a banquet, even if with only a sheep."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Backbiting
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that it was said
text: " O  Messenger of Allah! What is backbiting?" He said : " Mentioning your brother with that which he does not like." He said " What if what I said about him is so?" He said: "If what you said about him is so, then you have backbitten him, and if it is not as you said, then you have slandered him."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Envy
narrated: Anas narrated that the  Messenger of Allah said
text: "Do not cut off one another, nor desert one another, nor hate one another, nor envy one another. Be you , O worshippers o Allah, brothers. It is not lawful for the Muslim to shun his brother for more than three(days)."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Envy
narrated: Salim narrated  from his father who said that the  Messenger of Allah said
text: "There is to be no envy except for two: A man to whom Allah grants wealth and he spends from it during the hours of the night and the hours of the day. And a man to whom Allah grants (memorization of) the Quran so he stands with it (in prayer) during the hours of the night and the hours of the day."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Hatred
narrated: Jabir   narrated that the  Messenger of Allah said
text: "Indeed Ash-Shaitan has despaired of getting those who perform Salat to worship him.But he is engaged in sowing hatred among them."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Rectifying  Manners
narrated: Umm Kulthum bint 'Uqbah narrated that the  Messenger of Allah said
text: "One who brings peace between people is not a liar, he says something good, or reports something good."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Rectifying  Manners
narrated: Asma bint Yazid  narrated that the  Messenger of Allah said
text: "it is not lawful to lie except in three cases: Something the man tells his wife to please her, to lie during war, and to lie in order to bring peace between the people."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Deception And Cheating
narrated: Abu Sirmah narrated that the  Messenger of Allah said
text: "Whoever causes harm, Allah harms him, and whoever is harsh, Allah will be harsh with him."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Deception And Cheating
narrated: Abu Bakr As-Siddiq narrated that the  Messenger of Allah said
text: "Cursed are those who harm a believer, or plot to do so."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Rights Of Neighbors
narrated: Aishah narrated that the  Messenger of Allah said
text: "Jibril - may the Salawat of Allah be upon him - continued to recommend me about (treating) the neighbors so (kindly and politely), that I thought he would order me to make them heirs."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Rights Of Neighbors
text: "Abdullah bin Amr had a sheep slaughtered for his family, so when he came he said: 'Have you given some to our neighbor, the Jew? Have you given some to our neighbor, the Jew? I heard the Messenger of Allah saying: 'Jibril continued to advise me about (treating) the neighbors so (kindly and politely), that I thought he would order me (from Allah) to make them heirs."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Rights Of Neighbors
narrated: Abdullah bin Amr  narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "The companion who is the best to Allah is the one who is best to his companion. And the neighbor that is the best to Allah is the one that is best to his neighbor."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Treating The Servant Well
narrated: Abu Dharr  narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Allah has made some of your brothers as slaves under your care. So whoever has his brother under his care, then let him feed him from his food, and let him clothe him from his clothes. And do not give him a duty that he cannot bear, and if you give him a duty he cannot bear, then assist him with it."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Treating The Servant Well
narrated: Abu Bakr As-Siddiq  narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "The one who treats his slaves badly will not enter paradise."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Beating And Abusing The Servant
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that Abul-Qasim, the Prophet of Repentance, said
text: "If somebody slanders his slave (by accusing him of committing illegal sexual intercourse) and the slave is innocent from what he says, Allah will impose the punishment upon him on the Day of Resurrection, unless it is as he said about him."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Beating And Abusing The Servant
text: "I was beating a slave of mine and I heard someone behind me saying: 'Beware O Abu Mas'ud! Beware O Abu Mas'ud!' So I turned around and saw that it was the Messenger of Allah. He said: 'Allah has more power over you than you do over him." Abu Mas'ud said: "I have not beaten any slave of mine since then."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Pardoning The Servant
text: "A man came to the Prophet and said: 'O Messenger of Allah! How many times should the servant be pardoned?' The Prophet was silent. Then he said: 'O Messenger of Allah! How many times should the servant be pardoned?' He said: ' Seventy times each day.'"

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Disciplining The Servant
narrated: Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri  narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "When one of you beats his servant then he (should) remember Allah and, withhold your hands."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Disciplining The Son
narrated: Jabir bin Sumurah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "That a man should discipline his son is better for him than to have given a Sa' in charity."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Disciplining The Son
narrated: Ayyub bin Musa narrated from his father, from his grandfather, that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "There is no gift that a father gives his son more virtuous than good manners."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Accepting Gifts And Reciprocating For Them
text: "The Prophet would accept gifts and he would give something in return."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Being Grateful To The One Who Was Kind To You
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Whoever is not grateful to the people, he is not grateful to Allah."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Being Grateful To The One Who Was Kind To You
narrated: Abu Sa'eed narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Whoever is not grateful to the people, he is not grateful to Allah."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Various Kinds Of Ma'ruf (Good Deeds)
narrated: Abu Dharr narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Your smiling in the face of your brother is charity, commanding good and forbidding evil is charity, your giving directions to a man lost in the land is charity for you. Your seeing for a man with bad sight is a charity for you, your removal of a rock, a thorn  or a bone from the road is charity for you. Your pouring what remains from your bucket into the bucket of your brother is charity for you."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Minhah (Giving A Gift)
narrated: Al-Bara bin Azib narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Whoever gives someone some milk or silver, or guides him through a strait, then he will have the reward similar to freeing a slave."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Removing Harm From The Road
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "When a man was walking on the road, he found a thorny branch and removed it. Allah appreciated his action by forgiving him."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Sittings Are To Be Held In Trust
narrated: Jabir bin Abdullah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "When a man narrates a narration, then he looks around, then it is a trust."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Generosity
text: " O the Messenger of Allah! I have nothing except what was given to me by (my husband) Az-Zubair, shall I give it (in charity)?'" It was said: "Do not hold (your wealth) so that Allah will hold against you."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Generosity
narrated: Abu  Hurairah  narrated that the Prophet said
text: "Generosity is close to Allah, close to Paradise, close to the people and far from the Fire. Stinginess is far from Allah, far from Paradise, far from the people and close to the Fire. The ignorant generous person, is more beloved to Allah than the worshiping stingy person."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Stinginess
narrated: Abu  Sa'eed Al-Khudri narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Two traits are not combined  in a believer: Stinginess and bad manners."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Stinginess
narrated: -Abu  Bakr As-Siddiq narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "The swindler, the stingy person, and the Mannan shall not enter Paradise."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Stinginess
narrated: Abu  Hurairah  narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "The believer is naively noble and the stingy person is deceitfully treacherous."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Spending On The Family
narrated: Abu  Mas'ud Al-Ansari narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "A man's spending on his family is charity."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Spending On The Family
narrated: Thawban narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "The most virtuous of the Dinar is the Dinar spent by a man on his dependants, and the Dinar spent by a man on his beast in the Cause of Allah, and the Dinar spent by a man on his companions in the Cause of Allah." Abu Qilabah (one of the narrators) said: " He began with the dependants." Then he said: "And which man is greater in reward than a man who spends upon his depandants, having little ones by which Allah causes him to abstain (from the unlawful) and by which Allah enriches him."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Hospitality And What Is The Limit Of Hospitality
text: "My eyes saw the Messenger of Allah, and my ears  heard him speaking when he was speaking and he said: 'Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, then let him honor his guest with his reward.' They said: 'What is the reward?' He said: ' A day and a night.' He said: 'And hospitality is for three days, whatever is beyond that is charity. And whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, then let him say what is good or keep silent."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Hospitality And What Is The Limit Of Hospitality
narrated: Abu  Shuraih Al-Kabi narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text:
:
"Hospitality is for three days, and his reward is a day and a night, and whatever is spent on him after that is charity. And it is not lawful for him (the guest) to stay so long as to cause him harm."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Looking After The Widow And The Orphan
narrated: Safwan bin Sulaim narrated that the Prophet said
text: "The one who looks after a widow and a poor person is like the Mujahid in the cause of Allah, or like the one who fasts all the day and stands (in prayer) all the night."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About A Smiling And Cheerful Face
narrated: Jabir bin Abdullah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Every good is charity. Indeed among the good is to meet your brother with a smiling face, and to pour what is left in your bucket into the vessel of your brother."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Truthfulness And Falsehood
narrated: Abdullah bin Mas'ud narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Abide by truthfulness. For indeed truthfulness leads to righteousness. And indeed righteousness leads to Paradise. A man continues telling the truth and trying hard to tell the truth until he is recorded with Allah as a truthful person. Refrain from falsehood. For indeed falsehood leads to wickedness, and wickedness leads to the Fire. A slave (of Allah) continues lying and trying hard to lie, until he is recorded with Allah as a liar."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Truthfulness And Falsehood
narrated: Ibn 'Umar narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "When the slave (of Allah) lies, the angel goes a mile away from him because of the stench of what he has done."Yahya said: "(I asked) 'Abdur-Rahim bin Harun if he approved of it,and he said 'Yes'."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Truthfulness And Falsehood
text: "There was no behavior more hated to the Messenger of Allah than lying. A man would lie in narrating something in the presence of the Prophet, and he would not be content until he knew that he had repented."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Al-Fuhsh(Obscenity) [And At-Tafahhush(Uttering Obscenities)]
narrated: Anas narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Al-Fuhsh is not present in anything but it mars it, and Al-Haya' is not present in anything but it beautifies it."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Al-Fuhsh(Obscenity) [And At-Tafahhush(Uttering Obscenities)]
narrated: 'Abdullah bin 'Amr said; "The Messenger of Allah said
text: "The best of you are those best in conduct.' And the Prophet was not one who was obscene, nor one who uttered obscenities."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Curse
narrated: 'Samurah bin Jundab narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Do not curse yourselves with Allah's curse, nor with His anger, nor with the Fire."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Curse
narrated: 'Abdullah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "The believer does not insult the honor of others, nor curse, nor commit Fahishah, nor is he foul."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Curse
narrated: 'Ibn 'Abbas narrated that a man cursed the wind in the presence of the Prophet, so he said
text: "Do not curse the wind, for it is merely doing as ordered , and whoever curses something undeservingly, then the curse returns upon him."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Learning About Lineage
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Learn enough about your lineage to facilitate keeping your ties of kinship. For indeed keeping the ties of kinship encourages affection among the relatives, increases the wealth, and increases the lifespan."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About A Brother Supplicating For His Brother In His Absence
narrated: 'Abudullah bin 'Amr narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "No supplication is more readily responded to, than the supplication made for someone who is absent."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Vilification
narrated: 'Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "(The burden of) what is said by the two who vilify each other is upon the one who initiated it, as long as the one who was wronged does not transgress."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Vilification
narrated: ' Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Do not vilify the dead (and) by that harm the living."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Verbally Abusing The Muslim Is Disobedience, And Fighting Him Is Disbelief
narrated: 'Abdullah bin Mas'ud narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Verbally abusing the Muslim is disobedience and fighting him is disbelief." Zubaid said:"I said to Abu Wa'il: 'Did you hear it from 'Abdullah?' He said: 'Yes.'"

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Saying What Is Good
narrated: 'Ali narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Indeed in Paradise there are chambers, whose outside can be seen from their inside, and their inside can be seen from their outside." A Bedouin stood and said : 'Who are they for, O Messenger of Allah?" He said: "For those who speak well, feed others, fast regularly, and perform salat [for Allah] during the night while the people sleep."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of The Righteous Slave
narrated: 'Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "How wonderful it is for one of them that he obeys Allah and fulfills the rights of his master." Meaning the slave. And Ka'b said: "Allah and His Messenger spoke the truth."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of The Righteous Slave
narrated: Ibn 'Umar narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "There shall be upon dunes of musk- I think he said: On the Day of Judgment- a slave who fulfills Allah's right and the right of his patron (master), a man who leads a people (in prayer)) and they are pleased with him. And a man who calls for the five prayers during every day and night."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Having Amicable Relations With People
text:
"The Messenger of Allah said to me:
'Have Taqwa of Allah wherever you are, and follow an evil deed with a good one to wipe it out, and treat the people with good behavior."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Bad Suspicion
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Beware of Zann (suspicion), for indeed Zann is the falsest of speech."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Joking
text:
"
The Messenger of Allah used to mingle with us such that he said to my younger brother: 'O Abu 'Umair! What did the Nughair do?'"

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Joking
text: "They said: 'O Messenger of Allah! You joke with us?' He said: 'Indeed I do not say except what is true.'" (Hasan)'

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Joking
text: "A man sought a mount from the Messenger of Allah who said: 'Indeed, I will let you ride on a she-camel's child.' So he said: 'O Messenger of Allah! What can ashe-camel's child do?' So the Messenger of Allah said: 'Are camels borne from other than she-camels?'"

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Joking
narrated: Anas bin Malik narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "O possessor of two ears!" Mahmud said: "Abu Usamah said: 'He only meant it as a joke.'"

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Arguing
narrated: Anas bin Malik narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Whoever avoids lying while he is doing so falsely, a house will be built for him on the skirts of Paradise. Whoever avoids arguing while he is in the right, a house will be built for him in its midst. And whoever has good character, a house will be built for him in its heights."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Arguing
narrated: Ibn Abbas narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "It is enough sin for you that you never stop disputing."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Arguing
narrated: Ibn Abbas narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Do not argue with your brother, do not joke with him, and do not make a promise, only to not fulfill it."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Being Polite
text:
"A man sought permission to enter upon the Messenger of Allah while I was with him, so he said:
'What an evil son of his tribe, or brother of his tribe.' Then he admitted him and spoke with him. When he left, I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! You said what you said about him. Then you talked politely with him?' He said: 'O 'Aishah! Indeed among the evilest of people are those whom the people avoid, or who the people leave, fearing his filthy speech.'"

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related Concerning Being Moderate In Loving And Hating
narrated: Muhammad bin Sirin narrated from Abu Hurairah - and I think he (narrated it from the Prophet) who said
text: "Love your beloved moderately, perhaps he becomes hated to you someday. And hate whom you hate moderately, perhaps he becomes your beloved someday."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Arrogance
narrated: Abdullah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Whoever has a mustard seed's weight of pride (arrogance) in his heart, shall not be admitted into Paradise. And whoever has a mustard seed's weight of faith in his heart, shall not be admitted into the Fire."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Arrogance
text:
"The Messenger of Allah said:
'Whoever has a speck of pride (arrogance) in his heart, shall not be admitted into Paradise. And whoever has a speck of faith in his heart, shall not be admitted in to the Fire.'" He said: "So a man said to him: 'I like for my clothes to be nice, and my sandals to be nice?' So he said: 'Indeed Allah loves beauty. But pride is refusing the truth and belittling the people.'"

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Arrogance
narrated: Iylas bin Salamah bin Al-Akwa' narrated from his father that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "A man shall remain exalting himself until he is written among the tyrants, so that he suffers from their afflictions."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Arrogance
narrated: Jubair bin Mut'im narrated from his father who said
text:
"They (meaning the people in general) told me that I was proud, while I rode a donkey, wore a cloak, and I milked the sheep. And the Messenger of Allah said to me:
"Whoever does these, then there is no pride (arrogance) in him.'"

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Good Character
narrated: Abu Ad-Dardh narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Nothing is heavier on the believer's Scale on the Day of Judgment than good character. For indeed Allah, Most High, is angered by the shameless obscene person."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Good Character
narrated: Abu Ad-Dardh narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Nothing is placed on the Scale that is heavier than good character. Indeed the person with good character will have attained the rank of the person of fasting and prayer."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Good Character
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah was asked about that for which people are admitted into Paradise the most, so he said
text: "Taqwa of Allah, and good character." And  he was asked about that for which people are admitted into the Fire the most, and he said: " The mouth and the private parts."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Good Character
text: 'Abdullah bin Al-Mubarak explained good character, and then he said: "It is a smiling face, doing one's best in good, and refraining from harm."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Beneficence And Pardoning
narrated: Abu Al-Ahwas narrated from his father who said
text: "I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I stayed with a man who did not entertain me nor behave hospitably with me. Then he came to stay with me, shall I reciprocate the same to him?' He (ﷺ) said: 'No, entertain him." He said: 'He (ﷺ) saw me wearing tattered clothes and said:'(Do you have any wealth?' I said: 'Allah has given me various kinds of wealth through camels and goats.' He said: 'Then let it be seen on you.'"

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Beneficence And Pardoning
narrated: Hudhaifah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Do not be a people without a will of your own, saying: 'If people treat us well, we will treat them well; and if they do wrong, we will do wrong,' but accustom yourselves to do good if people do good, and do not behave unjustly if they do evil."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Visiting Brothers
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Whoever visits the sick, or visits his brother in Allah (faith), a caller calls out: 'May you have goodness and livelihood be good, and may you dwell in an adobe in Paradise.'"

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Al-Haya
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Al-Haya is from faith, and faith is in Paradise. Obscenity is from rudeness, and rudeness is in the Fire."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Calmness And Haste
narrated: Abdullah bin Sarjis Al-Muzam narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Taking the good route is a part of the twenty-four parts of Prophethood."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Calmness And Haste
narrated: Ibn 'Abbas narrated that the Messenger of Allah said to the Ashajj 'Abdul-Qais
text: "Indeed there are two traits in you that Allah loves: Forbearance, and deliberateness."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Calmness And Haste
narrated: Abdullah-Muhaimin bin 'Abbas bin Sahl bin Sa'd As-Saidi narrated from his father, from his grandfather, who said that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Deliberateness is from Allah, and haste is from the Ash-shaitan."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Gentleness
narrated: Abu Ad-Darda narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Whoever was given his share of gentleness, then he has been given a share of good. And whoever has been prevented from his share of gentleness, then he has been prevented from his share of good."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Supplication Of The Oppressed
text:
"The Messenger of Allah sent Mu'adh [bin Jabal] to Yemen, and said:
'Beware of the supplication of the oppressed; for indeed there is no barrier between it and Allah.'"

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Character Of The Prophet
text:
that
"I served the Prophet for ten years. He never said Uff and never blamed me by saying: 'Why did you do so' or why did you not do so?' And the Messenger Of Allah had the best character among all of the people. I never touched Khazz nor silk, nor anything softer than the hand of the Messenger of Allah, nor have I smelled musk, or a fragrance sweeter than the sweat of the Messenger of Allah

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Character Of The Prophet
text: "I asked 'Aishah about the character of the Messenger of Allah. She said: 'He was not obscene, nor uttering obscenities, nor screaming in the markets, he would not return an evil with an evil, but rather he was pardoning and forgiving."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Keeping Consistent Relations
text: "I was not jealous of any wife of the Prophet as I was jealous of Khadijah, and it was not because I saw her. It was only because the Messenger of Allah mentioned her so much, and because whenever he would slaughter a sheep, he would look for Khadijah's friends to gift them some of it."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Most Excellent Character
narrated: Jabir narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Indeed the most beloved among you to me, and the nearest to sit with me on the Day of Judgment is the best of you in character. And indeed, the most disliked among you to me, and the one sitting furthest from me on the Day of Judgement are the Thartharun, and the Mutashaddiqun and the Muthafaihiqun." They said: "O Messenger of Allah! We know about the Thartharun, and the Mutashaddiqun, but what about the Muthafaihiqun?"' He said:"The arrogant."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Curse And Insulting One's Honor
narrated: Ibn 'Umar narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "The believer is not one who curses others."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Too Much Anger
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that a man came to the Messenger of Allah and said
text: "Teach me something that is not too much for me so that, perhaps, I may abide by it." He (S.A.W) said: "Do not get angry." He repeated that (the request) a number of times, each time he replied: 'Do not get angry."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Suppressing One's Rage
narrated: Sahl bim Mu'adh bin Anas Al-Juhani narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "Whoever suppresses his rage while he is able to unleash it, Allah will call him before the heads (leaders) of creation on the Day of Judgement, so that he can inform Him of which of the Hur he would like."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About Honoring the Elder
narrated: Anas bin Malik narrated that the Messenger of Allah said
text: "No young person honors an elder due to his age, except that Allah appoints for him one who will honor him at that age."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Two Who Shun Each Other
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah (s.A.W) said
text: "The gates of Paradise are opened on Monday and Thursday. In them, (will enter) whoever has not associated anything with Allah will be forgiven, except for the two who shun each other, (about whom) it is said: 'Return these two until they make amends."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Patience
text: "Some persons from the Ansar asked for (something) from the Messenger of Allah (s.a.w) and he gave them. They again asked him for (something), and he gave them. Then he said: 'whatever of good that I have, I would never hoard it from any of you. (Remember) whoever abstains from asking others, Allah will make him content, and whoever tries to make due, Allah will suffice him. And whoever remains patient, Allah will make him patient. Nobody can be given a blessing better and more encompassing than patience."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
chapter: What Has Been Related About The Two Faces Person
narrated: Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah (s.a.w) said
text: "Indeed among the worst of people to Allah, on the Day of Judgment, is the two faced person."

book: Chapters on Righteousness And Maintaining Good Relations With Relatives
